name: Ken Klispie
text: Excellent service! The team at Guthrie's did a thorough inspection of our new/used minivan after it started making various intermittent sounds from a long cross country drive. They were able to pinpoint several issues that were small but would have left us stranded on our next big trip. Quick, very reasonable and communicative through the repairs. We did our next long trip without any issues or noises. We know where we will be taking all of our cars for service, thank you!

resp.text: Thank you, Ken for the review. We appreciate your business. We are happy to help with your automotive needs. Welcome to Alabama!!!

name: Steven Richardson
text: We were traveling through Alabama and my pickup broke down right off the 310 Cullom exit. The tow truck driver recommended Guthrie.  We were nervous not knowing anyone but were pleasantly surprised. We received text updates and a phone call to explain what needed to be done.  They exceeded our expectation completing the job quickly and at a fair price. Highly recommend their auto shop. God Bless.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Steven. We appreciate your kind words. We always try to get people back on the road. I know what it is like to be broken down on the road. Especially if you are on a schedule. Thank you so much for choosing Guthrie's Auto Service.

name: Michael Blair
text: Our car started experiencing some pretty severe issues on our drive home to Tennessee from Florida. We genuinely could not have chosen a better exit to pull over at! We pulled Guthrie's Auto up on our Maps and decided to take our car over there. Despite how busy they were, they were very understanding that we were from out of town and immediately got to work on our vehicle and offered recommendations on places to eat around since we had to wait several hours! Absolutely awesome service!

resp.text: We appreciate your words, and the 5 stars. We strive to give everyone a 5 star experience and help them along their way. Thanks again. Terry Guthrie

name: Victor Cornell
text: I've taken my cars there several times and always got good professional service which was reasonably priced.

resp.text: Thank you Victor, we appreciate your business. Terry

name: teresa cobbs
text: Great people. Keep you updated on progress and prices. Very trustworthy.

resp.text: Thank you Teresa, we appreciate your business and kind words. Terry

name: Barbara
text:
A Great Place/Great People... Our truck broke down & Triple A couldn’t have found a better place to take it to! They took us to our hotel & picked us back up....The owner went above & beyond to get our truck fixed so we could be back on the road this morning! Truck is running great again! Thank You So much for not only getting our truck fixed but for your kind & thoughtfulness.
Rick, Barbara & LACI

resp.text: It was a pleasure to meet you two. I was happy to help you all with your F-250 diesel. Glad you were able to get back on the road any get out of the flooding that we had that day. We were safe but got a lot of rain that day. Thanks again for letting us to serve you.

name: Janice McGahey
text: They got my car fixed in no time flat. The cost was super reasonable. And it’s been several weeks everything is running perfectly. I would highly recommend Terry and his crew!!

resp.text: Janice, thank you for your review! We're glad we could provide a quality auto repair service for you and we'll see you soon!

name: La Donna Griffin
text: I received very good service, both times I brought my car to Guthrie's.  Very nice employees., and patient with the questions I ask.  I'll be back.  I've recommended Guthrie's to a few people.

resp.text: Thank you La Donna for the 4 stars. We hoped to give you a 5 star experience when we serviced your Kia. Maybe next time. We do appreciate you trusting us with your vehicle. Terry Guthrie

name: Page Sparks
text: A couple years ago my car was really in a bad way, and took it to the dealership. They were going to charge me $1500 for my repair. I despaired and reached out to friends and family for recommendations. A good friend recommended Guthrie's, said they always did good work. So I called them up. For the same repair they were going to have to charge close to $900. It was better but still hurt. Took my car up and waited. Got a call from Mike and he said that he wanted to check over the car before I spent all that money. He discovered what the dealership didn't, that something was just unplugged. Only charged the diagnostic fee! He could have charged me fully, but he and this business have been ethical. I take my car to them anytime I have issues, and they've been precise and sure every time. Would highly recommend for anyone who's been burned by bad mechanics.

resp.text: Page, thank you for your review. We were happy to have been able to help you out with your vehicle and to save you money. We appreciate having you as a customer and we look forward to seeing you next time!

name: Hustle Hard Fitness
text: Very caring and reliable crew Terry and them have always took care of our car needs and always does a fantastic job! Great prices and they get it done it a timely manner

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review! We'll continue to provide a caring and reliable atmosphere for your auto repair needs and we look forward to helping you in the future!

name: Felicia Wright
text: Took my vehicle to have my AC looked at. They were very friendly and knowledgeable. Seemed to want to help me more than just make a dollar. They have a text system set up that notifies you when your vehicle is being worked on. The owner follows up with you a day or so after you pick up your vehicle to be sure everything is going well. Very personable business.

resp.text: Felicia, thank you for your review! We're happy to have looked at your A/C and we'll continue to be friendly and knowledgeable.

name: John Thomas
text: Broke down while traveling. They was very helpful and willing to get our truck repaired at very reasonable rates. I highly recommend Guthrie's Auto Service.

resp.text: John, thank you for your review, we hope you had safe traveling after visiting our auto repair shop, and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you!

name: Bettie Burnett
text: Had car towed to Guthrie's for repair on coolant system. Had been told by two regular customers that they do really good work. The office attendant (Mike, I think was his name), was straight-forward, respectful, patient, gave me a phone quote, had the work done timely, with the final bill ending up being a little less than the original quote, even after adding the tow bill & taxes. It was a very welcomed change from the experience I'd had at another local shop I'd been referred to (but later warned about from several other past customers) where I repeatedly had to endure rudeness from the know-it-all mechanic, immediate breakdowns from same issue I'd just paid to have repaired, & ignored voicemails asking to speak to the owner. Guthrie's owner followed-up the very next day to make sure everything was going well with the work on my car. I would much rather pay for a job well done the first time than a little less and keep breaking down, having my car towed, finding another way to work at the last minute to keep my job, and then constantly being talked down to in person & over the phone (while the owner justifies it as him "being from New York",... to which I reminded them both that he's now n ALABAMA, & that cocky attitude won't do here, especially with me!!... 3 different types of repairs... never fixed after being told they were!). So, yes, I am very happy to give Guthrie's a positive review, THANK YOU!

resp.text: Bettie, thank you for your review. We were happy to help out with your coolant system repair and we are glad to be respectful, honest, and patient for all of our customers. We are sorry you had a bad experience at a different shop, but thank you for trusting us to get the job done. See you later!

name: Randy Anderson
text: Took my '08 Tundra in for some pretty major repairs (stuck secondary air intake valve, timing belt replacement, pulley repair). I’m beyond pleased with the quality of the work, the affordable price, and the speed of service you guys gave me. I’m new to the area, and will be coming back to you guys for any vehicle work that I need, and I’ll make sure to tell everyone else I meet about you as well! Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Randy! We're glad we could help you out with your '08 Tundra repairs, and we'll continue to offer quality and affordable auto repair services, and we are excited to have you as our customer. See you next time!

name: hotrodford 88
text: Great people to deal with.

name: Jeffrey Stevens
text: They were AAA approved brought truck in for water pump replacement they repaired it in a timely manner and did a over all inspection people were very friendly

resp.text: Jeffrey, thank you for your leaving us a review. We're glad to have helped you out and let us know if there anything we can do for you!

name: Cheryl Masterson
text: I was traveling thru Cullman car wouldn't start.  They repaired it same day. What a blessing, excellent service.

resp.text: Cheryl, we're so glad we could help you out while you were traveling through Cullman. Thank you for trusting us with your auto repair needs!

name: Mark Maddox
text: My truck needed help. I planned on it being in the shop for 7 to 10 days. I dropped it off on a Monday afternoon, and received a call on Friday afternoon that it was ready. Never did I think anyone could repair or replace as many things as Guthrie's did in such a short time. I left Guthrie's and drove to Gulf Shores. The true test, interstate highway's in Alabama. They did a great job. No vibration, shaking, or leaking. Awesome job guys. Thanks.

resp.text: Mark, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Here at Guthrie's Auto Service, we understand how important your vehicle is to you. That is why we always strive to provide quality care in a timely manner. It was a pleasure to work on your truck and we're thrilled to hear that your drive to Gulf Shores was smooth. We look forward to your next visit!

name: Jason Bookout
text: We were from out of town and our car broke down late on a Friday afternoon. Terry the owner fixed our busted coolant hose and had us back on the road in less than 2 hours for a fair price. He did not take advantage of a situation where we had no other choice.  I have later heard from other friends in the area that Terry does great work. Would highly recommend if you are in the area.

resp.text: Jason, we appreciate your kind review and were happy to assist with your coolant hose. We understand how frustrating it can be to deal with vehicle issues when you are out of town, so we were glad we could fix it quickly so you can be on your way. Thank you and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you in the future!

name: tanya roberson
text: Very courteous, professional, high quality service! They solved our overheating issue and fixed it Fast! Highly recommend!! Best auto service in Cullman!!

resp.text: Tanya, thank you for your review! We're excited to continue to be courteous, professional, and provide high quality service! Looking forward to seeing you next time!

name: Xochitl Robinson
text: Terry was very helpful and pleasant.I went there to have an stimate on a problem that I have in my SUV. The place is very clean.prices are reasonable. Thanks Terry.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We appreciate your support of our auto repair shop!

name: Justin Nichols
text: Needed help tracking a power draw draining my battery, they found it and got everything sorted very quickly. I was very pleased with the service and I will absolutely use them for future repairs.

resp.text: Justin, thank you for your review! We're glad we could be here to help with your battery, and we'll look forward to seeing you next time in our auto repair shop!

name: Douglas Ballenger
text:
I was really surprised by the service and friendliness of Guthries auto service, after I spent 2 weeks working on my vehicle with no luck finding the problem I decided to find a shop to work on it. A friend of mine recommended Guthries. Some of problems I was having with my vehicle was, lost power to all of my windows, lost power to my rear view mirror and backup camera, blown bulb in taillights, short causing battery to drain, could not turn ignition switch All the way off so I couldn’t get key out 🤔😂 but the power door lock still worked!!
But don’t lock them if you have something draining your battery ! 🙃 Seriously Guthries will be my go to from now on ! Very friendly service, very knowledgeable and very fair service pricing!! I’m not going to say what my vehicle problem was ask Mike when you take your vehicle 🚗 in.

To all at Guthries auto service,

Thank you 🙏

resp.text: Douglas, we appreciate your kind review. We were more than happy to help you out of a tricky situation with your vehicle, and we'll continue to be friendly, knowledgeable, and fair-priced for your future visits. Thank you and we'll see you again!

name: Marie Lindsey
text: Great service and repairs. Called me as they found issues and got my approval before all repairs. Even checked with me the next day to make sure everything was working. I will take my other vehicles there for any service or repairs. Very satisfied customer!

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback, Marie! Our goal is to provide quality repairs to all of our customers along with excellent communication to keep our customers in the loop. We look forward to working with you again in the future.

name: Emily Taylor
text: I've used this shop for a number of repairs on my older vehicle now. Their prices are fair, the staff are all friendly and knowledgeable, and they are very expedient! I never have to wait long when I call, they're usually able to schedule my repair for the same week, and they always complete my repair in less time than expected.  They also send valuable customer loyalty coupons!

resp.text: Emily, we are glad to have you as a customer in our shop. We will continue to offer fair prices, friendly and quality service, and timely. We look forward to your next visit to our shop!

name: Gregg Loney
text: Long story as short as possible! I’m driving from Orlando to Las Vegas with a car load and 3 pets. I drove in with my car acting up and they went right to work. They kept me updated with the progress and about 2 days later I had my car back in perfect working ordering! I have no idea what this kind of work is worth with parts and labor but having peace of mind is worth it all.

resp.text: Gregg, we are so happy that we were able to get you back on the road quickly in a vehicle that will get you to your destination! Providing our great customers the peace of mind to travel cross-country is so important to us!

text: I called and scheduled an appointment on a Wednesday for a that Friday.  I had never been in before as I haven’t lived in Cullman long. My car was ready before they got there. (A/C leak). Two days later I get a text from the manager following up to make sure I was satisfied and to make sure the A/C was working properly. That alone will have me going back when I need service again.

resp.text: Chris, we are glad that you had such a positive experience at our shop for your A/C leak. We do our best to be quick and thorough for our customers because you guys are our priority. Thank you for your review and we're happy that we have gained a new customer!

text: Everyone is so nice & helpful. They charge very reasonable rates and do quality work.  They inspected a Volvo i recently purchased and have given me nothing but top notch service and treatment.  Even giving me a ride home.. I definitely will be a returning customer and highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thanks for the recommendation! We appreciate and value all of our customers, when we receive feedback like this it fuels us to keep working hard every day! Thank you!

text: Terry and his crew were absolute life-savers.  We were traveling down through town when our alternator went out. Thanks Terry and crew!

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback, Tyler! We look forward to working with you in the future! Having customers like you is what fuels us on a day-to-day basis to be our best!

text: This place is AWESOME. I appreciate everything Terry did for me and my truck when it died on a Friday afternoon at closing time. My wife and I were 4 hours from Home and stranded. They charged my mom nearly $30 for a $0.50 headlight bulb and then had the nerve to charge her another $78 to replace the bulb. Don't use them unless you want to be conned .

Update: They obviously can't read either. It was my mom that they overcharged, not me.

resp.text:
Jared,

Customer service and honesty are what we take the most pride in here at Guthrie's Auto Service. Unfortunately, we are unable to find anybody in our system by the name of Jared Lumpkin. If you could reach out to us at your earliest convenience, we would love to hear more about your experience and how what we can address your concerns and make it right by you. (256) 739-1690

Thank you.

name: Covenant Wildlife
text: Decided to give this new location a shot with one of my companies trucks that needed tires. After they installed the tires I left and within 30 min the TPS light came on. The technician never calibrated the sensors. I called the store and told them what happened and the guy said to bring it back by and I told him that it would have to be tomorrow as I had a full route planned and did not expect it to take over 2 hours to just install 4 tires and that I was late for my customers. I asked if I could bring it by in the am and he said that was fine that the tech would calibrate the sensors and that it would only take a min to do. I show up this am  (after clearing some time on my calendar) and I tell the guy who I am and what I am there for and he informs me that they have no mechanic available to do this and that I would have a pretty long wait. I tell him that if the tech did his job correctly, I would not even have to be here a second time. He just says sorry. So I make an appointment for Tuesday to come back a tired time for something the tech should have done right in the beginning. I will take my fleet plus my personal cars elsewhere. Probably go right next door to Christian Brothers.

name: Craig Winn
text: Love the Firestone auto care locations. One of the service reps from the Pelham location is moving here. Great guy and lots of help. Looking forward to this addition in our neighborhood.

name: Richard Thompson
text:
Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere.
I spent 10 minutes on the phone the day before letting the guy know that I was in search of a car mechanic I could trust to tell me what NEEDS to be fixed on my car, not what makes them the most money.  He assured me they would take care of me and he completely understood and that I could trust them.  The next day, after bringing my car in, it was clear they were trying to upsell with strong recommendations for everything from new tires (still have 5k-10k of tread) to all new brakes and rotors for the whole car to the $130 "fuel treatment system", to a NEW SUSPENSION FOR MY CAR.  Yes, they tried to recommend I buy a new suspension system.

I will never go there again and will go find a different mechanic I can trust.

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text: Fast and friendly service! I had something stuck in my tire and I only had to wait about 30 minutes for them to repair it and get it back on my van. I will definitely be back!

name: Richard Gayheart
text: My initial experience was pleasant and we discussed what was necessary to fix the truck. I needed to order a specialty part to finish the work. When I brought the part in, there was a different person running the front. At that point, things went downhill. Now I needed several new parts. The person was condescending and spoke to me like I didn’t have a clue. After I explained I had cleared the repairs with the first person and we had emailed the parts needed, this new person demanded to see the email. I retrieved the email and the reply was ‘wow, that was an expensive part’ and told me I needed more parts. I left the store because further conversation was not going to improve the situation. The next day I called the store and spoke with the original front person. My issues were resolved and the truck was fixed, but I will not return based on the second person I interacted with.

name: Tim Hedderly
text: Employees are friendly and personable.  I live in Helena, but will (am) traveling to the 280 location for this service.

name: Brent Curtin
text: I'm a little disappointed.  i went in to see if they could patch my tire.  its run flat so they said they couldn't.  said i need to buy a new tire.  that's ok.  was told that at other locations.  but then he told me that i need 2 new tires on the back as well.  my car is brand new and has 18,000 miles on it and i know tires can go bad at 18,000 miles, unlikely, but can happen.  that was a real turn off trying to sell something not needed.  when i used to go to another of their locations in mobile, the girls and guys down there had me running on slicks before they tried to sell me a tire.  they made sure i didnt buy tires until i really needed them and they had my loyalty.  trying to rip people off isnt a way to get return customers especially when they are putting competition right across the street from you.  just my opinion.

name: Ju Mc
text: This location was led by Wendell and was heads and shoulders better than the service I received at my previously chosen location. I'll definitely be back soon... even if I have to go 30 mins out of my way to get there.

resp.text: Thank you for your positive review, Jason. We look forward to seeing you for your next service.

text: Best and most trusted place to get your car fixed in all of Tuscaloosa!!! The people who work here are the definition of southern hospitality. I've never had such an enjoyable experience while getting my car fixed (I got to hang out with the sweetest dog in the waiting room). They walked me through what they were doing with my car and made me feel informed. They even fixed something small for free because they noticed it. Can't recommend them enough!

text: I enjoy them changing my oil

resp.text: Getting you back on the road is important to us. Thank you for your review!

name: Zac Petro
text: I come here for all my repair needs. The place is run by 2 brothers who have decades of experience. They are extremely honest and always work to get you the best price for what you need. They won’t recommend additional work just to make an extra buck. You can’t go wrong!

name: Jessie Hartley
text: The gentleman that help me was very kind.  he checked the brakes on a car and saw that I did not need new brakes and he was not trying to sell me something I did not need. I Highly Recommend going here...

name: Vance Olmstead
text: Although Midas is a national company this one has a mom and pop type vibe to it. they're extremely honest (which is surprising considering the business), and super professional. Today's visit had me going in and checking why my brakes are constantly squeeling. They took a look at it, and told me they were fine. They didn't try to replace something that wasn't broken, nor did they try to find something else wrong with my car. No charge and on my way within about 30 minutes. Highly recommend them!

name: Ben Carlson
text: The brothers who own the Tuscaloosa Midas, as well as the other employees, were very genuine and helpful throughout the whole process. They took the time to explain the problems I was having with the rear shocks on my car, as well as showed me how worn the shocks were. I would recommend the honest service of this shop to anyone who is deciding where to get car work done.

name: MultiplesOfNico
text:
Pretty much got scolded going here. Due to an issue that really wasn’t taken seriously.
I won’t be going here again.

My family and my boyfriend even drove the car. They still notice the problem.

Took it Hyundai and they actually diagnosed the problem.

name: Todd Erickson
text: Great team of technicians & office staff caring for customers .

text: Shop of honest guys doing an honest day's work. Very friendly, very upfront with the costs.  There were no hidden charges or surprises. Very efficient work done as quickly as possible.  You don't feel like you are being taken advantage of.

name: Alexis Brewe
text: Very dissatisfied with my experience here. I chose Midas based on the great reviews and went to the shop to get an oil change and maintenance check, because my car had been shaking the last few days. The maintenance tech did not properly check my tires, inform me of the extent of damage to my tires, or give me any answers about the shaking. I had a tire blow on the interstate four days later that caused an incredible amount of damage to my vehicle. First time in my life that I’ve gone to a car shop and they haven’t recommended that I buy new tires, and I seriously wish they had. I wouldn’t go here again.

resp.text: Hi there, thanks for the feedback. We are very sorry to hear that you didn't get excellent customer experience we expect to be provided to our customers. We'd really like to talk to you more in regards to your experience, but we need some additional information from you first. Please click goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

text: Originally went here to get transmission work done on my dodge, and everything was smooth for about two months. Then, my battery light comes on and I get someone to look at it. Took it back here because it was under warranty, and Michael Benson was incredibly rude to me and my husband. He looked and acted as though we were a HUGE inconvenience. He even told my husband, "I don't know why she didn't just take it to the other location." (referring to me. ) Would not recommend. That employee just completely ruined my experience with this company.

text: Amazing!!! Danelle was so kind and helpful. From out of town and needed assistance with my tire and they went over and above of what I expected! Recommend to anyone who is looking for friendly hometown service.

name: Jake Jones
text: Great place. I'm usually out in 30-45 minutes when getting oil changed. The key to not waiting hours is to not go when everyone else does (as is with any other service). They offer shuttle service to the surrounding areas. They seem to retain their employees which means you are getting experienced techs each time. Recently when getting my oil changed, the tech found $10 in my seat. They made a point to bring it to me. To me this showed that I can trust them (in all honesty I didn't even know it was there!) I've also gotten tires here and they gave me a great price and did a great job.

name: ashli Jennings
text: Always a great experience.  Great customer service!

name: Bill Wolfe
text:
First visit I woke up to oil all over my garage floor the next morning.  Care was not taken to capture the oil when they changed it and left my skid plate full of oil which resulted in the mess.  Not to mention the oil that blew all over my exhaust and the smell I had to tolerate.  Complained to manager and received a sincere apology.  He asked that I give them a chance to do it right.

Second chance...  Leaving on a trip Saturday.  I called Thursday to inquire about an appointment.  I was told they do not accept appointments but they will be happy to work me in Friday.  I took 2 hours of vacation in order to allow ample time for my oil change and tire rotation (arrived at 1:00 PM).    When I arrived I was told they were not accepting any more oil changes for the day.  I explained I had called the previous day and was told that I would be  accommodated.  The reply from the counter was "Don't know what to tell ya..." while bouncing a pen on the counter and sucking air through his teeth.

There won't be a third chance.

text: Great service. Great people!

name: James
text:
I've had multiple repairs to my Ford focus here and they always do a great job. I had an air conditioning issue and they resolved it for cheaper than Pep Boys quoted me for.

Give this place a try.

I didn't even have to ask anyone, the salesman or manager (Albert I believe) saw me start walking with the tire and he whistled for me to stop and got another worker to take me to put it on and get the other flat to bring back (twice, 2 different guys). I'm not from this area but I'd recommend this place to anyone. Great people, great service. I was lucky to find that place right there not far from my car. God bless them.

name: Stacie Haney
text: Took our van for a quote that was outrageous. Said we would get one somewhere else and the man refused to give my husband the car keys back and that we would have to pay to have it towed. Said legally they have the right to refuse to return our vehicle to us. What’s legal is us signing a document that we will not sue them if we get in an accident after we leave their place and chose not to use their services. They can not legally keep our car no matter how unsafe it is. Once he said we are going somewhere else the guy said he was just kidding and would throw in a discount if we stayed Took it to Farrar instead for better service, price and done professionally.

name: Randy Lambert
text:
Unprofessional and Poorly Managed, Don't Go Here.

I went to Midas in Meridianville for specific (rear diff) and general (oil change etc) services, I choose to do business here after a midweek visit asking if they could provide everything I am looking for. The Manager indicated they provided those services and I made a 7:30 am appointment for a few days later. Appointment day I arrive at the appointed time to locked doors and wait 15 minutes for someone to show up, while I was waiting I noticed trash from the previous days services and appointments all in the service bays. With the late open and the trashy appearance I should have left as these are signs of poor management. They took custody of my vehicle for the remainder of the day, of which I had to call them at closing time to see if there was an update, they were unaware of the status and had to call me back. When I heard back from them they said it was done and we agreed I would pick up the following morning, when I arrived they indicated half of the things I asked to be done weren't done and they can not do them (rear dif & and tire service). I was not charged for the items but now I need to make another service appointment elsewhere.

Separately, one of the Technicians blocked my wife and kids in while they were dropping me off. I went out to ask him to move of which he replied "she can get by", I followed up and asked him to please move, she is driving a larger unfamiliar vehicle (my truck) and would appreciate some extra space. He slurred at me under his breath and attempted to coal roll me in the parking lot.

resp.text: Hi Randy, we are sorry that you did not have a positive experience at our location. If you'd like to tell us more, please visit https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx

So far I'm $3000 in the hole and my truck runs worse Note that it was good, I just wanted to have it restored. So much for restoration. All new system ! SO FAR, VERY VERY DIS SATISFIED.   CHECK BACK WITH ME, IF THIS THING DONT GET ME OR MY FAMILY KILLED TAKING IT BACK. Either way, check back with me, because if it isn't fixed properly and something happens you will hear from me or my sons or lawyer. Cant believe this kind of stuff from Midas. But I do now!!!!!!!

name: Alyssa Oliver
text:
Called up there to schedule a drop off. Because they had good reviews. Not the friendliest person who answered the phone. That's fine but when I told him what was going on he said we dont do transmission work. My problem is it says they do on their website. Rude and waste of time. Going to add to the post I was discriminated against I guess because I'm a woman. my husband called the place and said exactly what I said the problem
Was and they told him yes they do that there.

resp.text: Hello Mrs. Oliver. We do not rebuild transmissions, but we do remove and replace transmissions with either used transmissions or remanufactured transmissions. A gentleman called yesterday and obtained a price to replace the torque convertor. I am not sure if this was your husband or not, but we can replace a torque convertor because it is physically attached to the transmission and is not an internal part. I believe there may have been some miscommunication as to what was required to repair the vehicle/transmission. Alabaster Automotive, LLC prides itself in servicing EVERYONE in the community and we do not discriminate against anyone based on sex, ethnicity, religion, etc. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to me with a phone call. Thank you.

Fantastic service !

name: Andrae Antwoine
text: They explain, very professional, but not accountable for any mistakes.  I have 4 kids and wife, the expense was necessary..they had to replace spark plugs, explained that if removed, Its a possibility some will break off...well 1 got stuck in the engine.....it requires taking everything out and restructure how it was before...with no mistakes...so it took 2-3 weeks to get it done...after 3100$ mechanic informed us #1 he drove the car 65 miles testing the truck..no gas reimbursement (not considering our financial needs)....#2.that our sensor light was not working, (but we never had an issue with it),they didn't charge us for replacing it, but now it  ironically reads an alternator light.  #3 The mechanic simply said, i don't know why it came on, but it needs to be replaced. Although, your safe to drive it home.   #4. 2 weeks later, a great amount of smoke begins to shoot out exhaust...that very day, I took it to another auto place to get it assessed. (my red flags were to much).The other repair shop did not go into detail, but towed it back to alabaster, free of charge told them the issue and Alabaster Auto's  said "we'll give them a call".  #5 2 days later, I called them...ask "what is the problem?" they replied: The fluid injectors ironically messed up within 2 weeks, causing oil to spill onto the motor, "washing it out"...not only did they tell me an alternator was needed, but now I have to buy a new motor. Their excuse was....this is all a coincidences. they don't know why these thing are happening to my ford expedition that is under 120,000 miles. I called the other auto store to come and get it...I'll pay them what is necessary, but I am not spending another dime at alabaster Auto's.  We are taking legal action against them immediately after proof of fault. I can't except "it's all a coincidence".

resp.text: Andrae, one of our goals is to be honest and forthright with our customers. Also, we make every effort to ensure our customers are satisfied.  We deeply regret not being able to do so in your situation.

name: Dayon Lane
text:
Do NOT aide this place. My CRV had to go in to have the fan assembly replaced. Upon getting it back I saw that my A/C no longer blew cold and my automatic window function no longer worked. Then, when taking it in to be looked at, I found that they BROKE what holds to coolant reservoir and just had it sitting, and it was empty. They had lost two of the caps on the front, AND they didn’t attach the grill back correctly.

I called them and they said to bring it in Saturday. I head that way and call them to tell them I’m on the way. And they inform me not to come Bc they are not able to do it Saturday and to come Monday. Isn’t an option for me. I paid $532 for them to essentially break my car. WILL never go back.

name: Andrew Hicks
text: GREAT staff! Very friendly and professional. The level of service on my car was too notch. We won't go anywhere else again.

resp.text: Thank you for all of the great feedback, Andrew!

name: Mark Wright
text: Had alternator and pulley replaced in June this year here.  Recently car wasnt  starting had to jump off took car to 2 places to check battery and alternator checked (free)was told it was alternator so took in here and they checked said it was the battery which I have no problem with but when I got there it was 42 dollar. Guess I should have asked first just assumed the shop that did the work would have done it free too.  Lesson learned I guess.

text:
We recently had one of our cars worked on here and the service was fantastic.  My son and his family have their cars worked on here as well.
If you need a good honest repair service this is the place.

text: Can't even change brakes and rotors correctly. I brought it in several times after they changed them with a noise and they couldn't find it and blamed it on something else. Finally got tired of it and took it to another mechanic and they left bolts out of my caliper and I've had 2 brakes lock up since they did the work.

text: We stopped here on our way to Gulf Shores, after having some minor issues with our breaks which turned out to be nothing other than the adjusting of the new pads I has installed a few days before. They were Saturday but got us in quickly within a few mins. The mechanic and the older gentleman in the office were very friendly and courteous. The gentleman sent us on our way to enjoy our vacation and didn't charge us. If you're having car trouble in this area this is your place. They are Great folks!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! Our main concern has always been the safety and satisfaction of our customers. We’re glad to hear we have delivered that. Thanks again, Justin!

name: Nikaveli ThaWhitePantha
text: The store manager Ricky Tidmore lied to my family and took over $12,000 dollars all the while blaming me on how the car was driven. Sold us a transmission when the motor and transmission needed to be replaced. DO NOT TRUST THIS PLACE. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

text: My last review wasn't what I intended. I just figured how to change it. They really do have a five star rating with me.

name: kevin armstrong
text: I came here to have a plug put in my trailer tire. I waited and was told to back my truck around. When i started backing in someone else whips in and i was forced to stop. He comes up to my window and tells me to wait just a minute and let him take care of this customer. I waited another 10-15 minutes. He finally plugs my tire, i pay and leave. I drive 1/2 Mile home. Get up the next morning and the tire is low again. I drive back down there and tell them something was wrong. There was one person in the lobby and he tells me the wait would be at least one hour to put air in my tire. I had to unload several things from my trailer to get to tools needed for me to put air in it myself. I did this in there parking lot as they say inside and watched me. They won't make there wrongs right. Expert tire is right across the street.

resp.text: Kevin, when we reached out it sounded like you had no issues with your experiences at our shop after we offered to assist in any way we could. If there are any further concerns, please reach out to us as we would like to clear up any misunderstandings. Thank you.

name: Chase Miller
text:
First time customer, came in off recommendation from a friend.

Staff friendly, clean waiting room, good location, fair advertised prices.

3 stars due to being told over phone an oil change would be 20-30 mins wait, showed up 20 mins after the call and I sat in the waiting area over 1-1/2 hrs (I waited because I understand business, and things do happen) without anyone informing me of any delays. I left without recieving any service.

Don't set expectations and then not fulfill them without an explanation, before money walks out the door.

resp.text: Chase, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and for the feedback on your visit. We apologize if any part of your experience was less than satisfactory and we hope to have the opportunity in the future to work with you. If there is anything else that we are able to help with please feel free to give us a call.

Oil changes are only about $22 and that includes a tire rotation and they don't try to upsell you on a bunch of crap you don't need like alot of other places in the area who offer cheap oil changes and then make it up with additional "needs fixing items".

The mechanics and the 2 gentlemen at the front desk are always helpful, and courteous even though they are always busy and I can't thank them enough.

I don't believe for a second these 2 reviews that say they did such a poor job and accept that some people are never happy unless they can drag everyone else into the misery pit where they reside.

Thanks Alabaster Auto and I will continue to use you and recommend you to my friends as long as I am in this area.

Ben

name: Shaun Osborne
text: New management. Used prior to change, always fair. Went by because air quit blowing cold. Asked how much to hook up gauges to test pressure and was told "shouldn't be any charge". The compressor was engaging and disengaging so i figured it might be plugged. The technician hooked it up and saw the high side was too high and low side very low. It was plugged. They tried to say they had to pull codes and all this junk and i told them it runs fine except for the a/c. I shut off the a/c and it ran fine, it would bog down when the compressor engaged. They tried to make more out of it, then charged me $45. Avoid if possible.

resp.text: Not us!! WE have been here since 1998, no new management.

name: Andrew Raymond Crawford
text: I am looking to purchase a 2002-2006 Cadillac Escalade and I used Hampton Cove Auto Services for the pre-purchase inspection of an example I was considering.  The car seemed ok to me, although I knew there were some issues with the shock absorbers and brakes.  The PPI was the best $55 I ever spent and saved me from getting mired in a long list of reliability problems and expensive repairs that would have equaled the purchase price of the car!  I haven't found the right car yet, but will try to bring a few more examples to Hampton Cove Auto Services until we identify the right one.  As well as having a diligent technical team, I have found Jaquata on the customer service side to be both accommodating and very personable.  My neighbor says she has been happily using Hampton Cove Auto Services for many years and it's very easy to see why.  I will use them again as my first preference auto mechanic.

name: Cale Lockhart
text: Take your car and money somewhere else, like Green Garage. TAPCO kept my car for over a week while making no attempts to contact and update me on the repair details. I had to call them daily. They did not give me an estimate for the repair and I was stuck with a $200 bill after paying them $300 the week prior. I went in for a new belt and to look at an oil leak and $500 later and my oil light is still on. Also they misgendered me (transman) the entire transaction. Very cool. Also your car will be sitting outside unlocked after they have worked on it.

resp.text: Cale, I apologize that you felt mistreated. You brought the vehicle in for the oil leak and we found your axle seal to be leaking. This is on the transmission side of your vehicle. The seal was replaced and you also requested a new drive belt which we happily installed for you. I advised you that there may be further oil leaks, and we would need to keep an eye on it and to bring it back in if oil was still visibly leaking on the ground. You had the vehicle towed in for a no start issue. After 3 hours of diagnosis not charged to you, we found that there was an ECM update needed for the vehicle. This is not a service we provide, and I know the advisor informed you that we were waiting on the programmer to come and flash the ECM. The advisor should of given you a rough estimate of cost for this service and I apologize he did not. We also did not know what the cost would be for the service because it has ranged from $45.00 to $400 in the past. So as we knew the fix, the cost was out of our hands. Once the programmer arrived, he performed the flash on the ECM, the vehicle cranked, and he gave me a bill for $200. We called you, let you know the vehicle was repaired and the cost was $200. We literally did not make one dime off of you, and spent 3 hours of diagnosing to confirm we had the right fix for you ( Normally a $345 cost). If your oil light is still on, then you may have another oil leak on the engine side and would need to address that issue, just as I advised you personally. As far as misgendering, we apologize, not really sure what else to say. We will do better with that situation as a whole. We apologize again for the way you feel. We were just doing our best to get your vehicle back in your hands, at the cheapest cost possible. We are not magicians, nor fortune tellers. We do not control when a vehicle breaks, or what mechanical part may fail and start leaking. All we do is advise the best path forward with as much information as we have to give the customer the best chance to make the right decision for themselves. Thank you for business. Please let us know if we can further assist you with your cars in the future.

name: Mark Paxton
text: I had an excellent experience with TAPCO on a '96 FZJ80 restoration.  They did a complete engine rebuild, turbo charger upgrade, roof rack installation, OME springs, powder coated factory rims, installed a front bumper, welded a custom rear bumper, and tons of NAPA service parts bringing this 21 year old SUV back to life.  They are a first class automotive service and repair company with talented techs and ownership that can fix your daily driver or build your one of kind custom builds.  Great work, exceptional service, at a fair price.

name: Scott Jackson
text: I stumbled across TAPCO on youtube while finding out what was involved in swapping the body mounts out on my F250. Along with body mounts, my truck needed new wheel hub assemblies and just someone to go over the steering issues i've had for some time, that several shops have looked at and never been able to diagnose. They were able to swap everything out and found a few things I was not aware of were contributing to the slack in my steering. The combination of fixed steering issues and the S&B body mounts, my 240k mile F250 feels like its a 40k mile truck! TAPCO gave great service, communication, and very fair rates for the amount of work done. Would highly recommend them!

resp.text: Appreciate the kind words Scott! We hope your truck is riding great!!

text: The service was quick and my car issue was resolved. I am satisfied with the place and would recommend it.

text: Been going for there for years now and they've never let me down. Reasonable pricing and they care about the work. Always get the job done well

resp.text: Thank you Max! Always a pleasure!

name: Arthur Tillman
text: I went in to get my vehicle fixed. I normally work on my car myself, but am willing to pay others to do so when problems are above my experience. I asked them to fix whatever it was that made the check engine light be on, which I knew was something with the vacuum system. I also asked them to fix two windows that weren’t working. They “fixed” my car and gave it back to me. Well on my drive home, I discovered a rat chewed halfway through my seat belt and left dropping in the floorboard that they did not clean up. The next day I let them know when I got off work and they said to bring it in and they would fix it. And they did, but they replaced my seatbelt with a black one and my interior is grey. When they replaced my window regulators, they left metal chips from drilling all in my carpet and leather interior, so they did not do a clean job and did not clean up after themselves. ALSO, my check engine light came back on and was running the same codes as it was before I brought it to them. So then I had to leave it with them for several more days. They had my car for over one week. One last thing is that my driver window was tight before they serviced it and made no road noise. Now, it leaks air over fifty and I don’t want to have to bring the car back to them for a third time. That same door now makes an awful rattling noise when it shuts, which it also did not do before they touched my car. I have had pleasant experiences with them in the past, and I left reviews those times as well but service was not what it use to be this visit.

resp.text:
Arthur,
Sorry to hear about your displeasure with our work. Lets start from the top. The vehicle was brought in after you personally attempted to repair many issues with the vehicle yourself and admitted that you may have done something wrong as everything you had done has still not fixed it and the same check engine lights remain on and the vehicle was running rough, even after you worked on it personally. We used our extensive diagnostic equipment and found multiple leaks throughout your vehicles intake system. I personally called and told you we had found these leaks and would need to take off the intake manifold you just put on yourself to see what was going on under it, as that is where the main leak was. I also notified you that there was an code in your ecu for the EGR system and that it may be triggered by the massive intake leak and we would need to correct the major leak first, and let you drive the vehicle to see if there was still an issue with the EGR system. The EGR Valve was also covered with epoxy from what looked to be a band aid repair from a previous time. This could be an issue, but during the diagnosis we did check each component of the system and did confirm the actuators and the valves were operating as they should.  Once we had your approval for the work, we moved forward. Once the intake manifold was removed, we found that you had left the old intake gaskets on the engine and also used the new gaskets of the intake manifold you just replaced. This is what we call being "double gasketed" and quickly saw this was the issue with the massive intake leak. We purchased new intake gaskets since the new ones you installed were severely damaged. We removed the old gaskets and cleaned the surface to ensure proper sealing on installation. Everything went together very smooth on the install and a quick smoke test found that the leak was no longer and the issue was repaired. The codes were cleared and the vehicle was test driven and confirmed that the vehicle was running properly and no longer had any further codes in the system. You were called and told the good news and were made aware that the EGR valve was still in question but would need significant miles put on it to be addressed. Once you took the vehicle and drove it, the light came back on and when you brought it back in we found that the same EGR code was back and found that the EGR Valve that you epoxied was blocking the air passage and triggering the light. You were not charged any further diagnosis and we repaired the EGR valve and there was no further issue.

After these issues were handled you requested that we look at your windows. The window regulators were found to be the issue at hand and they are riveted in from the factory and are very difficult to perfect. We Use OEM ford rivets and installed them to perfection with the factory holes in the door that were not modified in any way shape or form. I do apologize there is wind noise with the window now, we would be glad to take care of this issue and resolve it for you at no cost.  I was also not aware of the pieces in the floor that were claimed to be left by us, and I sincerely apologize for the possible mess left behind. I would be glad to provide a complimentary vacuum of your interior from a detail shop of your choosing. There was a good bit of mess on the floor, including crumbs and such, so we may of overlooked what mess we made, versus what mess was there before we began our work.

The seatbelt issue. We have never had a rat issue before at this location. We have been here for 8 years and never once faced an issue of the sort. We have biweekly pest control services done and stay very proactive with pest control due to the known issues of old downtown buildings and sewer systems. When brought to our concern, we replaced your belt with an OEM Ford part and purchased it by your VIN number at no cost. The interior in your vehicle was sun faded and that is why there is a color difference.

name: Kevin Sandlin
text: Don't go here. They charged my daughter $100 to tell her that her check engine light meant her gas cap was loose. If they'll take advantage of a 19 y/o girl who's out of state, what else do you think they'll do? Seriously: $100 to read a check engine light code and (literally) tighten a gas cap. #epicfail

resp.text: Kevin, I believe you may not fully understand the process of diagnosis on a vehicle. We take pride in our diagnosis and ensure the diagnosis is correct before we tell a customer any type of estimate. Our standard diagnostic rate is $100 and we roll that fee into the repair if you decided to do the repair with us. We have signage throughout the main office with this verbiage and discuss the process with customers as they drop a vehicle off. But yes, lets walk through it so you and everyone can understand. First, we read that check engine light on the vehicle, and used the $6500.00 computer scanner to do so. We went through and found every lasting detail on the issue down to the date it happened and how often it happened. That is where Autozone stops. They get their $30 scan tool out and tell you 10 guesses of items it could be. So now that we have a lot of data, and approved $100 of diagnostic work on the vehicle ( up to 1 hour of diagnosis ) we can move forward and start using our years of training and knowledge to properly diagnose your vehicle. Now my technician gets out his smoke machine (a $1600 tool)  that pressurizes your daughters Evap Emissions system and also fills the system with smoke so we can determine if there is a leak on the system. Then we put the vehicle on our $4500 lift to ensure that we inspect every inch of the system that has a fault. We also use the scanner in the above mentioned process to activate all of the solenoids of the evap system to ensure they are working properly and letting the system properly work. So now that we have used our multi thousand dollars in tools and years of knowledge that is priceless, we have determined your daughters system is actually in perfectly working condition and the only fault is that a personal mistake happened of someone leaving the gas cap loose! Whew! Seems like quite a lot for such a simple task, right?  Well what if you went by the local auto parts store, got a free scan on the vehicle and they sold you an evap canister for your daughters vehicle and then you take it somewhere for an install and spend $1000.00 and the same problem remains. I am sure this review would look a lot different if you took into consideration the time, the effort, the knowledge, and the care that was put into your 19 year olds daughter vehicle to ensure we did not sell her any parts or service she did not need and made sure she was getting the most honest and best value possible when she put her trust in our shop. I apologize you feel like we took advantage of her. I hope that you see we spent a careful amount of time ensuring we had a proper diagnosis, and realize that doing so does not come free. This business is how we feed our families and have done so for 8 years. If we did not charge customers for diagnosis, then we would become a charity, and likely go out of business, and your daughter would be stuck down the street at the dishonest shop that sold her thousands in repair work that was not needed. I am certainly glad to hear your daughters vehicle is still doing well and the check engine light has not come back on after our thorough diagnosis, with out costing her any extra money.  If you would like to further discuss this issue you are welcome to call me, Michael Lee, the owner whenever you would like to. I would be glad to walk you through our process and make sure you fully understand the extent of work we did ensuring your daughters vehicle was safe and properly diagnosed and why the $100.00 was charged. Most would consider it an #epicsave , you know, since we were the honest shop that did not take advantage of her and took every possible step to make sure her vehicle was diagnosed properly. Happy Holidays.

name: Shirrell Moore
text: I will never take my truck or car there again,I took my SUV in because the brakes kept going to the floor,when I brought it to them the assured me that they can fix it,after he called me and told me it was ready to be picked up the brakes went slap to the floor so I left it with them 2 weeks then he called and asked me why I didn't tell him I put a brake booster on it I told him I didn't know what was put on there then he charge me again to put a brake booster on there,now he already put a master cylinder the first time that was the first thing he said was wrong with it but it wasn't the problem and I paid him 324.00 the second time 370.00 when he put the brake booster on it went up long enough to get it home when I got back in town I went to drive it coming off the interstate the brakes went slap out when I took it back to him on Monday morning trying to get him to fix it or give my money back he told me my godbrother sign a no warranty,but I told him he didn't suppose to let no body sign nothing if his name wasn't on it,I asked him to contact me cause when I first took it to Tapco I sign a warranty for 12 months or 12 000 miles but since it wasn't fixed properly he didn't want to honor the warranty he originally gave me now I'm out 700.00 and my brakes are the same when I first came I really feel robbed without a weapon, but I'mspeaking with my attorney!

resp.text:
It is unfortunate that you would not tell the entire truth here and try and lie for personal gain. Your vehicle left with working brakes and came back 3 times with working brakes. (Video Evidence) Your brother inspected, test drove, and then
signed off on the vehicle being repaired and working properly, and agreeing to the no warranty (mainly because you brought us used parts to install on your vehicle). This is all after the lies that were told about the vehicle and trying to throw us under the bus after multiple shops had unsuccessfully repaired your vehicle. I hope you are leaving the other shops that worked on your vehicle bad reviews and threatening them with attorneys as well, after all, they could not even repair your vehicle.  Before we even installed parts on the vehicle you threatened attorneys for some reason. We should of turned you away then, instead we repaired vehicle properly.  I am sorry you are so upset. We do not turn out incomplete work. Our endless reviews on here and Facebook, and your brother signing off on our work after a thorough inspection are proof to my statement.

Also, NAPA Autocare provides a nationwide warranty for our customers. I would recommend calling another NAPA Autocare center in the area that will accept your business. I ask that you treat them with respect and be up front with them from the beginning and don’t threaten their every move with lawsuits.

It is unfortunate that Google will not let businesses review customers.

I will gladly accept your 1 star review. Thank you!

He ordered the part right away,  had it overnighted and my car fix the very next day by noon so I could get back on the road safely.

name: William Deacon
text: I was on a road trip 650 miles from my local dealership, when the vehicle developed a problem. Turns out the wheel speed sensors where the issue. I call my dealer who advised me to find a dealership that could make the repair... easier said than done. I was told 10-14 days before the service could be performed... until I spoke to Shannon Stull at Century Auto. I briefly defined the situation in hope that the parts and time might be available. In record time Shannon with the cooperation Chris Pope, where able to order overnight the proper parts and squeeze the car in for service. The parts did arrive and the service was performed without issue. I’m sure it was a team effort to make this happen, and thanks to the professionals who actually installed the parts! Clearly this Dealership, Century Auto has the service and professional staff to get the the job done. My night mare hunting trip was saved by the team, to include transportation to and from the rental car. Everyone I met at the dealership was outstanding, but I can’t say enough about Shannon and Chris.. true professionals. THANK YOU, for all the efforts and the time you saved me!

resp.text: William, thank you for sharing your experience and I am glad the team was able to help.

name: Necedah Townsend
text: My Porsche was at the Huntsville shop for over an week after I told and showed the parts guy and manger Shannon what was wrong with my Porsche.  We pulled up the part and I left under the impression that the part was being ordered because it was going to take at least two days to arrive. Therefore when the part was scheduled to arrive was the timing I was told my car would be looked at by the technician. Lies lies lies .... I had to keep calling Shannon the manager to find out if there was any information on the arrival of the part ... how much will it cost and never an direct answer. Every time  it was let me call you back and I am about to go follow up. And never return the call/s. After my car was there for a week I called again to only find out the part was not ordered and they were ordering it that day. Which meant at least another two days waiting for the one part that we knew I needed to arrive. The sad thing is this is the only place locally that are certified to work on my car or get parts from. I had to get a rental twice for a week because I never knew when my car would be ready. Extremely Poor Customer Service. Lastly they called me at 4:00 to tell me my car was ready when they close at 5:00 with only an estimate for cost. Never stating that they did not except certain payments. Noted on my receipt I had a premium car wash lol.  My car was so dirty on the outside. I had just gotten the inside detailed myself. Such a joke.

resp.text: We are so sorry about the miscommunication regarding our service scheduling. While we can accommodate walk in clients, our customers who book appointments are priority to have their vehicles serviced. We take pride in our service departments commitment to thorough inspections and quality work, and sometimes both of those take some time. Our team worked as quickly and as diligently as they could to try meet your expectations. We apologize your vehicle was not diagnosed and repaired as quickly as you wanted.

name: Chris Haury
text: Professional, as expected from Porsche. Even though they were backed up and hampered by an employee out sick and weren't able to provide the loaner vehicle requested, they honored my appointment and provided an excellent door to door shuttle service that was really efficient and quick. When they phoned to tell me my service was complete, the driver was already 10 min from my house. The service on my vehicle was excellent as expected, and the Porsche tech sent a video going over my vehicle and the work done. Very happy.

resp.text: Thank you for your five star review! We are happy to see you received exceptional care from our team.

name: matthewsleila
text: I have had issues with my Macan, too many in my opinion,  however this team of mechanics and the service team are the reason why I stick with it and remain patient and positive. They truly care and always have done their very best to ensure,  although there have been issues, that they provide the best service possible and always go out of their way to please the customer. Amazing team, technical knowledge and certainly understand and practice high quality customer service. Shout out to Jacob,  Randy and Chris. I appreciate you guys.

resp.text: Thank you Leila, the guys will continue to strive to provide the service that you appreciate and deserve.

name: Bill Brown
text: Great experience for a long time coming first buyer. Total professionalism from all Century employees. No pressure and all were extremely helpful in explaining the new world of Porsche, to include those not directly involved in the sale.  Highly recommend Century and the Porsche Brand.

resp.text: Welcome to the Porsche family and Porsche of Huntsville, a Century Automotive dealership. Congratulations on your purchase and thanks again for your business.

name: raymond fernandez
text:
About over a year or so ago Porshe of Huntsville did inspection service on my Cayenne without informing me of the cost. When I called this out to the service manager he said he would make it right and explained the dealership would provide the next service at no cost to me. He said he would document it in their computer records. I counted on that all this time, so when my vehicle was brought in for service I fully expected them to honor that promise. We'll there service manager said they could not find any record. Please note that I confirmed this way back with the previous service manager that it was noted on their record.
I am completely dissatisfied with the lack of commitment to what was promised by the dealership.
I therefore  refused any additional service and just agreed to pay for an oil change (which costs $430), The car was kept for 4 hours.
I will never buy a Porshe again.

resp.text: We wanted to follow up and and thank you for speaking to our service manager Shannon about your experience and hope the resolution  you came to together was satisfactory.

name: Dave Vaupel
text: I flew to Huntsville from Jacksonville to buy a Cayenne e-hybrid and drive it back home. From my pickup from the airport to drive-off it was a great experience.  Bradley D. and Jon C. Took great care of me. I will definitely be talking to them when it’s time for the 2 seater. Thank you Porsche of Huntsville!

resp.text: Thank you for your five star review! We are happy to see your trip was well worth it and that you love your new Cayenne!

name: Ronnie Honbuckle
text:
Exceptional Service staff from the service managers desk, shop mechanics, parts department, shuttle service personnel, the folks who cleaned and washed my Porsche and bookkeeping departments. Thanks for the courteous, timely and a job well done. Cheers
R. Hornbuckle 4/16/'21

resp.text: Thank you for your five star review! We are happy to see you received exceptional care from our team.

name: Mike Kurbanick
text: What a great experience!  Everyone was friendly and knowledgeable.  Our car was exactly what we were told it would be and then some.

resp.text: Thank you for putting your trust in us and flying up to Huntsville. I hope you had a safe and enjoyable drive back to Florida.

name: Todd Lackey
text: Century and the team at century Porsche are always top notch. Above and beyond the call of duty is always my experience. Jacob and Chris make it easy. A+ service. Good job!

name: Kelley Snook
text: Exceeded expectations. I purchased my car sight unseen and had it shipped to Michigan. Bradley walked me through the entire process including what to expect and timing of each step. He is a knowledgeable professional that I would make an effort to work with again—even though there are three Porsche dealerships within 25 miles of me. Everything was exactly as he said it would be and he continues to be a willing resource for me after the purchase. Outstanding communication. Thank you!

resp.text:
Kelley, Thank you for the kind review. Purchasing a vehicle sight unseen from several states away can be a difficult. We try very hard to represent our vehicles to long distance customers as if they were looking at them person, yours was easy. Thank you for your business and entrusting us with your purchase.

Drive safely.

Porsche of Huntsville

text: I have used this dealership’s service department twice. Not only are the service folks knowledgeable and seem trusting, I’m so happy that each  and every person are very professional with a commitment to customer service. Quite a class act.  Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you Jacqueline for the kind words. Porsche of Huntsville strives for this kind of service and relationships with all of our customers.

name: Becky Cobb
text:
I live halfway between Huntsville and Memphis. I took my car to Memphis for its annual service a year ago. My check engine light had popped up several times before I took it.   I was told there was nothing they could do for my car’s issue unless my check engine light was “on”.  The issue persisted and became worse.  I decided to try Huntsville to see if they could help.  To my surprise, your dealership exceeded my expectations!  I was provided with a loaner car and constant updates.  Your service manager, Randy Carter, was amazing. After my disappointing experience in Memphis, Randy and Chris Pope will be my “go to guys” for as long as I drive my Cayenne.  This car was our first Porsche purchase and being cared for the way I was in Huntsville, it will not be my last.
Thank you for everything you did. I am a satisfied customer and will continue to use  you for my future purchases.
Sincerely, Becky Cobb, Iuka Ms,

name: Charles Phillips
text: I had a major service performed on my Panamera this week.  Jacob and Randy provided excellent service. From the time I dropped the car off to getting the loaner car to pick up.   Everything went smoothly. Communication was very good.  Definitely recommend this service team.

name: J Williams
text:
I’m am glad others have had a good experience with this dealer. We have not. We found the car we wanted here in Huntsville while shopping from out of state. Initially the process was smooth, easy, friendly...until the salesman, Bradley, sold the car out from under us. This was after several attempts to call, email, and yet for 24 hrs no word back, nothing. Only to receive a call hours after all the attempts to reach...to say the car was sold. Having dealt with other dealers and more specifically, Porsche dealers...the lack of communication and poor salesmanship was absolutely horrible.

I know, in our case, we can shop at other dealers...I can only hope they treat their customers better than they did us.

resp.text:
J Williams,
I am sorry that you had a bad experience. Feel free to call me if you would like to discuss.
Jon Cunha, Sales Manager

name: Ron Hall
text: I would not recommend this location, no customer service or respect for customers time. They do not deserve any stars for today's actions. Stopped by this location Saturday to schedule an oil change for Monday. I dropped off my vehicle at 0700 sharp and asked if it would be complete by 1300. I returned at 1300 to get vehicle and they had not even started, nor did they apologize or try to make up for their lack of customer service. They seemed completely indifferent about not completing the job. I believe that these businesses do not consider the planning that takes place to coordinate vehicle maintenance. I understand things happen but 6 hours to complete an oil change seems reasonable. If there was going to be a problem with completing by 1300, they should have told me at 0700. I took my vehicle and got service completed at Goodyear.

name: Roscket Tasartir
text:
Brought my car in with a nail in a tire, expecting a puncture and needing a patch. They inspected it and found it was only firmly embedded in the tread, no puncture. They removed the nail and even pressure-checked the tire, all without charging me a dime. Thanks!

Keep in mind  that this location is within the Redstone Arsenal, so you'll need to have badge-access to the Arsenal to use their services.

text: Got a great deal on a new set of tires w/ alignment, as well as a brake & rotor change. Service was excellent and fast. I highly recommend them!

text: Love this firestone

text: I do not like that I am so familiar with this store but my wife's Acadia has been temperamental of late. The good news is Justin and the chaps at Firestone are great to work with. Highly recommend.

text: Highly recommend this place. Had a little accident on the way back to Maryland and everyone here was friendly and professional. They got us in and back on the road in less than an hour. Really great people here.

text: Great place had a slight ordering issue with my tires but they worked it out.   The whole team even stayed over to make sure they got my car done .  Can't recommend enough.

name: demetria williams
text: I am completely disappointed with my experience here. I caught a piece of metal in my tire on my way to work so i had to leave work to get my tire replaced, $151 was paid for one tire 215 50R17. A few days later my Tire Pressure Sensor goes off and I add air and recalibrate my tires, just for it to go off again. I called them they told me “our calibration system is down and we did not reset your sensors” which seems like a minor fix of course, but it’s not. Now, if my tire pressure is low, I won’t have any idea because my sensor has not been reset and therefore it is not functioning properly. I now have to leave work, again, find another location and have them correct mistakes that were not disclosed at the time of my visit. Very disappointing. Let’s not halfass any other jobs, if you can not do it right in it’s entirety then you should not be doing it.

text: not exactly good but sometimes good

text: Left caps off under hood after oiil change on 1 trip. Froze bank account 10 days and refused to help resolve hold after payed by another method on another trip. Payed for unlimited tire rotation and balance with new tirea but they seem to be trying to find ways to loose my business.

text: Thank you! Thank you!  We were on the road between South Carolina and Arkansas. We had a tire that wouldn’t hold air! It was Saturday night, we called this shop, they said someone would be available first thing on Sunday morning to check our tire.   They found a tiny leak the two other Firestone garages had missed.  We were good to go!

text: Honest, helpful, checked out the car and did not try up sell me things I did not need.  Great to work with.

text: Barry was great very Courteous and fast I will definitely recommend your Firestone to all my friends thanks again Barry!!

I was contacted by the General Manager AND Area Manager after my surveys. NEITHER of them provided ANY compensation for my wasted time and money. Highly recommend not going here.

text: Did a oil change at the 280 location last month and they forgt to put back the engine oil cap..i didnt even notice till lastnight when i see some oily fluid coming out the bumper so i open upbthe hood and realize i the oil cap is missing. I took it in this morning and all they did is put a cap on. I was told it was scrub and clean but i dont think they did any of that..i still gt oil under the hood,the hoses and the covers.. really not recommend going there again.

The front desk person was very unapologetic and had an attitude about it when it was brought to his attention. Probably won’t be back.

Place was orderly and clean with a nice TV.  Associates were very nice and did a repair on my car much faster than was told by two other places. Many Thanks!

The workers seemed like they were glad to be employed!! Time, sped of service, cleanliness, professionalism, was all 5 stars!! Thanks Firestone on Hwy 280!! Yall Rock!!
