text: They were all right, personality and the work as well.... However it's one of the smallest firestone's I've ever seen.. I had to wait two hours.

resp.text: Hello, we know that your time is valuable and we'd like to ensure that this is addressed. Please feel welcome to email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with these details and your contact information. We appreciate your business and look forward to hearing from you soon. ^Alexis

name: vic rosier
text: Paid $30 + just to have a tire mounted on a spare rim !  Thats Price gouging. And ridiculous then said it would be more to put it on a car !! This is the worst place ever! I have never paid more than 15 for that service anywhere else ! Save yourself and go anywhere else!

name: Paul Taylor
text: Quality of staff will blow your mind. I've been a few times ever since they quoted me 600 bucks under express oil change rate for a particular fix. This most recent time I was there for 3 hours-I like to pay attention to people as Psychology is my major. Every single person that came in(very busy day) treated the staff and other waiting customers like long time best friends. That, I believe starts with their first experience and how this particular store takes you in as family, wants the best for you, and the atmosphere is contagious. It takes a special kind of mechanic shop professional to turn EVERY stressed/worried car owner that steps foot in the door into thankful, optimistic family. To reassure the readers and hopefully future customers of firestone 280, I want y 'all to know I don't gain anything from this review, and honestly I don't know if it will even be on the website lol. Have a blessed day!

name: sherman grant
text: Agree with others who posted negative reviews; these people try to sell you services your car doesn't not need. I took it to get "looked" at for a wheel noise, and they didn't bother taking out on the road, just raised it up and visually looked at it. Go somewhere else and trust your own instinct.

name: Chris Bonds
text: Had a great experience getting a front end alignment. Very help staff who got the job done.

name: Ronni Lessa
text: My a/c stopped working in Mississippi, on my way back from New Orleans to NYC. I was staying over in Birmingham and went over to Firestone first thing in the morning. They were very kind and helpful. They drove me back to my hotel and picked me up, when my truck was finished (earlier than expected). The a/c is working beautifully. I would recommend this particular location of Firestone, to anyone and everyone.

name: Joshua Deason
text: The service here was outstanding! The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. I was informed of what services were recommended once my vehicle inspection was complete and was also informed of services that could be needed in the future but were not necessary for this visit. In addition to an inspection and oil change I also had 4 new tires put on my truck and had an alignment completed. A few other customers came in for oil changes only and were in and out in no time at all. I will definitely return with my vehicle for future services!

name: James B
text: Con Artists!  I normally avoid chain stores like Firestone because I know they try to scam people, but it was my last option to get my car examined.  I was helped by a woman I think was named Sabrina, and she fed me the biggest scam I've heard with my car, I don't think she realized I knew more about cars than she probably did.  She told me the tires were done and needed to be replaced NOW, the air filters needed replaced NOW, the battery was dead and needs replaced NOW, and the radiator needed to be flushed - and they'd conveniently do all of this for me at a hefty premium.  I was silently laughing at myself because two of my tires had 20K miles left on them (yes the other two need replacing soon), my air filters were replaced 8 months ago, my battery was brand new (I took it to auto zone AND advanced auto parts and they showed me the readings and the charge was fantastic, they laughed at Firestone for trying to pull one over on me), my radiator was also flushed within the last year.  I finally called her out on the battery and she looked me right in the eye and had the immoral audacity to say the battery was still worthless.  These are common things places like Firestone try to trick people into having repaired, because most people don't have the knowledge to know any better.  It was funny because they didn't even identify the things that were wrong with my car that I knew about.  They checked off that both headlights were working great, even though I knew and verified that one of the front headlights was dead... did they really even look my car over or just pretend to then hand me an appraisal for all the "broken" items I needed to have them fix now?  If you do not know much about cars, do not trust Firestone, they will sense your naivete and pull a fast one on you.  Always get a second opinion from a more reputable garage shop (I prefer privately owned places that rely on their honesty for business).  This just reaffirms the longstanding distrust I've had for places like Firestone, avoid them if you care about your money and your vehicle's longevity.  This visit was a total scam and employees like the one I dealt with do not belong in a customer service position.

name: Em M
text: Service is always great!

name: Chase Lindsey
text: The manager is awesome she matched all my prices and was so sweet it made my stomach hurt

name: KevinLisa Pate
text: They are a great store shop with very good tires and wonderful service!thanks Firestone

name: vnehwal
text:
Appointment scheduling is a fake program. Don't rely on that scheduling service. I scheduled my appointment one day before for 11.30 next day, they told the the service will be done by 12.30. I said great and I will plan accordingly.
went there next day at 11.30, now they say they will try to do it by 12.45 and when i come back at 12.30 they even haven't started yet.  They waisted 2 hours of my time(including going there and back) and still I have to take my car back without service as they wanted more time. Problem is not that they took time, the problem is that how they communicated and mentioned the timelines and did not followed the timelines. What point of scheduling an appointment when it does not have any meaning and you still wait in the queue and on top of that you miss-communicate the customer about timings. Don't you think that they have plan accordingly what you communicate.

name: Paul Pietrowski
text: Wouldn't even say hi to me. Too busy answering the phones to take the time to greet a in store customer.

resp.text: Paul, we appreciate you bringing this to our attention. This is not the type of service that we expect our loyal customers to receive, and we truly apologize. Please feel welcome to email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with the details of your visit, the store, and your contact information. We value your business, and we thank you for contacting Firestone. ^Jennifer

name: MADEBYMUNKI
text:
I have been here twice for a tire repair and on one occasion the mechanic messed up my studs and lug nuts not once but twice, however the manager in charge - Sabrina took care of everything professionally. I was reimbursed on the cost of my lug nuts and studs and treated really well with respect. If you are reading this Sabrina, you did one hell of a job, we need more managers like you around.

I would definitely go back if need anything else as the customer service and professionalism is something this branch  can be proud of. God bless.

name: Maximum Gamer
text: The service and professionalism of the technicians and staff, especially Sabrina, is second to none. I can say without reservation if there's an installation needed on your vehicle that you are in safe hands at Firestone.

name: Albert Barginere
text: Off the chain good...every state every time.

name: RICHARD ST JOHN PERDUE
text:
This is a great place to have your car taken care of, especially if you find your dealerships mechanics have grown tired of their profession.

For 20 years I have had nothing but excellent service at this location.

name: Kate Mullen
text: Sabrina, Ryan and Marqies were AMAZING! We rolled into town with a seriously misaligned van and the team at Firestone took great care of us. They were honest, kind and quick.

name: Jim Hutton
text: Two stars because they were nice.  They sell tires and are probably good at it, but saying they do much mechanical work is misleading. I took my truck there, based on a call where they said they could deal with my two issues.  After keeping the vehicle all day, they called to tell me they couldn't fix either issue.  I'm not talking rebuilding a motor.  We're talking a power window off the track and leaking hose. Tires, probably fine. Mechanical work, take vehicle to a mechanic.  I won't go back. As I said,  the staff was very nice, but no help on my issues.

name: Benjamin Tibbs
text: Great service. I have gone several times for oil changes and tire replacement and they have had my vehicle ready promptly and their work has always been fantastic. My go to shop for routine car maintenance.

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text:
This my "go-to" place for an oil change and tires. They have found other problems that could only be fixed by the dealership and let me know about them. They are always friendly and helpful. It is NOT a 10 minute oil change place though! I usually always bring a book to read, or work to do if I am stay and wait for the work to be completed.

I am adding an edit to the review. The previous review was in June 2017. When I took my van for an oil change today I asked for them to check the tire pressure.....they didn't. They also didn't reset my oil change alert on my dashboard. They went from 4 to 3 stars on my review.

name: Stephanie Repass
text: Made an appointment at 11:45 and got there at 11:35. They couldn’t find my appointment. Finally found it and I asked if it would be done within the hour since I was at lunch. He assured me it would. 35 mins later my car hasn’t moved. I go inside to ask what’s going on and the 2 guys at the counter say they’ll be with me in a minute. Meanwhile they’re just talking to each other while I wait for 3-4 mins. Finally I ask for my keys and the guy just hands me my keys and doesn’t say anything. I NEVER write reviews, and I will NEVER go to this location again.

name: Tim Fisher
text:
Changed my oil competently, but tried to upsell me on some other frivolous repairs that would have cost over $100.

How do I know they were frivolous? I had my car at its dealership just last week for a safety recall, and when they did a similar complementary check they found nothing of the sort wrong. Nearly every single number on Firestone's check-up sheet was low-balled by up to 20% from the dealership check-up, and there's no way I got that much wear and tear in a single week.

Bottom line: know what you want when you walk in, and don't let them sell you anything else. If you don't know cars well enough to know a con when you see one, take yours somewhere more honest.

name: Elizabeth Gilmore
text: Driving from South Carolina to Texas, my serpentine belt snapped. Sabrina and the mechanics at Firestone were incredible in explaining to me what happened, what was needed, and recommendations for down the road. I wasn't charged an arm and a leg or ripped off for my lack of knowledge. I'll continue using Firestone sue to this experience.

name: Erica Lattimore
text: Called about a quote on my brakes and tires, instead she was in a hurry to answer the question(s) and just threw a price out there. Ask can she put the make and model of my car in computer instead of just throwing me a quote. Came back a different quote then what she told me. Hire more patient people instead of the Impatient stupid woman that answered the phone.

name: Heart Sigh
text: They are friendly there but if you're in a hurry, don't go there. I went on my lunch break for an oil change. They said 30 minutes. An hour later they hadn't even started. They finally finished almost 2 hours later. Another person I was talking to there he came in before me and was still waiting for his oil change to be finished.

resp.text: Good afternoon. We are truly sorry to hear about the long wait you had when you took your vehicle in to have your oil changed. We know that your time is valuable and we'd like to help get your concerns escalated to our upper management team for further assistance. Please email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with your contact information, a link to this review, and any invoice numbers related to the oil change. We value your business with Firestone and we hope to hear back from you soon. ^Katrina

name: Reeves Burruss
text: Bought a "new to me" car, and same day took it to Firestone to get a new timing belt because they were the only people open on Sunday (my only off day). I paid 850$ and was assured that the car would be ready that afternoon. I called back later in the day and was told to show up around 4:30 (right before close) to pick up the vehicle. I arrived and was told that they wouldn't leave until it was finished. About 15 minutes later I was told the guy didn't know how to do the job. When I asked how it would be done I was told,"oh, he'll just have to figure it out." The clerk later came out and said it would be the next morning. After asking to leave early from work an hour away, I arrived to a car that made a loud racket from the engine. I was told to leave it there and let their "expert" mechanic look at it the next day. I was told the previous day that the expert mechanic was the one working on it in the first place. I asked to speak to the manager, Vince, who is scum of the earth. He told me he was tired of dealing with my problem and that if I drove it away he wouldn't be liable. Fair warning to anyone looking to have service done at Firestone.

name: Cody C
text: I had a flat tire on a Sunday, so everything else nearby was closed. We pulled up riding on a donut, and they were pretty busy. Since I had a dinner to attend, we couldn't afford to wait. However, the guy was extremely polite and offered to check the pressure in the spare for us. It was too low, so he filled it up for free.

name: Brad Yellock
text: I have used firestone for 16 years. They are just like any other business. Sometimes great, sometimes bad. The particular location on hwy has an associate named Sabrina that works the front. Whenever you see her turn around and leave. If you ask for an oil change and an alignment, you’ll get a tire rotation and washer fluid. That sounds funny but I am not kidding. She is a terrible communicator, and a terrible listener. Everyone else great. She should be happy her teammates are professional and don’t give their true thoughts on her, but you can see the looks on their face when she screws up. I am literally 5 for 5 with screw ups from her not listening. What’s more she had an aditude when she makes a mistake. Again her name is Sabrina. Sabrina Sabrina Sabrina.. you see her run.

name: Gregory A. Meadows
text: Tried to charge me for everything but what the problem was. I apologise, it was the Bessemer Rd location

name: Michelle Cranor (FunSiZe)
text: Besides the wait time the customer service is great. I came in when they opened and had a appointment but it took them an hour just to get to my car. Sucks for me I will be late for work. So making a appointment doesn't always work. Besides that they are very friendly and helpful.

name: Margaret Strickland
text: When it came time to purchase new tires or our vehicles, I did a lot research and got a number of comparable quotes.  Firestone easily beat every quote.   On the service side, it's been a big disappointment.  Tried to sell me a new air filter when the one in the car was only 2 weeks old.  Tried to sell me an alignment with no explanation.  When I asked to see the numbers one wheel was so slightly off that I really beleive it could be calibration error as the old tires showed no signs of uneven wear and the car never pulled.  Today I went in for an apppointment at 9:00 am.  Every bay was full and I was told they were "down 3 techs".  Took 2 hr and 15 min for rotate and balance and oil change.  I specifically asked twice to include the full size spare in the rotation.  Left only to see it was not done.  Incidently, it's running the same air filter as on last visit and today it was "fine".  They also did not mention an issue with the suspension they said was problematic before.  So if today they were really busy and everything was "fine", and last time they were not as busy and they offered multiple unnecessary services, makes me wonder about how much pressure they get to "sell" services OR if, when they are busy, they don't do a thorough inspection.  Either way, it's disappointing.

name: Kelly Pan
text: Will charge you $60 to change 1 head light and will tell you it takes an hour. The actual cost of a headlight bulb is about $6 for a Toyota Corolla and it takes a LITERAL 1 minute to change the bulb. GO TO AUTO ZONE BUY THE BULB YOURSELF. THE AUTO ZONE WORKERS WILL CHANGE YOUR BULB FOR YOU FOR FREE.

name: Sidney Garner
text: Got tires from here 2 months ago, the day after I got them one was flat. Took it back they replaced it and now a month and a half later another tire is slowly going flat, took it in to ask if they could look at it and made me wait all afternoon. I would not recommend them.

name: DeJuana McCary
text: Karen the sales advisor and Michael the technician were excellent. People to be trusted, who care about you and your vehicle.

name: Phrawsty Gamez
text: Recently spent $500 for full service only to have my car cut out on me twice in the same day. FULL SERVICE BUT IT WAS BARELY A QUART OF OIL IN IT AFTERWARDS!!

resp.text: We are truly sorry to hear that you had a negative experience while visiting our Birmingham store. We would like to hear more details concerning this oil change service. Please, email us at, socialcare@bfrc.com, with a description of your visit, your contact information, and the invoice number or store address. We hope you will give Firestone a chance to rectify this issue.^Kristyn

name: Corinthean Mitchell
text: The technicians were very friendly and keep me informed of what was happening with my car.

name: Hank Winks
text:
Had tires installed on both trucks, both vehicles had tire pressure fault lights go off within a few miles of leaving the store.

Took them back, the store manager assured me they did nothing wrong. I told her the lights weren’t on in either truck previously, she said I was lying as her master certified mechanic saw the light on prior to changing the tires.

Never experienced anything like that before.

Very frustrating to be told I’m a liar and have the lights going off constantly to remind me of it...

resp.text: Hi Hank, we are sorry to hear about the negative experience you had at our Birmingham location. If you could email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with your contact information, invoice number, and a link to this review, we will escalate your concerns to our upper management team. We look forward to hearing from you. ^Miguel

text: The lady and man in the office was super professional and nice. By far the best Tire Shop I know of I live 45 minutes from this place and still would rather drive there than take my truck to anywhere else.

I thought this place was reasonable, but i cannot keep paying them bonuses to fix my car. I ask them to do an oil change this last time and they did not do it. Done with Dave, Jason and the whole bunch, just done.I DO NOT RECOMMEND ANDERSON'S AUTOMOTIVE FOR CAR REPAIRS. Something is wrong, they should stand behind their work!  Reporting them to BBB! Done they arent fixing the problem. I will not use them again! Pretty angry with them., they don't stabd behind their work, they say it was thus this time, disappointed just disappointed. Just because a church going perso recommends someone, dient mean their honest and good.

name: Eric Perez
text: They are true masters of their trade! I had subtle high-speed shaking and a knocking sound in the suspension that I could not detect (nor could any other shops). They fixed both these issues in one day and now my Ford Ranger rides like a butter cloud!!  Military friendly and all-around good folks. I'm glad I found the shop I can trust in this area.

name: Edward Pearson
text: Fixed right the first time.Good prices too.

name: Theodora Stovall
text: The owner JB is very nice. I recommend this business to everyone who needs  auto repair.

name: Phillip Dunn
text: Great work on my 2013 Chevy Truck!

name: Taurus Moorer
text: He was rude unprofessional. Does not need a business open to the public. He told me because I did not buy my rims and tires from him he was going to put all of his other customers before me. But I was the first one there. He shows no customer service for customers that are spending their money with him. And this was the owner.

name: Kathleen B
text: Great service and prices and they got me in and out quick, thanks guys!

name: Jessica Ware
text: I love it here brad is amazing !!!

name: BK Sensei
text: Went there March 16, 2021 just a few hours before the tornado that hit the area close by. These guys went above and beyond that day. That took care of my vehicle and the others in the shop even close to the time of the tornado passing. They made sure everyone there was safe and took us to the safest center room they had. I have a strong and hardy work ethic and even I wouldn't have asked these guys to work in the garage at the time they did. I have nothing but good regards for each and every person working there that day. I can't complement them enough. Definitely deserved a sixth star that day. Make sure you keep this place in mind when you need something taken care of.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are so grateful for your kind words and for your support. Thank you for choosing us!

name: Kevin Jones
text:
Greystone Tire and Automotive recently performed my son's 120k Service for a 2014 Camry SE. The car performs better than it did when we purchased the car with 70k miles on the odometer. The car "now" idles quietly which is uncommon for most four cylinder engines in my opinion.
The car drives like it's new. The difference after the 100k service and tune-up is appreciable.

resp.text: Kevin, thank you for your review! We were glad to help your son out with his 120k service on his 2014 Camry SE. We look forward to seeing you family next time!

name: Chad Cullum
text: Always a great experience, especially when dealing with Brooks. I've had five cars in there over the past two years, and I've never been disappointed with the service.

resp.text: Chad, thank you for your review! We're glad to help you out with your automotive repair needs and we'll see you next time!

name: Sheri Davis
text: Great place -- reasonable prices good staff

resp.text: Sheri, thank you for your review! We're glad to provide quality auto repair service while being friendly and reasonable. See you next time!

name: Ashley Smith
text: I was over on 280 for a massage when I noticed my van picked up a nail on the right passenger side. Thankful for these guys who took me right away to patch my tire so I could drive back over to my side of town in Trussville. If it wasn’t for them I probably would be stranded on the side of the road desperately seeking away to pick up my three small kids.  Thank you for being so kind, fast, and for having much compassion!

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review, Ashley! We take pride in providing automotive solutions for our customers in an efficient and friendly manner and we're glad we could help with your van's tire. We appreciate your kind words and we hope to see you back for future auto services!

text: The power steering went out on my car.  They ordered a hose and it came in later than expected; however, these guys went above and beyond to have my car ready when they promised.  When and if I ever need work done on my car, these guys are the ones I'm using.

text: Excellent service.

name: Dominik Herrmann
text:
Great place and knowledgeable, friendly staff offering services at a reasonable price. Especially with CostCo discount. Only complaint is when I went to get my A/C checked out they only told me what I already knew. It's stuck on defrost. Repairing it would require taking the dash out. Well that's an easy 500$.
However, they did not notice the ripped vacuum-tube that connects to the driving cabin, which could be fixed from the engine compartment. Had to fix it myself after I noticed the problem. Could have done a better job on that. Otherwise great job.

name: Dylan Minor
text: Honest automotive shop that will take care of you fast and easy.

text: Recommended by AAA when my car overheated.  Honest folks.  Certainly had the opportunity to take advantage of me.  They did not.  Just added coolant and replaced a leaky hose.  Good folks.  I will use them again.

name: Sandra Cross
text: I had to have my radiator and battery replaced in my car and it was ready over the weekend. Everyone is very kind and honest here- pricing was also very competitive compared to others that I received a quote from. These are some go-to people if you have any car troubles!!

resp.text: Sandra, thanks so much for reviewing us! We appreciate your kind words and are glad to hear that we are your go-to guys for car repairs! Have a wonderful day, and we look forward to working with you again in the future.

name: Sarah Kirkland
text: Probably one of the worst customer service experiences I’ve ever had in my life. In short, I had to have it towed there TWICE because they never fixed the problem in the first place, my CAR WAS STOLEN because they left the keys in the car overnight, and then they jerked me around for months after and even refused to pay for getting a new key (that was stolen out of the car.) The owner seems nice, but the people at the front of the house constantly lied to me and my family. Awful, awful service.

text: Had multiple services done on my truck including: lift install, tpms calibration, and alignment. All services done in a timely manner at very reasonable prices. Highly recommend and will be back!

Super awesome helpful staff and will definitely use them again in the future.

name: Deanna Helton
text: So I post many reviews and honestly I hate for them to be negative but I have had a horrible experience here. I went in on Tuesday 12/18 because my car was running hot. Tammy was nice enough to give me a ride home while I waited. Firstly my car was not correctly diagnosed I spent over 500$ here and still having the same issue. When I picked it up drove toward Wal-Mart it immediately got hot so the looked at it again right before closing then i leave again same thing finally I park in publix to let it cool down. Again in the morning I take it back. Again they check it send me on my way 30 minutes later car hot again. I call and was pretty much brushed off and was told that they fixed what they thought was the problem. So as of right now I've been charged all this money car still running hot n they acting like it's cool I came in with 1 problem which has still not to be resolved. I will I'm so disappointed I travel alot for work and I'm in Alabama all alone no family I came here expecting a1 service seeing that it's connected to a napa but to spend this type of money and my issue not be fixed I'm so disappointed. Now I have to go get my car worked on all over again so I can hopefully make it home for Christmas.

name: Randy Jaudon
text: Great Place, Quick, Clean  & Friendly.  Tammy was great.  I have a new place to service my vehicle.

text: BEWARE....Don’t trust these guys. We needed a headlight changed on our Prius. We were told how much. When we returned to get the car they charged us an extra $15.00 because they said in was hard! My husband asked well why didn’t you call us first to make sure it was okay. They didn’t have an answer.

name: Wj Brown
text:
My daughter’s 07 Kia Sorento stopped on her on the freeway in Atlanta, she had it towed to a shop in Atlanta. They replaced the battery and alternator 500.00.  Two weeks later she is getting warning lights on the dashboard. Fearing that it might be more problems, when she came home for a wedding, I called Greystone Auto and took it in for a diagnostic. In less then 30 mins, results were in; defective alternator(new) . The folks at Greystone called the Atlanta shop and coordinated an under warranty replacement. That was a blessing not to have to worry about my daughter having a malfunctioning car while living there alone.
I have always gotten good service and fair prices here. I have had at least 5 repairs done there and never a complaint.
Thanks Brooke and all the folks there for easing our anxieties.! Now I have another review to write about that Atlanta shop 😡!

name: Marnie Cowan
text: We recently took a car here to get a pre-purchase inspection done, and had a great experience as they were professional, efficient and knowledge and offered a reasonable price.

name: Karen Estes
text:
Women: do not go there! Send a man!  I had trouble getting someone at the desk. I need a new light for my brakes (just one). They wanted $40.00 and I have the bulb !  No respect !!
As a woman I am used to being taken advantage of!!!!!!’

resp.text: Hello, Karen. Unfortunately we were slammed this morning so we apologize if we were not able to get to you sooner at the counter. We were not able to install this for you because you bought the part through Autozone and for legal reasons we must install our own parts in the shop. We would never discriminate or take advantage of anyone based on their gender, the reason we could not help you is simply because the part was not purchased through us. If you'd like to discuss this further, feel free to call us at the shop. Thank you.

name: Doug Lunsford
text: Thought I needed a tire after I had badly scuffed one (including a small piece out of the rubber). The service guy checked it out thoroughly with me and discussed options, including not buying a tire until later. I really appreciated that they didn't just sell me a tire (since he knew I thought I'd have to have one) but talked me through the pros and cons of the choices. So I'm waiting a while, unless I have to go on a trip, but you can bet I'll buy it here.

Every other sentence was this is a cash car. He kept saying cash cars don't last long and I had to realize it was a cash car. His rudeness didn't allow me to think of purchasing a cash car nor a financed car. I could have done either but not with them.

resp.text: Hi Danita R., thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at Capitol Chevrolet Montgomery Service Department. We're happy we could meet your expectations! We sincerely thank you for the positive review, and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Adam Mattes
text: Went to get a misfire diagnosed and no suprise they diagnosed me with a misfire but wouldn't tell me anything past that. Instead they wanted $1200 to replace my spark plugs (they had just been replaced), spark plug wires, and clean my throttle body. A quick look at the throttle body would have told them it was clean. A quick look at the spark plugs would have told you they were correct and attaching a multimeter to the wires can tell you if they pass. They did not check my fuel pressure (takes 2 seconds with the proper tool) or my fuel injectors and did not check the camshaft position sensor which I think (again I didnt get it diagnosed) is wrong. They will say I refused further diagnosis when I refused replacement of everything but what I really refused is their poor excuse of what I diagnosed is. My though is take your money and run I can learn what they told me just sitting in my driveway.

name: Phillip Dunn
text: Oil change was 69.00 yesterday I was told by service adviser, today I paided 83.00 plus. Price change over night. Damm!

name: Kendra Washington
text: Got the car I wanted

name: Mark Brogdon
text: I live in Florida and found a Jeep Wrangler they had there online. Before I left, I called to make sure it was still there. Mr. Ricky Jones said "let me call you right back, I'm going to walk out there and put my eyes on it before I tell you to drive 3 hours up here." He called back within 10 minutes and told me he had pulled it off the lot and to come on. That started how great the service and experience was there. Everyone was super friendly and personable. I didn't feel like I was being hustled or pressured into buying anything. Even though they aren't a Jeep dealership, they knew the answers to my questions regarding the jeep. I ended up buying it and couldn't have had a better experience, all the way from Mr Ricky in sales to AJ in finance office. Super easy buying experience!

name: Leon Howard
text: Several employees didn't have a mask on. I didn't get the answers for replacing my tires. I was disappointed with service.

text: I drove from Mississippi to Montgomery Alabama to purchase a pre owned hyundai elantra from Capitol Chevrolet of Montgomery. It was priced $4000 below retail.  I worked specifically with Quenita Mitchell, and S M Harris, who went out of their way to make sure I received the best deal possible. The facilities are very nice, and the staff is extremely friendly knowledgeable and helpful.

name: Giuliana Marie Marinucci
text: I went in to look at the 2018 Traverse on 9/16/2017. When I arrived, I was looking at the vehicle from the outside in before being approached by a salesperson. When the lady finally came up to assist me, I asked if I could look inside of the vehicle - if she had the keys - because the truck was locked. She told me "no" but she could take me inside and give me the specs for the vehicle from the tablet. Ok, fine... thats good for the moment. We get in and she starts running numbers on what the payment would be and telling me what the truck had it in based on what was on her tablet... disregarding the fact I asked her multiple times to go outside and get it unlocked so that I could get inside of it and look. I know what I can afford, I already did the numbers before I got here. All I wanted to do was look at it and see if it fit my family's needs. She finally unlocked it but when I started touching the touch screen she yelled at me like I was a kid even though there was little damage I could do to the vehicle (not that it was my intentions but) since the vehicle was in demo mode. I was also not allowed to sit in the drivers seat. She had told me multiple times that the truck was out of my price range, knowing NOTHING about my finances because I had not yet disclosed that information in any form. Then she had the "manager" come out and he told me the same thing, that I couldnt afford this vehicle but they could put me in a cheaper vehicle. Long story short, they lost a purchase from a client who makes over $100k per year because "I couldnt afford that vehicle". We will take out business on to Prattville to the Chevy dealer up here when they get the 2018 Traverse in stock.

name: Captain_Catbeard
text: I am so very thankful that this company and the people that work for it exist. I'm a retired disabled vet living with my partner and two cats on the road in our 1977 Dodge American Clipper RV and our mechanical fuel pump went out while traveling through town. I called several mechanics in the area but Anderson Motor company were the only ones willing to help us out. Originally I was told that they may not be able to get to it until Wednesday on a Friday which would have taken us out of our home, but after explaining that situation to Chris at the shop he did everything in his power to get us back on the road. Even though they were backed up Chris made our problem his problem and bless him for getting us back on the road that day. Our two cats were also very happy to get home. We were treated like family by the front staff and I would recommend this shop a thousand times over. Great people great prices. Thank God for Anderson Motor Company they really saved our butts.

resp.text: Oh my gosh!! Thank you Travis! We all were speaking about how kind you and your lady were and such a pleasure to help out. It was very thoughtful and well appreciated to get such a great review from you. Happy travels and we hope to see you whenever you come this way again for an update on your adventures!

name: Samuel Hunt
text: I attempted to take my vehicle in for repairs two different times. I received a quote for a front end overhaul, and a fuel pump replacement. The charges, in my opinion, were so outrageous to me that I decided to go somewhere else for both repairs. I am not a wealthy person. When they told me the cost of the part and the 55% markup of an additional $160 to me just for the part, they told me "I have to keep the shop in business". The labor was going to be an additional $100/hr. What they don't know is I know how to look up the cost of the part. I also know they receive discounts from parts suppliers when sourcing parts for repairs. They were going to charge me full retail for the part, and then add an additional 50% markup to me???!!!! That is outrageous. I will never be back to that shop and waste my time. It is unfortunate ☹️ that you can't trust auto repair places in Huntsville because this is how they gouge their customers and rip them off. When I complained about it being too much and unreasonable, he justified it by saying that's what all the shops in Huntsville do. I just moved here a year ago. Although I have been blessed in my past getting auto repair service from shops/owners who I became friends with, I would never have expected shops in Huntsville operate like they do.

resp.text: Mr. Hunt was never paid us to repair a vehicle. He has brought different vehicles here various times, got our diagnosis and he did the work himself. We charged him a checkout fee the last time and he obviously doesn't believe our time and effort matters. We are a very honest and upfront business and sincerely take great care with our customers. Some people cannot be pleased, this is the case here.

name: Kristian King
text: This man is awful. Worst customer service I've ever experienced. Will never return to this over priced hack shop.

resp.text:
King Incident – 8-7-2017

The car was towed in with the symptoms of no crank and no start. It was apparent someone had been working on it prior to it arriving at Anderson Motor Company since the area around the fuse panel was disassembled, screws were left on the floor, etc. The Kings told us they had already replaced the battery, the starter, and an alternator to no avail.

The first thing found during diagnosis was a burnt ignition switch. After a new ignition switch was installed, the same fuse blew again. It was apparent at this point that the vehicle was in a shorted state.

Next, we began pulling the wiring diagrams. From the fuse panel we checked the following components one by one:
-	Fuel injection
-	Ignition coils
-	Instrument cluster
-	Circuit opening relay
-	Charging circuit
We determined the location of the electrical short was the junction box interior fuse panel. The junction box was available from the dealer at a cost of $340.97 with a delay of several days before one could be obtained. Mrs. King informed us that she could not wait for the part and did not want to pay the quoted price for it either. We bypassed the junction box and ignition switch. The vehicle now starts and runs. Most importantly, the root cause of all her electrical problems was that her husband installed a battery and hooked it up backwards, thereby shorting out the system. He self-installed the alternator, battery, and starter, and still had the no crank/no start symptoms. Mrs. King called at least twice a day and was constantly aware of our progress on her vehicle.
She was happy during the process and had no problem with the cost until she informed us she wanted to pay with her mother’s credit card. We asked that her mother complete our credit card authorization form, which we require for all off-site credit card transactions. At this point, she became extremely hostile and her whole behavior towards the shop changed. She cursed my receptionist and my service manager, spewing F-bombs, etc. This occurred on a Friday
(8-4-17). On the following Monday (8-7-17), she came to pick up the vehicle and used a card with a different name than we had listed for her in our system. She stated that it was her maiden name and she hadn’t changed everything over yet. Her husband said the same. At this point, I asked to see her driver’s license to confirm that her ID matched the credit card she was presenting for payment. She went ballistic – screaming, cussing, and completely belligerent. She called her mother and put her on the phone with me and I calmly explained the situation.
Mrs. King’s mother then emailed her approval to use the credit card and the payment was processed. The Kings left at that point.

name: Angela Wilson
text: Zee

resp.text: Angela, thanks so much for this review. Let us know if we can do anything else for you. =The Anderson Motor Company team

name: Cliff McGinness
text:
I've been a loyal customer for years on my many different vehicles. They were just completely unprofessional and rude to me! I will not be back again! There are a million repair shops around town, find a different one to take your vehicle to.
In response to their reply, they have no idea what was going on and are completely incorrect! They immediately made assumptions and asked me to leave! I even went back in to try and give her another chance to listen, but just more ridiculousness. Go through the Google and Facebook reviews, I'm not the only one

resp.text: I refused to add damage to Mr. McGinness's estimate for body work that I had written prior 06/15/18 and that he was attempting to get someone else to pay for. He wanted to add headlamps and a mirror which I have photographs proving were not part of the original accident. I am a professional, not a liar or a cheat. My photos show a perfectly intact passenger mirror, etc... which were on the opposite side of the original damaged area (driver's side). We appreciate all of our customers and their patronage, but we will not compromise our ethics for anyone.

name: Katie Tyler
text: Husband had a flat on the interstate today. Thanks for helping so quickly and professionally.

name: tommy george
text: Good place to have ur car worked on

name: G P
text: Very friendly very nice people very busy as well had to wait a little while but was worth it try to catch him when they're not so busy and you're doing great good luck on that though

name: Mr Magik
text: I highly recommend this place to everybody, great people

name: Sean Fitzgerald
text: Traveling through on vacation we had a problem with our car.  The immediately fixed it. Honest place to go if in need anything.

name: Tim Sanders
text: Great work good price

name: Joseph Law
text: Best experience

name: Joe Mann
text: Great place to take your car!!!

name: Rhianna Messing
text: Was not impressed.

name: Charlene McClure
text: Very nice guys

name: vincenzo ceccarelli
text:
High quality work, fair prices, and excellent service. My wife and I are new to town and found Superior Auto Care on Google. I have two separate experiences to share.

1. After completing our move from Washington state, Philip got us right in to look at the brakes on my wife’s Subaru and do an oil change.  He had his techs do a thorough inspection only to find that the brakes were good and just a little squeaky. The labor cost was marginal and totally worth it for the peace of mind. The oil change was also very reasonably priced.
2. Brought the Subaru back in to have the AC serviced. Once again everything was working as it should be so Philip threw me the keys and sent me on my way free of charge.

Honesty and integrity go a long way with me. Philip has both of those qualities and will have my business for as long as his shop is open. If you’re on the fence about where to take your ride, Philip at Superior Auto Care is your guy.

name: John Whitaker
text: A/C not cooling as it should. A national oil change chain business told me the A/C compressor had to be replaced, approximately $800, or           $ 1400 with a warranty. I searched here and found Superior Auto Care. Problem resolved (replaced low Freon). I couldn't be more pleased with their honest and friendly service. They have all my auto repair business from now on. I'm not saying the national business tried to rip me off, they may have just been incompetent.

name: Bill Stratman
text: The mechanic is fantastic. They replaced my engine and did it right the first time. No loose bolts or missing parts. Everything was done right. Very thorough.

name: Gideon Rah
text: Deserves five stars. Friendly help. Goes above and beyond.

name: Haley Wood
text:
Truly top notch service and has my business forward. Now let me tell a story.....

My wife’s car was giving vibrations by my own accord and felt by the look of things, balancing would fix the issue. She was due new tires but I had a month or so before committing to new set. The tires had whooped out on the back two, but good tread even in the low spot and could not be balanced.  Still safe just rough riding by my account. Ordered tires, set up an appointment with a different tire shop on Saturday,  loaded up the new tires in her car. Saturday appointment was not booked (I can’t get it done) so I figure I would set up an appointment with another local shop close to work for Tuesday.

Monday...

My wife calls me at 9 am with a blowed out tire. She already late. And she already told me them tires got to be changed before today.

(Disclaimer.:  Her car came with no spare and I had been inactively looking for one).

So I’m deep in the dog house if you didn’t read between the lines.

She gets a tow to Superior Auto Care and they get after it in due time. Not unreasonable for a spur of the moment and professionally put those new tires on I already had in the truck.(I double checked and correct torque and the exact psi to spec and not “normal” like most shops I have dealt with)

The question I had all morning..... was it my misjudgment and my wife is mad forever or was it a nail that even new tires could not prevent?

By all evidence from Superior Auto Care, it was a screw.  True detectives they are and me and my wife had a great week.

It was just a flat not a blow out by the pictures. she had. Her safety even by my own misjudgment would not have been compromised. But I’m glad it was a screws fault and not my misjudgment.

Great guys over there. Phillip was more than helpful. Couldn’t ask for better service in this situation by my wife’s accord.

She got to work late, held it over my head while I didn’t know if it was my fault. I committed to a lot of things I would do this week I had been putting off not knowing it was not my fault.  But, I’m sitting here a happy man. Walked the dog while having conversations with my wife. Deep stuff that could have went the other direction. That is if it hadn’t been for the folks at Superior Auto Care making the correct diagnosis for the problem.

name: Jacob “Jake” Lamberson
text: They do good work for a fair price.

name: I Moss
text: I got a flat going to work. I called AAA who recommended Superior Auto. Phillip answered the phone and got me in with no warning. my car was ready when I got off work. I ended up replacing all my tires and my back brakes and rotors. They didn't try to upsell me but since i had been told at my oil change that the time was coming soon they verified and replaced it while there.

name: Nichole Winters
text: They really are superior! Customer service,  detailed work, timely, and affordable. I would go back for all of my car needs, if I didn't love out of town.

name: Kay H
text: Exceptional service. Was pleasantly greeted as soon as I entered the door. The owner took his time and addressed my  questions patiently. The mechanic was just as friendly. They made sure I was satisfied with the completed work and didn't overcharge me or upsell parts. I would highly recommend this shop.

name: Dave Sunderland
text:
One of the few places I've gone and got honest feedback on my vehicle.
Very reasonable prices.
Philip is awesome!

name: Rashid Beisenov
text: Great place. Very good service. Phillip is awesome and Eric is good master!

name: Derick Houser
text:
Excellent customer service
Great work to my car and repaired my car in great time frame
Nothing but good things to say I would recommend to anyone looking for auto care or repair

name: Ray Feltner
text: Great work but I spent more than I wanted. The cheap fix wasnt the fix... of course. I wished they would have followed up with me more and explained in detail the work. You spend $1400 I feel you should feel better about the work that was done.

resp.text: Sorry you feel that way Ray.  Please come by and discuss this further with us.   We will make it right!

name: Samuel Dawes
text: I hesitate to give these guys 5 stars..... Only because of how great they are, i want them to stay a secret of Madison;) truly the nicest mechanic shop I've encountered in Alabama. Recommended👍

name: Bill Hansen
text: I was very pleased with the job performed, the owner Philip and main mechanic Eric. The work was very well done and they even fixed a couple other minor things I was not aware of that was needed. They were both very patient with me when I inquired about the extra repairs. I am way out of my element when it comes to cars and it was nice to feel like these guys understood my concerns and lack of experience. Good people.

name: Aisha Robinzine
text: The best auto care I’ve ever had... honest and good pricing. If you want something done right it’s this place. It’s worth the trip from Nashville

name: Lance Kozack
text: Phillip was very nice and worked with my wife and I without question on the solution and our budget. I highly recommend them.

name: Paul Rainwater
text: They have always done the work they said they would do at fair price. I would recommend anyone to go there and get their car fixed.

name: Brighton Pollard
text: Fantastic Staff! Prices are reasonable and repairs are quick! Always a pleasure to do business with this company. Highly recommend.

name: righttospeech Flydown
text:
I was taking a cross country road trip and my AC began coming out warm. Since I was unfamiliar with the repair shops in the area I turned to the google reviews that were favorable. They got this one right! The place is nothing fancy but they fixed my issue at a very fair price and had me in and out in about a hour. What I also like about the place was that they were very polite over the phone and friendly at the shop. In addition they did not do a sell job on me to make extra money as many shops do. If I lived in the area this would be my go to mechanic.
Thank you for your service.

name: Stephen Trumbull
text: They do good work and more importantly are honest. I brought my car in for an alignment. They called and said the alignment was not the issue, a bald tire was. They could have easily added the tire to the alignment and charged me for both.

name: Chris Plott
text: Philip was super nice and kept us in the loop about our car repair. They were fast and getting our car back to us.

name: Cory Anderson
text:
Outstanding staff. I've used these guys on three occasions with three different vehicles and have been very satisfied each time.

If you're looking for a mechanic in Madison I highly recommend these guys.

name: Junior Suan
text: From my experience, these guys strive to resolve issues on your vehicle. I had the pleasure of working with both co-founders & although we did not resolve issue, being they do not go deep as far as cam phasers, I can honestly say I left feeling relieved. They were very honest. They pointed me in the right direction on issue I was having so that was highly useful. I have numerous folks who have had successful business encounters with these fellas. Definently dependable, highly trustworthy.

name: Lanny Moore
text: Its Good

name: Jason Tynes
text: Been using this shop for 7 years. HONEST mechanics. And good. Highly recommended.

name: Carlos Bryant
text: Great guys. Good experience. I brought them a ghost of a problem and they somehow worked it out. Very fair. And nothing beats integrity. I usually do all the work on my vehicles, but if I ever need a pro, these are the guys.

name: Elizabeth Tanner
text: I dropped my car off overnight and left the note stating I needed an oil change and wanted them to look at brakes. They called the next morning saying they changed my brakes and when they tried to even out the rotors they weren't able to do it. They never even called to tell me I needed new brakes first so I was forced into this service and their prices. I wasn't thrilled by the lack of communication but honestly I needed brakes so it didn't matter. I told him I'd be there before they closed and asked him to call me if for some reason it wasn't ready and he said okay. I show up before they closed and he looked at me like I had 3 heads and said my car wouldn't be ready until the next day and that they were very busy and i should have called and checked (...which I did when he called about the brakes). I'm new to the area and didn't know anyone so I had been walking to/from there in 100 degree weather. The lack of communication was very frustrating. The man did apologize and even offered to drive me home (which is why they get 2 stars) but I would not recommend this place for their lack of communication.

resp.text: Sorry for the miscommunication.  We hope to do better.   For those reading this - please call us before coming as things do happen that push completion dates/times out.  We can only try and we are here for our customers to help not hurt.

name: Ashley Fountaine
text: Polite but overly-expensive. $170 diagnostic and they still didn't know what was wrong with my car. They obviously think their tools are made of gold. ;)

name: Shane Knox
text: Do not use them!! I made an appointment (four days in advance), then it was three days more until they even looked at it. They misdiagnosed the problem three times, tried to get me to pay for work that did not need to be done, and charged me double what it should have cost for what they did do. The mechanic is incompetent and the owner is dishonest.

resp.text: Shane,  we are very sorry that you feel this way about the service we provided.   Please contact us as soon as possible to discuss where we can improve and the issues you bring up, where we might improve or resolve to your liking.  We are not here to get rich, but to help our customers.   Waiting to hear from you phone or come by as you are able.

name: Scott A
text: Great prices

name: Joseph Gooding
text: Honest, quality service every time.

name: Maryann Hockman
text: Need help just before closing, my car would not start.Great service

name: Tracy Swatfager
text: Great service

name: Alisha Black
text: Good service

name: Sean Jensen
text: This shop and the employees saved me over Memorial Day weekend. My trailer picked up a nail in one of the tires and obviously leaking air. Even though they were booked for the whole weekend they were able to squeeze me in to patch and plug my tire. This got me back on the road so I could get all the way back to Texas without missing work. I am very grateful for what they did for me, and the staff working extra to accommodate me. Very friendly and professional shop will recommend for anything you need.

name: Robert Burns
text: A welcome and much-needed addition to the Auburn Opelika area. Firestone has been there for us for years and has serviced all of our vehicles! Most definitely glad to have them in town!

name: Haley Sherman
text: Today was such a great experience! Earnest and Tiffany were SO KIND and patient with me. It was my first time buying new tires and they walked me through that process very well. They also made sure to check other aspects of my car to make sure it was safe when I left the store. I will FOR SURE be going back there. Good people. High quality work. What more could you ask for?

resp.text: Hi Haley, we appreciate the feedback so much. It's great hearing our services met your expectations! Thank you for stopping by our Firestone! ^Blake

name: Sandra Hull
text: I was driving home to ATL and my check engine light came on. I stopped in at Firestone and was well taken care of. Everyone here was kind, helpful and informative.  I truly felt like I was a priority as everyone here worked fast and efficient just so I could get back onto the road and make it home. Thank you again Tiffany and Earnest for your help!

name: Nate VanderWoude
text: I went in for an oil change on a Sunday, which is a walk-in only time. I fully understand that wait times are longer with a shorter staff, and no scheduled times. I got there at 1pm and was told that it wouldn't be done until 3-3:30. Again, it's a long wait, but I understand. At about 3, another customer comes in for a new battery. He is given an estimate that it will be about 5 when his vehicle is ready. At 3:45 both of our cars are taken to the back by the same technician. Again, this is already 15 minutes past my estimated completion time. My car is lifted, and the oil is drained. The tech then moved to the battery change, and worked there until it was completed at 4:15. He then disappeared, then came back and finished my oil change at 4:45. Again, I am a reasonable customer, but having another customer moved in front of me for no reason, causing me to wait for nearly 4 hours is absolutely unacceptable. I won't be going back.

name: Jared Stauffer
text: I came in at 4:55 on Sunday with a nail in my tire. I was on my way back from Auburn and heading the whole way to South Carolina. I didn’t realize I had a nail until I was on the road. Paul and his team were more than happy to help. Firestone closes at 5 pm on Sunday, but they stayed late just to help patch my tire. Super grateful for them. Will be coming back to Firestone in the future!!

name: T Potts
text: Pretty clean shop area. Usually quite busy. Appointment recommended. They've done quite a few repairs on my old pickup truck and so far I'm well pleased with results.

name: Joshua Jones
text: When their competitors were having a day off, the good people at Firestone saved the day by not only having the scarce tire I was looking for, but was able toput it on the very same day!

name: Chicky The Awesome
text: I love Tiffany the manager. We were there getting tires but they also let us know our battery was low. Excellent service. Paid for 4 new tires and a lifetime warranty alignment cheaper here than three other places that I called for a quote. They have my business from here on out. Great folks and excellent service and quality maintenance.

name: Alisha Walker
text: I went in for a oil change, and the next day my oil light came on. I called and someone told me they probably didn’t put enough oil in it.. a month later my car started making noise because I didn’t have anyone oil at all. They never game me a sticker in the left corner to let me know when I should get another one. Wouldn’t recommend when it comes to the an oil change!!!

name: Michael Easterwood
text: Very nice people working here. I highly recommend this place.

name: James Acord
text: My family and I have been long term Firestone customer. We’ve been to countless Firestones and I can reassure you this one is the best of them all. There is a common denominator and that is the supervisor Tiffany Stevens. She goes completely above and beyond to service her customers and treat them right. If there was a definition of perfect customer service she meets & exceeds those expectations. She was previously at the Fort Benning Firestone that my father goes to and she was phenomenal there. Her leadership at this firestone proves to build the brand and cement our trust in the company. I honestly can’t thank her enough for how kind and helpful she has been to us - She truly deserves infinite praise & recognition for her hard work.

name: Michael Brown
text: Good customer service they explain everything clearly

name: Patrick strickland
text: Very friendly staff did alignment and was quick and very nice. Tiffany was very helpful.

name: Jonathan Keaton
text: Scratched all four of my wife’s rims on her Tahoe and the manager Tiffany said get a quote and they would fix it. Got a quote and she said it was to high so went and got another quote and she said it was turned over to corporate. They absolutely will not pay for there mistakes and make it right with the customer. Never dealt with anything like it in my life. Terrible!!!

resp.text: Hello Jonathan, we are sorry to hear of this issue after service at our Opelika store. We would like to investigate your concerns, please, send us an email to, socialcare@bfrc.com. We will need full details, your contact information, and your invoice number. Thank you for choosing Firestone, we value your business. ^Kristyn

name: Tim Hornsby
text: Recently, my daughter was Traveling from Auburn back to Atlanta.  Before leaving she discovered that one of her tires was very low on Air.  I called Firestone Opelika, AL, since they were the only store open on Sunday.  Paul answered the phone and said he'd be able to look at the tire but wasn't sure he'd have time to fix it since it was almost closing.  The tire had a nail and was not repairable.  Paul worked overtime to make the car safe for my daughter so she could get back home.  Firestone, thank you for caring and providing incredible service.  Next time I'm calling Firestone first.

name: Stephanie S
text: Employee's are nice but when you have an appointment there really slow.

name: K Verb
text: Wow, these guys are the best auto service ever. Shredded two high load trailer tires on the freeway on a Saturday before Father's Day, two hours before closing. They had me in and out in 30 minutes for each tire. Did I mention I had to come back for the second tire? They fit me in between other jobs and got me back on the interstate; kept me from being stranded in town on Father's Day weekend. All was with a smile and a great attitude of, we will get you fixed and on your way, don't worry.

name: Shikera B.
text: A huge thank you to Tiffany for making sure my two day process was completed and my car was taken care of. A company MUST go above and beyond to receive FIVE STARS on any review I complete... Ms. B, a satisfied, loyal customer.

name: edwina halliday
text: Great place. Nicest and caring staff. They didn't think they were able to fix my truck even good enough for the 200 miles I needed to get back home. But they did a wonderful job. The truck levelled out the closer to home I got the better the truck ran.

name: Bettie Whyte
text: A huge thank you to Tiffany for making sure my two day process was completed and my car was taken care of. A company MUST go above and beyond to receive FIVE STARS on any review I complete... Ms. Blakely a satisfied loyal customer.

name: Danny Hale
text: Good people , good service !

name: Deborah Hodges
text: Great service..We had car trouble while traveling through. They were great. Got us back on the road in a very timely manner.

name: Edward Dellascio
text: Fast and courteous

name: Judith Goggans
text: Had a flat tire on the interstate during a very rainy evening minutes away from business. I called to find out how to get to them the quickest because I knew it was closing time according to their website. They got me in and out in a hurry, I ended up having to buy a new tire but it was worth them waiting until I got there to see if they could patch the other tire.

resp.text: Judith, we're so glad that you chose us for your automotive needs. Now, you're a part of the Firestone family! ^Alexis

name: Arturo Vegas
text: We came here in an emergency after finding a slow leak in one of our tires. They were extremely courteous and fast. My overall stay was about an hour or less. Also the place inside was clean and they have a TV for your wait time or there are some shops within walking distance for that too. The parking was not bad and bathroom was clean. Very pleased with the service here.

name: S. S. C.
text: I took my suv there for a tire that they did not have they said they would have the tire the next day so two days later I went to another tire shop and they replaced it the same day save yourself a headache and go somewhere else

resp.text: Hello. We can only imagine how frustrating this was for you, and we apologize. We'd be happy to escalate your concerns to the appropriate management team. Please, feel welcome to email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with these details of your visit, the store location, any related invoice numbers, and your contact information. We appreciate your business with Firestone, and we look forward to your message. ^Mariah

name: Heather Randolph
text: Very friendly and helpful.

name: crdubalyah
text: Super helpful staff. Got my alignment just right and done quickly too!

resp.text: crdubalyah, thank you for choosing Firestone! We look forward to your next visit. ^Jennifer

name: Trayvis Minnifield
text: Great very Great

name: Brittany B Lipscomb
text: Honestly, this review is long overdue. First of all, I never thought a place like this could provide great customer service. But I'm glad that I was wrong. Jim is one of the best mechanics. It is awesome that I can call him and he will literally take time to help me figure out what is going on with my car when I'm2 hours away. He also drove me to work when I was dropping my car off so I didn't have to walk in the cold to work while being sick. He also was willing to drive to Atlanta while my car was having mechanic issues but thankfully, I was able to drive home with his help. I'm not sure what I can say to make you understand that all the amazing guys who work here genuinely care about you. The best part about this place that I frequently visit is that they love my 78 lb dog Waffle and are great about him visiting when the car needs work. They often ask about him if he is not with me. My first encounter with Firestone was with Brandon but since he left, I love the whole team. Thanks Firestone for taking care of me, I am so glad that you are serving Opelika with amazing customer service. I really am grateful to y'all!!

name: Rick Richards
text: I'm pretty cynical about most repair shops, but the folks at your store are just outstanding.  They could not have been more helpful, kind and knowledgeable.  You've got a great team and thanks again

name: JSS Development and JS Management
text: I went there with four new tires I bought off the web For a lot less than they wanted for tires and they said they could not change them that day they were very rude this is my first and last experience at this place

name: Sanghoon Hong
text:
Had my summer tires mounted and aligned a few days ago here. This weekend, I was doing some maintenance on the car in the garage which required me to take the wheels off and oh my did Firestone over torque the lug bolts to hell.
The spec for my BMW is around 103 lbs-ft for the bolts and so usually I'll just pop it off with my impact wrench and go on with my day. My impact wrench wasn't loosening the bolts. OK, maybe it's dying. So I got my breaker bar out and had the back workout of my life. One of the bolts, I had to stand and jump on the breaker bar to loosen it....come on guys, I don't even want to think about what that was torqued to...
Yall made me think my trusty impact wrench was failing me
And they charged me for tire disposal, even though I took the all-season tires that was taken off back with me... but thats a story for another time.

resp.text: Hello Sanghoon, we are sorry to hear about this issue after tire service and would be happy to help. Please, send us an email to, socialcare@bfrc.com, with full details, your contact information, and the store's full address. You are a valued Firestone customer, and we hope to hear from you soon. ^Kristyn

name: grady simpson
text: Paul was awesome. Needed air in the tires of an RV we had just purchased. Paul, who I assumed was the service manager, said sure and personally came out and aired the tires up. It's hard to find customer service like that nowadays. Oh, it was also 5 minutes before closing and no charge.

name: Michael Waldrep
text: Was not satisfied with service and neither was lady customer in line ahead of me,she was complaining also.

resp.text: Michael, we appreciate you bringing this to our attention. This is not the type of service that we expect our loyal customers to receive, and we truly apologize. Please feel welcome to email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with the details of your visit, the store, and your contact information. We value your business, and we thank you for contacting Firestone. ^Jennifer

name: Expert Reviewer
text:
Went to avail myself of my lifetime alignment that I bought and have not used. They told me it would be an hour and they would call when it was ready, so I walked to Lowe's to shop. After several hours and no phone call, I called and was told we cannot touch your car because it is a liability if we do because there is metal showing through and you have to buy tires or we cannot let you go. Started to buy the tires and then realized that the tires had a warranty because they were not that old. So I call and tell them to cancel putting new tires on it. I take it to get the Goodyear warranty honored. Then find out there is NOT any metal showing through the tires and the tires still have mileage. They flat out lied!

I will NEVER buy any products from them ever. I don't care if they are selling tires for half the price of other stores.

name: carina santiago
text: Life savers!! Great service and friendly staff!

name: carina santiago
text: Life savers!! Great service and friendly staff!

name: Aubieone
text: They’ve done front brakes and a TPMS sensor on my truck and a blend door actuator on my SUV. All work was great and was done in a timely manner. My “Only” gripe is I don’t believe they should be charging $10-$20 for diagnostic if they perform the work.. most places drop that charge if the work is performed otherwise I’d give 5 stars. Please consider that Firestone.

name: william phillips
text: Quick and professional!

name: Kevin McSpadden
text: I wanted to get the battery checked out on my daughter's car that we recently bought along with an alignment check (due to me recently placing struts on her car) and the tires re-balanced(they did not balance them correctly a couple of weeks ago, car still shaking in rear at certain speeds). Tires still out of balance and was misled on what was wrong with the battery.  Store Manager, Tiffany Stevens, would not even acknowledge me when I asked her if I could speak to her.  She didn't act like she even cared at all.  Techs get paid by the job and by how much labor is, keep that in mind if you do not take heed to this review.

name: Mannus Foster
text: Good people and service

name: Tabitha Prestridge
text: Very friendly and great service

name: Dennis Moore
text: Just needed air in my tires. Very friendly person at counter.

name: Kimberly W
text: I am so excited to finally have a Firestone in Opelika! The staff was very friendly and cheerful.  The service advisor did not try to pressure me into having service done.  He stated what was needed at the time and did not press for anything additional, I appreciate that.  Very friendly atmosphere.

name: A E
text: I was satisfied with my scope of service, oil change, nail in tire, honored my coupon.  Thanks guys!!

name: Amanda Holloway
text: I have an 09 Honda Civic and I took it to this location because my a/c went out and I have always heard good things about Firestone.I dropped my car off so they could diagnosis the problem and was called about an hour later stating that my a/c compressor went out due to old age and it would be $1296.00 to fix. I went and picked my car up and refused the recommended work. Luckily, I went and got a second opinion from a local mechanic who immediately stated that it was more then likely just the A/C relay switch. And after about 30 minutes my a/c was fixed and it only cost me $50.00. Not sure why Firestone would try to charge me for something that was not broken. I will never recommend this location to anyone because I feel they tried to rip me off.

name: Carl Crawford
text: Good service

name: A E
text: I was satisfied with my scope of service, oil change, nail in tire, honored my coupon.  Thanks guys!!

name: Tim Smith
text: Pleasant attitude and fast service today

resp.text: Tim, cars are our passion, but your are our priority. Thank you for choosing Firestone. ^Alexis

name: Leslie Carmichael
text: Fast service and they did my oil change 15 minutes before close! Other places turned me away 1hr before close saying they didn't have enough time to complete the work.

name: Andy Thee
text: Super fast service and friendly staff.

name: Debbie Tucker

text: Awesome job! Super fast and great service! I'll definitely use them again! Thanks guys!

name: Tizzo Heavy

name: Bruce Maurmeier
text: Friendly.

name: Tracey Blackmon
text: We had a blow out in our camper and we stopped to see if they had the tire we needed to replace it. Not only did they have it they put it in for us and we purchased two tires for a great price!

text: Nice people....

text: Stopped by asked for advice the technician was very helpful

name: Bill Fredette
text: Great service and super nice people!

name: j barnes
text: Very happy with the service! Awesome people to deal with!!

name: Alrendria Blaze
text: Good service, as always.
