text: Nice location easy to get to

name: george reagan
text: Very pleased

name: Aaron Ryals
text: I purchased a brand new vehicle from them April 29th. The service until the sell was made was nothing short of phenomenal. However, it ended there. It’s now been 5 weeks and they still haven’t sent my paperwork to my county for me to be able to purchase my tag. My wife and I have called multiple times and we get the same response. We will check and call you back. Guess what....no one ever calls back. I’m completely frustrated and have received warnings for no tag, so I now have a vehicle I can’t drive because I’m way beyond my 10 business days to have a tag. I recommend you shop somewhere else. I should have paid more and purchased local.

name: Mohammed ALKhateeb
text: Love the service,  love the cars and every one friendly!

name: tina morgan
text:
We purchased a renegade from Mikail. He was very helpful and made it a very easy purchase.
The entire staff also made us feel welcome which we’ve had bad experiences at other dealerships. We will definitely buy from them again! Thank you Mikail!

name: A. Mck80
text: My experience at Autonation was awesome. My service advisor was Jason Williams and he saw to it that I had awesome service. Not only did he greet me when I drove up to the service center, but he made sure I had beverages to drink, he checked in with frequently to keep me informed of the progress they were making on automobile, and he saw to it that I received the services I requested and I received them in a timely manner. He was absolutely awesome and I will come back again.

name: LaToya B
text: This place was the absolute worse place I ever been to for car repair service. They were very unprofessional. They lied to me and told me my services would be covered under warranty. They said they called and then told me later warranty was not covering. My car went into the shop running and was there for 3 weeks. When I tried to go get it now they are saying it needs a whole new motor. It was so many levels to this, but I would never in my life ever buy a Dodge and I will never go to that dealership again. Everyone that work there is a complete joke.

name: Christopher Peters
text: They have trouble wearing masks correctly. Also, the Service department treats customers like an after thought.

name: jan vickers
text: automation is awesome! they bought my vehicle and found the exact suv I wanted!! Alexis was so sweet, and oh so helpful!

name: Jackie Camp
text: When my 2014 Chrysler 200 needs service I take it to AutoNation because they are professional and they check everything to make sure no issues arise.  When it's going to be a long wait they come and let you know were they are on each step of repair.  They always have coffee and water if needed.  They also check on recall parts so you want have to come back they fix it doing your service visit.  They always offer other discounts on oil changes, tires and other necessities.  I wouldn't take my Chrysler anywhere else.

name: Matt Montenegro
text: Some of the most sleezy people that give all car sales men a bad name. Purchased a used vehicle from this dealership in May of 2020. I was sold when I was told that my vehicle had an Auto Nation warranty of "90 days or 4,000 miles." Sounds great doesn't it? Well after being hurried along in signing paperwork so the vehicle could be mine I was very happy with my purchase. However, less than a month later, and still well within my "warranty" coverage period I got a Christmas tree of lights on my dashboard. I was told to take it to its dealership and from there I could then make the claim. When I called to make the claim, Auto Nation's warranty service said there was no vehicle with my VIN in the system. I then called the manager there who told me, "I never signed any contract stating I had a warranty and it doesn't matter what I was told because it isn't in writing." I realized the manager was right about this however, I was being told one thing then they intentionally rushed me through signing paperwork so that I wouldn't catch that I never signed anything for my "warranty". The deceptive methods of these people shows that they are talented at one thing and, one thing only and, that is lying to people. These people are clearly slimy and cannot be trusted, save yourself the hassle and do not purchase a vehicle from here. Learn from my mistake, don't come here. Where ever you do go, whatever you are offered make sure it is in writing!!!!

name: William Mott
text: The two service advisors I usually deal with are Michael Robinson and Ken Baker; they are always friendly and helpful. I dropped off my truck for service (oil change, tire rotation, etc.) and Ken Baker called back to notify me that my vehicle was ready. As far I know, the work was done satisfactorily.

name: Charles Bailey
text: I’ve never had any problems with them. Good quality work on time. They’ll tell you if something else needs to be looked at.

name: Samantha Stefan
text: I have purchased 3 Vehicles from this Dealership with my Husband and have had the same salesman Austyn ! He is Humble and Honest and that means a lot these days when purchasing a vehicle. They met my expectations and we will continue to buy from here as long as he is there. The best experiences I have ever had at any Dealership and I have bought many vehicles in my lifetime!!! Thank you Austyn you Rock !!!

name: Alfonso Packer
text: Consumer service was very poor. Upon arrival to pick up my car after recall work I had to stand in the lobby for 20mins before I was even acknowledged to get help. Then the service guy who said he had my paper so he would him me continued a phone call for an additional 30 mins. It didn’t bother me until I heard the conversation, which seemed personal not AutoNation business related, so I decided to go to parts while I waited to get so things. That department was great. After finishing up he still was on phone so I went to someone else to see if I could be helped then he decided to pull up my paperwork and noticed it was a recall job and only need a signature and to hand me my keys. I will never probably use the service department if that was a example of the customer service to expect.

name: Richard Dodson
text: Had some warranty work done on my 2019 Ram 1500. Troy was very knowledgeable of what needed to be done, and the service technicians did a great with the small issues that had, andchad my truck ready to go in a timely manner. Great job Autonation team.

name: Ms. Kay
text: Great service team. Ken was extremely patient throughout the journey. I experienced some flood damage in September 2019 that required major repairs to include a rental for a few weeks. Updates were offered and a complete thorough summary of what was serviced. Ken and the team wereprofessional. My vehicle was as showroom ready as the day I purchased it from them. Roll Tide.

name: Daijha Doss
text: NONE of my experiences at autonation have been pleasant. I’m either here all day or have to leave my car for days at a time because they can’t seem to do their jobs. My car was there for 2 days just to get the battery changed (I kid you not). Now I’m waiting on a part for my car and dear lord you would think they had to actually build the part themselves. I’ve been told 3 different stories about this part. I’ve had my car for almost 4 years now and EVERY SINGLE TIME I’m in there someone is upset about how they run this place. Now I’m that someone. Thanks for nothing Autonation. Keep up the good work.

name: Rick McNeill
text: I have dealt with Tommy Johnson on multiple occasions and he has always been courteous and professional.

name: Amir Sahori
text: Very unprofessional staff. 7 hour oil change while I was stuck at the mall. No service or anyone to help get me anywhere. Was given a call 20 min before closing time and said that my ride was ready, got there 40 min later due to traffic and they said they closed. So honestly never doing business with this dealership ever again. I suggest everyone get oil changes at Honda rather than this dealership... buy your cars somewhere else, the bad service outweighs the quality of their trucks.

name: Samuel Alston IV
text: I was completely satisfied with the Service Advisor, Mike Robinson’s eagerness and prompt service to my problem. I definitely enjoyed the awesome service. I will recommend him to friends and colleagues. Also, Autonation as somewhere to go for all their car related needs.

name: Janet Wright
text:
Great company, great atmosphere, and it was awesome working with Chris and Austin
They made us feel at easy and comfortable
My husband and I would definitely do business with this company again
Thanks guys

name: Natalia Hornbuckle
text: Great experience from beginning to end!!! Salesman (Sondra) not overbearing, very professional, cordial and kind. Ralph in Finance great personality. Wonderful experience.

name: Scott Boyd
text: The staff there worked out a great deal for me on my purchase of a 2020 Jeep Wrangler Unlimited Rubicon.

name: Dana Adcock
text: 10 years ago we bought a new Jeep Grand Cherokee.   No one has ever touched this car but Auto Nation.  A couple months age my husband took the car in for repair.  A new condenser had to be installed.  After the work was completed, when we picked the car up, the dash lights were out.   We were told there would be an additional $300 or more to fix it.  This was very shabby business as it was fine before the work was done.   I’ve had a couple of issues with this establishment but let it go but this is going to far to expect us to pay for something that was broken while a very expensive repair was being done on the car.

name: Daniel Eisrnhard
text: Sid was very helpful throughout the whole process of repairing my wife’s vehicle through the extended warranty.  He spent time on the phone dealing with my warranty company and when it came time he even drove me in his own vehicle to the rental company.

name: Diane Krause
text: I took my car in for repair of the power adjustment on the driver seat. The service rep who took care of me made the scheduling and check-in nice and easy and arranged for the shuttle service to take me home. I was disappointed that the AutoNation website didn't allow me to schedule an appointment for repairs online (only maintenance services could be done online). I got a diagnosis and repair quote within a day, but word that it would take a week to get the part in. It turned out to be an additional day for the part to arrive, and I was told the car would be done the following day, but  it took two more days for it to get done. We came from the Houston area where we were used to parts being accessible more quickly, so this wait time may be normal for the Mobile area. The pickup experience was a bit frustrating. I picked up on a Saturday and waited 1 hour 15 minutes to get checked out (was told the car was ready but paperwork had to be done). The service rep kept getting pulled away by walk-ins, phone calls, and I'm not sure what else, but it seemed I kept getting bumped to the back of the line. There may have been more legitimate reasons for the long wait time, but those weren't shared with me. Everyone was nice and helpful, and my car was repaired, but the wait times were a bit disappointing.

name: And P
text: Parts department is a joke. Spent 10 minutes going in circles trying to reach someone there. Eventually just hangup.

name: Cinde Pocase
text: I recently had a recall taken care of on my Jeep Renegade at Auto Nation Jeep in Mobile.  Troy took care of setting up my appointment and getting the repair done. They always do a great job there and take care of me and my car.

name: Darla Wheeler
text: Awesome experience!!! Austyn Long gave us great service. We are very happy with our purchase and will be going there if we need anything in the future.

name: Michael Harris
text: Service was good Michael was good at explaining what I needed. Not sure if I needed all of what I got,but overall I was satisfied.

name: Mr. A.D.
text: Ron did a awsome job getting me in and out fast. He also explained a lot of things I didn't know that I could get for my vehicle.

name: Clausell Huff
text: GREAT SERVICE VERY CLEAN QUALITY VALUE GREAT. THANK YOU

name: Will Powell
text: Shamarcus Mack did his job well as the salesman and was very helpful and friendly. I recommend him completely but AutoNation as a whole, not so much. I bought a car from there on August 26th. I paid cash and was told that I would have the paperwork for the title and so I could get my tag, in about 10 days but to allow 20. It’s weird to me that I didn’t get the title that day but now it has been a month and I still don’t have the paperwork. I’m still driving around with no tag, just the temp tag.

name: John Boy Gordon
text: I WORK THERE

name: Scott Ford
text: I drove about an hour away from home to sell my car to Autonation because they were willing to give me substantially more than other car buying services.  To be realistic the price was still under the book value for the vehicle, but no messing around, just a reliable sale.  I would say from the time I drove in to the time I left with a check was less than an hour and they gave me 50% more than what Carmax offered.  Karen in the online department was great to sit with while the service guys did a quick inspection and prepared the paperwork and check.  If you're looking to sell a vehicle and don't want to mess with CL or haggle with another dealer, autonation was great for me.

name: Tomecia Watts
text: I had the best experience ever. I went in to purchase one vehicle and walked out with 2 new vehicles. I'm very excited about my purchases and I would highly reccomend my salesperson Mykel. Charlie also made the experience  wonderful as well.

name: ADDIE LAWSON
text: I love this place!  I have a 2018 Jeep Wrangler and I took it in for service early in the morning.  I had questions on the transmission and they checked that too.  Wonderful service department!

text: Great service fast and reliable.  Wide selection of vehicles. Had to take a star off because they dont have the slushy machine no more. Bring it back.

text: The staff were great and answered all our questions. Our sales person, Austyyn, was professional, friendly and never pushy.  If you are looking for a vehicle, I would absolutely recommend AutoNation Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram Mobile.

Not sure if I'd give Autonation a thumbs up BUT I'd definitely give Mr. Cejka 2 thumbs up..

text: These guys are amazing! Quality work every time at unbelievable speed and low low prices! They DON'T try to break the bank. I am always speechless as to how cost effective their work is and fast. Thanks guts for ALWAYS being FAIR , FRIENDKY & FAST!!!!

resp.text: Thanks for taking time out of your day to leave such a kind review!

name: Miguel Davis
text: Great and quick service.

resp.text: That’s really nice to hear, thank-you!

name: Mitchell G Lattof Jr
text: I had gone to Pep Boys to get my headlight repaired. After keeping my car for 3 days trying to "diagnose" an electrical problem, Pep Boys informed me that I needed my entire headlight assembly replaced and it would take a week to get the part in and cost $2,700.00. I declined and took my car to Downtown Car Care for a 2nd opinion. After an hour or so, DCC determined that all I needed was a FUSE replaced and a new bulb. DCC saved me $2,500+ and they'll be my first "go-to" place for future repairs. They are extremely professional and friendly and I was very impressed with how clean their shop is. I highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Mitchell. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us

name: Alison Herlihy
text: Harold and everyone at Downtown Car Care did a great job getting my classic car up and running again! There aren't many mechanics around who can work on a 60+ year old car, let alone who will be totally honest with you about what they can do and do the work for a fair price. I'd recommend Downtown Car Care to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you for the great recommendation Alison! Always nice to hear from satisfied customers!

name: John Pickering
text:
Super fast, friendly team. The owner greeted me warmly, and his friendly team kept great communication. The price was downright astoundingly good for such a well-kept, professional garage in the downtown area.

I live in the downtown area and Downtown Car Care will be my garage for my maintenance needs from now on.

resp.text: John, thank you so much for the review and excellent feedback! Please come see us again anytime in the future!

name: Brittany Costello
text: Hands down the best experience I’ve ever had with a car repair shop! I got a flat tire just hours before my flight was scheduled to leave and they we’re able to fit me in and finish the job extremely fast, the day before a major holiday! The staff was a delight to work with... Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing us, it was our pleasure Brittany!

name: J. Craig Dickson
text: Fast and friendly service. Extremely reasonable rates compared to dealerships and you still have ASE Certified Mechanics that can do the work you can trust! I have known Harold 2 decades and he is as good as they get in bringing resolution to a car issue or concern. I would trust my mom, my wife, my sister and any daughter to go there alone and know they would be well taken care of there! Great job Harold and Chris!!

resp.text: We're delighted to hear how much trust and confidence you have in us! Thanks for the amazing review!

name: Fatima DZ
text: Just moved in town and finally i found a honest guys that can fix my car without breaking other parts. Chris is the guy that you should talk. I will give 7 * to him.

resp.text: Thank you so much Fatima! I appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.

name: Michael Scott
text:
My girlfriend and I recently came into some critical car troubles while we were moving to New Orleans. We stopped in the nearest town which was Mobile. We took our van to Downtown Car Care and they helped us out big time. We were looking at a 1000+ service request to change and fix our transfer case. We didn't have that kind of time or money to stay there and wait for that to happen. It is a 94' so they would have had to track down the part first. Time is money. The dudes at the shop found a temporary way to get our van running safely without even changing it. Ran and still runs like a beaut. Only charged us $20 for the whole thing. Easily could have taken our asses for a ride. Solid people working at this place and would recommend them to anyone if i lived in Mobile.

Thanks for all your help.

resp.text: I’m so glad to hear you had such a positive experience! Thank you!

name: Only Hazardous (Ryan Nichols)
text: My name is Ryan, and I’ve dealt with Harold personally on MANY accounts and I have never once been dissatisfied. Super friendly guy, honest, and he’ll get the job done quick. 10 out of 10 will do business again!

resp.text: So happy to hear you have always been satisfied with our services. We really appreciate the review you have left us!

name: Unicorn Sparkle with Anne Michael
text: I had a flat tire the other day while I was downtown. The people at Downtown Car Care really took exceptional care of me! They were so friendly and welcoming when I pulled in. They knew I needed my car fixed quickly since it was almost time for carpool that afternoon.  They were quick with patching my tire, and got me back on the road in no time! I will definitely be going back to see Harold at Downtown Car Care!

resp.text: We love hearing from satisfied customers! It makes all the hard work worth it. Thank you!

name: Luke Hildreth
text: They were more then fair with price . I was in a bind and they  were amazing.

resp.text: We're glad we could help, thank you Luke. Take care!

name: john
text: I brought my wife's car in for a few things (power steering pump, alignment, and oil leak) right before we left for vacation. As we were on vacation the shop kept us updated on everything that was going on. (A part was having to be ordered from out of state) The original quote was $1,000 which I was OK with because they wanted to do a transmission flush as well. For the amount of work and parts I was happy with price. They called about half way through our week long trip to give us an update and the shop owner stated he would have it done before we got back or worst case senario, the day we got back. He also stated he thought it would be a bit cheaper, about $950, well that's great. No problem there! So the day we got home he called and said the car was finished and that he was able to do all the work for $860!!! He very well could have charged me the $1000 and I would have gladly payed. He instead did the honorable thing and charged me what it cost him! Also, very clean shop!!

resp.text: Thank you, John! We’re thrilled that you’re happy with our services.

name: Deona Elaine
text: I was on my way to New Orleans and blew a tire on the interstate on the way. Downtown car care was the closest place to me and I’m so glad I was able to get their help. As soon as I called, they sent a tow truck and the owner was able to work with me on the cost of the tire I needed. Because I had a security bolt on my wheel and didn’t have the key for it, they had to remove the bolt — and they handled it for free! Instead of replacing both tires in the back, they only replaced the one that blew after looking at the condition of the other wheel which was super helpful since I told them I was on a budget. Since I’m a female, I’ve always felt wary of mechanics, but since visiting this shop, they’ve restored my faith in the business! Thank you for your hard work, flexibility, and kindness!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review, Deona! We take great strides to make sure our clients are satisfied and appreciate when a client sees that we work hard on their behalf.

name: John Connolly
text: Fast service. Friendly staff. Really helped us out in a bind and got us back on the road again quickly. Breaking down in an unfamiliar area, states away from home, can be daunting. Everyone was exceptional.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave such a thoughtful review, John. It’s customers like you that make our job so enjoyable!

name: Cody Plaisance
text: My wife and I were traveling to Gulf Shores from Baton Rouge for a family vacation and at 3:00 both our rear breaks went out and we managed to get it to Downtown Car Care and they took it in, fixed it, and were back on the road in no time at all. This was all at an extremely reasonable price and would recommend these people to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you for the review! We hope your vacation goes super awesome!

name: NamJung Homeschool
text:
I am YounJi from University of Alabama. My family and I had a trip to Mobile, and our car stopped working on a roadside. We looked up all the reviews and chose "Downtown Car Care" to help us.

The car broke down at 3pm on Friday. We thought there is no way to fix this car since it was late of the day. However, this place shocked me with the fastest service. They changed the broken alternator and replace to a new one in an hour. We really didn't wait at all. Plus, their customer service was great (the nicest mechanics ever seen!).

I truly recommend this place. This place saved our summer trip.
Again, choose this place for your car repair.

I also want to leave a thank-you note to the crew. Thank you for your amazing service!

resp.text: All in a day’s work, glad you’re happy with the results!

name: Tony Anthony
text: My name is Tony & I am the Service Manager at Colony One Auto Center in Stafford Tx. Our shop pride's itself in excellent customer service, after dealing with Harold Burns/ Chris over a potential catastrophe with one of our customers traveling through Mobile..........I can't be more grateful there are shops like this! These guy's were courteous, immediate and effective, its hard to get all those on the drop of a dime in an emergency situation. If anyone is travelling through Mobile (or near) or live in the area of, don't take my word for it, give these guy's a try! My thanks and gratitude for all you did Mr. Burns, Chris and the business as a whole!!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review! I’m so glad you were happy with everything.

text: Just want to say this is an awesome place to get all your car needs repaired. Mr. Eugene was very helpful and the staff was just wonderful. Just want to Thank Eugene for going above and beyond.

text: Purchased the $99 special for brake pads for my Toyota.  Somehow they managed to get air in the brake lines and weren't able to get out.  I had to take it to another shop and get the brake line bled which cost me an another $75.

resp.text: We're sorry, Steven. Our priority is to treat you how we would want to be treated. It is absolutely not acceptable that you were treated poorly. When you can, please contact our consumer solutions department at 914-984-2500 option #2 and we would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you.

Very professional personnel.

Hard to see from Lakeshore Drive.

Prices are great, no issues with any work performs. Also, I love how they don’t try to sell you anything you don’t need. Liz

name: V Riv
text: Talethia really went above and beyond to take care of me. Really needed new brakes and rotors. Very pleased with the quick turn around time and reasonable pricing. Will be back 😀

name: Chloe Photography
text:
Never been happier! Eugene has very good customer service and took care of all of my needs plus some! Thank you so much! Highly recommend

**UPDATE: A couple days after leaving the shop I noticed the brakes seemed to be sticking some. I chopped it up to new brakes and rotors. 2 months after service and every time I get on the freeway my tires shake and when I brake after getting off the exit the shaking is horrible, brakes jump and pulsate. I have pulled over twice this week to see if I see any issues and have noticed smoke coming from my brake pad area. I will never use this place again. Now I have to Fix the brakes and rotors I just got. Not to mention I was conned I to getting some kind of contract deal at a good price. Come to find out I was mislead and instead of paying $1038.00 through monthly payments. I have to pay a total of $2500 through weekly payments. All I wanted was brakes and rotors and had cash on hand but was talked into tires and some more things that “I needed”

name: Clinton Mann
text: I have used this location before and have been pleased, but never again. I brought my truck in for brakes and it was a complete disaster. The truck squealed and ground the whole time I drove after the brake job. It was way worse than before I brought it in. After 3 return visits to the shop I was told they didn't have time, or there was no mechanic on site each time. Also I called ahead, or made an appointment in person each time. The last time I was told to be there on Wednesday morning at 8:00 a.m. and they would get me first in line ( since I had already paid for a failed brake job). I arrived and was told once again " no mechanic is on site right now" . I work full time and don't have the time to spend back and forth trying to get it right. I took the truck to a different mavis location and they rectified the problem but I waited for over 3 hours while they did a complete brake job. I was told by the second location that it was not done properly and that the first time the old parts were still in place. They did nothing and charged me 700$. I will never be back.

resp.text: We're sorry, Clinton Please call us at 914-984-2500 option #2 so we can learn how to improve for you!

text: When I came to Mavis, I knew I needed new brakes and probably new rotors so I had already called around to local mechanics and checked prices. Not only was I happy with the enthusiastic "can do" "lets make it happen" attitude from Eugene the manager and his entire team, but the price was competitive, and he was able to get it done same day!  As an Uber driver this was extremely helpful because it allowed me to not miss a busy weekend night of work and possibly a whole weekend of work, putting money back in my pocket.  I could not be more grateful to the entire team for taking such great care of me and especially their willingness to take on the repair near the end of the day on a Friday!  I will definitely be back for other auto needs!

name: Jonathan Snively
text:
I feel like the manager Eugene has conned me. I went in back in April because I needed new brake pads and rotors. After waiting about 5 hours for them to install, it was finally done. About a month or 2 later, my vehicle starts to squeal anytime I apply my brakes. I took it into Goodyear at the beginning of October as the sound was getting unbearable. They checked my brakes and said that the rotors were cheap and needed to be fixed. They suggested me to take my vehicle back to fix the shorty work Mavis did to get warranty work as Mavis said I had a “warranty”. The next day October 3 I took it into Mavis. Sure enough after looking at my car for 30 minutes my calipers were hanging down. I waited another 4 hours for them to put 2 calipers on. Why I paid them another 400 dollars is beyond me. As I was leaving there parking lot my vehicle was squealing when I applied the brakes but it seemed to be better. About a week ago, I noticed my vehicle started to shake and when I backed up it sounded like I had a flat tire. At this point I know I was intentionally being conned out of over 800 dollars from Mavis tire. I take my vehicle to pep boys on Sunday.

My calipers were loose again. They didn’t tighten the damn bolts on the calipers. One caliper bolt was gone. The other one was about to be gone. Could have caused a huge accident. This is a terrible place of business. Eugene has no integrity in my opinion. I want to get my money back.

I called customer service today talked to an answering service. Customer service never called me back. Please avoid this place at every cost.

I have tried to send the picture of the receipt to the gentleman's phone. He asked me to take a picture and text him... Is there an email address I can send this to?

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, we believe accountability is paramount. We apologize for only bringing you 1 star service. This is nowhere near our standard. We see that you have since been in contact with the Regional Manager, Chad who is currently awaiting a receipt to be sent so he can review.

text:
Appointments literally mean NOTHING at Mavis. My girlfriend made an appointment over the phone over a week in advance. She gets there and they don’t have her tires in. Why you ask? Apparently they have a company policy where if they’ve sat in the shop more than a couple of days they just send them back. Doesn’t matter if you have an appointment or not. Makes zero sense.

I also made an appointment. Wasn’t quite as far in advance. (Couple of days) I did mine online. Guess what happened when I showed up to my appointment. Yup, no tires. Apparently they don’t deliver tires on Tuesdays. If that’s true, why let me book an appointment for Wednesday on a Monday? I did receive a call on Tuesday. The guy just said “we don’t have your tires in yet”. I said “ok? Well my appointment is for tomorrow. Will they be in on time?”. He said “yeah”.

Mavis needs some serious restructuring at both the store and home office level. Avoid this business at all cost. Order from tire rack and ship to another installer. Same price or cheaper.

name: J C
text:
Dropped my car off for a front wheel alignment, I was called and informed to get it aligned would take repairs totaling over $1300. I was not going to put this much money in a car this old, so I told them I would not have any work done and would pick the car up later that day. I called ahead later and was told that they closed at 5 pm, and I told the person on the phone I would be there in time.
At 4:50 I arrived to find the entire place closed and locked up, this was a Saturday night and Mavis is closed on Sundays, thus leaving me without a vehicle until Monday.
Also my car was left outside with the doors unlocked, the interior lights turned on, and the battery dead.

Nice! 😎👌

name: Mr. Brown
text: Waited for 3 hours for them to fix my front brake pads. Eventually I found out that they didn’t even have the part they needed, which they didn’t bother to tell me until I asked 2 hours into the process. When I asked how much longer it would be, they said they would call their parts guy to find out. They didn’t bother telling me the result of that phone call. I took work off to get this problem fixed, and they wasted half my day with no apology or explanation. Horrible customer service.

name: Steven McCallister
text:
I took my truck in to get the brakes replaced because I am too busy to do it on my own. It also had another problem with the brakes randomly locking up under five mph. They had it on the rack for nothing but three minutes, failed to do what I asked, and failed to even inspect the part I diagnosed to be the problem. They just tried upselling another service.
Took my truck home and fixed the problem myself.
They need more mechanical training, otherwise they will continue to misdiagnose a lot of problems.

text: I am convinced no one at this tire engineers knows what they are doing. We dropped our car off to get 2 new rear tires. We picked it up when they called and said it was ready and one of the new tires was already flat, so then we had to wait for them to fill it back up and replace the valve. We left and the tire pressure sensor was still on so we brought it back and waited 30 mins for them to try to fix it and they said it was fixed and would go off after we drove it 10 miles. We waited 2 days and it never went off so we took it back and had to wait for them to go get new sensors and install them. We wasted so much time for them to try to figure out what they were doing. Don't waste your time and go somewhere else to get tires!

name: Smiles Wind
text:
Best hands down! As a woman, I hate getting oil changes. I’m typically met with “ you need this” or “you need that” I really don’t know. Here, it’s welcoming, no hassle, clean bathrooms, Very clean sitting area, all that’s missing is flowers on the table LOL... you wouldn’t even feel like your at an oil change place!

They tell what’s needed ONLY and of course they recommend but it’s not a forced feeling, tv is there to watch, they offer free bottle water while you wait.  I pass at least 4 other place to come here. Highly recommended.

text: Shawn buckner is great. I went into their store looking for tires. He took a lot of time learning what I needed and the showing me all my options. His crew works quickly, they are clean and respectful of my equipment. text: I came in for an oil change - they were extremely friendly and helpful.  They let me know of two of my tires that were in desperate need of replacing.  The cost for the tires were cheaper than most other places I had priced them.  Quick, friendly and communicative - the best kind of service you can ask for!

resp.text: Hi Christine. Thank you for your Review at Midas. Please come again soon!

name: Preston Holloway
text: I had a hard time finding somewhere to weld a new flex pipe on my car with short notice on a Saturday with my two screaming godless heathens. This place was amazingly accommodating! My wife brought her new car (that actually works) and occupied the monsters while I tried to piece my life back together. I consider myself pretty knowledgeable about cars and they taught me a couple of things. They worked me in as quickly as they could and kindly sent me on my merry Fast and the Furious way! The mechanic ran a great bead on my exhaust and I could not be happier with it. Whilst still lose consistently to Toyota Tundras this was a vast improvement in my driving experience! 10/10

name: Jeff Phillips
text:
It's been more than serval years since I've been in a Midas store. What a pleasant surprise this was several days ago for me. From the first call
( live person BTW ) to schedule an appointment, to the inspection/estimate and repair to the final check out process this was a fine example of how to do business. No pushy sell folk trying to up sell me just a genuine help attitude. What a refreshing client experience this was for me with schedules and pricing being kept as promised. Thank you to the entire team for a job well done!
JP

resp.text: Jeff, thank you for this great review! We appreciate your trust and business, and hope that you always get 5 star service whenever you come to our store. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do. Thank you!

name: Justin Marden
text:
Don't bother making an appointment online, because it's useless. Made an appointment, got confirmation of said appointment, and when I got there I was told I didn't have an appointment because the online system doesn't actually make appointments for this location and it's somehow my responsibility to call them and make the appointment again. So needless to say I did not get service on the day I made an appointment, and I took my money elsewhere.

Mind you, this is not universal for Midas. I go to another Midas location in another state and never have this problem. Won't be returning to this location again, and I would advise the franchise owner to seriously rethink their appointment system.

resp.text: Hi Justin. We are sorry that you did not have a positive experience at our location. If you'd like to tell us more, please visit https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx

name: m1 k87
text: Horrible service.. they took 2 hours to get the oil changed my car wasted my time ... they charge me different prices everytime i go there .. plus they checked my cabin filter and i swear they didn't put back bc i didn't bought it from them i went to Auto Zone to buy me a new one .. i will never go back .. by the way i never fix nothing there but changing oil ( LOOK AT THE PRICES ) they won't rotate the tires bc everytime i go there they want me to buy new tires from them

resp.text: Hi Mahmoud, thanks for your review. We do our best to manage our time and workflow during peak hours, but sometimes wait times do occur. We're really sorry that you weren't happy with your experience. We would like to speak further with you about your visit - please email us at social@midas.com and include your phone number. Thanks.

name: Shannon Breland
text: You hear the stories of mechanics taking advantage of women all the time but not today.  This place is great and the guys who work here are the nicest you'll ever meet.  I was there for something small and was asked to come out and look at my car.  I thought here we go... they found a bunch of stuff wrong and the bills gonna go up $1000.00 but that's not the case. He just wanted to show me something that could go wrong in the future so I could keep an eye on it.  I'm a pretty good judge of character and these guys seem very trustworthy and kind.  I'm definitely gonna go back if I need anything else done to my car. Highly recommend the Midas on Highway 31, Hoover.

resp.text: Wow Shannon, we love positive feedback! Thank you for sharing.

name: Alexander Monsma
text: Had our car break down on vacation. This was the only shop open on a Saturday. Manager was vaping and blew the vape all over my and my kids multiple times. The work that they did took way longer than it should have, was nearly double the cost that other people quoted. Got home and a few weeks later had a mechanic tell me that the work they did at this Midas place was poor and he was going to have to go back through and re-do a lot of it. I would not recommend using this place. There's a lot of other places that are more honest, more upfront and that will do better work.

resp.text: Hi Alexander. We are sorry that you did not have a positive experience at our location. If you'd like to tell us more, please visit https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx

name: Austin Dixon
text: Was traveling out of town and my starter went out. They squeezed me in at the close of day and had my car running again a couple of hours later. Were very professional the whole time. One of the best experiences I've had at any auto repair place.

resp.text: Car repairs are rarely fun Austin, so glad we could deliver a top-notch experience!

name: Oakmont Chapel
text: Great courteous and professional service!

resp.text: Thank you for your positive review. We look forward to seeing you for your next service.

name: Domecia Brown
text: I have always been pleased with the service that I receive from this store.  BB is a master at his trade and they always prioritize good service and customer service above all else.  I will continue to stay were I am appreciated as a customer and that is right here at Hoover Midas!!

name: kimberly gray
text: My Visit at Hoover, Al Midas was so very pleasant. They made it possible for me to get the work I need done with their Easy Pay payment. This was a blessing. The staff is amazing, knowledgeable and most of all their true and honest expertise I value the most. Take your car her for service☺️☺️☺️☺️

name: Evonne West
text: The customer service as you enter was extremely nice. They even offered coffee. They have a clean restroom. The reason why I gave this business 3 stars is because I had an oil change and rotation of tires however the later that day my tire light came on and the following morning it was completely flat. I had to pay for a tow service and Lyft to handle the matter. At this time I recommend them but keep an eye on the service provided.

name: Cindy Aukamp
text: We were traveling on vacation when our engine light went on. We saw the Midas bay doors open even though it was after hours so pulled in. Bebe was kind enough to look under the hood and found the problem and went out of his way to fix it after hours and would not accept any money!! He was such a kind person and we so appreciate his help! In my eyes he is a Superman that helps stranded motorists. Thanks also to his wife who helped us find a nice hotel as we were planning on spending the night on our way to Gulf Shores. I would give the the highest ratings available and will pass it on!

name: Thomas Ramsey
text: Wilson (mgr) and his people are excellent ... They dx and repaired a simple muffler issue that the Cadillac dealership wanted to charge me an outrageous fee.  Honestly is important in the car business and much appreciated.

resp.text: Car repairs are rarely fun Thomas, so glad we could deliver a top-notch experience!

name: Jeremy Fisher
text: Tried to over charge me $100+... Watch what they are charging you for. Make sure the work was done!!

resp.text: Hi Jeremy we are sorry that you did not have a satisfying experience. If we can help, please contact us at https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx

name: Virgile Cance
text: I appreciated the professionalism from Bibi, honest and quick review.

resp.text: Thank you for taking a second to leave us this great rating, Bule! We were happy to help, and hope you get nothing but excellent service whenever you visit our store.

name: Taylor Thomas
text: I debated writing this review but after making an appointment and yet again being told they are 30-45 min behind I am too disappointed and had to share my experience. They are nice people and decently priced but never again will come back to this place. I have been coming here since I bought my car in 2018 and every time I make an appointment. Every time I arrive on time but they are running behind. Every time I wait almost 2 hours for a simple oil change. The last time I called before I went because I was bringing my 3 month old son and they assured me I would be out in an hour. I waited in the lobby for over an hour and my car never even got pulled up to a rack so I left. Its literally not worth your time to come here for routine maintenance.

resp.text: Hi Taylor. We are sorry that your repairs took too long. Please provide your contact information at https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx and we'll reach out to see how we can help.

name: Leo LeBarre
text: Great service, friendly and honest folks. Recommended.

resp.text: Hi Leo. Thank you for your Review at Midas. Please come again soon.

name: Ken Osvath
text: Thanks again to Alan and his team. Respectful and helpful — Leo and Bebe listened to our need and worked to solve our issue in a timely manner. We’ve been well taken care of each time we’ve turned to Midas in Hoover.

name: BIG MOE RuLeZ
text: I had a pair of aftermarket headers installed on my car that I knew I couldn’t do myself and I couldn’t be any happier with the guys work and time it took. Very professional, polite, and courteous. Will definitely come back for any future plans.

name: Darlene McCloud
text: I needed help with my car and I was out of town . Stop my this Midas and was met with  professional and friendly workers. I cant say enough how helpful and awesome everyone was. Fair price for outstanding job. I would definitely recommend this business to anyone who needs on honest repair or upkeep for all theirs car needs. Thank you again.

name: Ben Harrison
text: WOW!! Is all there is to say about the team at Midas in Hoover, AL. If you want to be treated fairly, given best service and pricing, shown options, and have faith in your decisions and advice...start here!!!  You will not be disappointed!!!  I  can’t say enough about the guys at this location. These folks go above and beyond any other team I have EVER dealt with!!!

name: Morgan Parr
text: While headed to the dealership to get my car maintenance completed before taking a long trip, my BEST friend suggested Midas in Hoover. Being the skeptic I am about having work done on my car because I’ve been taken advantage of before, i took a leap of faith. From the very first phone call to discuss what I needed done to the actual service was great. When it came time to show me I needed tires I was given options with no pressure to purchase. I was given an explanation of why I needed the tires and then they showed me. In summary, the customer service, the mechanic who worked on my car, to the general manager who educated me on tires, it was ALL a good experience and will definitely do business again.

name: Two-Do Guyz
text: Was charged wrong for services over $50. Had to go back and get refund

resp.text: We are sorry that you did not have a satisfying experience. If we can help, please contact us at https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx

name: lue eaton
text: The people here at Midas went above and beyond what I had expected and I am so pleased with the service that I received, my car was repaired and it runs great.

name: Asher
text: They cut the mufflers off the car before realizing they did not have a replacement so they kept the vehicle for two days longer than promised. Then told us the wrong closing time. At pickup, they rude and combative. Poor experience. To be fair, I feel like they did do a good job.

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear about this disappointing experience! Please let us know what we can do to help resolve this by visiting https://goo.gl/Htn9PP. Thank you.

name: Julius McCall
text: I had an exhaust problem on my Mercedes C300.  My appointment was at 4:00pm.  They had my exhaust problem fix and oil changed before 6:00.  Excellent service would recommend for all your service needs.

name: Tommy Walker
text: I brought my car in for a $17.76 Oil Change special and wound up spending close to $200.  My car was fine when I brought it in.  When I picked it up initially(after oil change) they said the inspection was good for everything.  The oil change included a tire rotation and I thought that happened as well.  I drove away and my tires began making this horrible droning noise as I picked up speed.  I brought it back and found that they did not rotate the tires.  I don't know what happened while it was in their possession but they said I needed two new front tires.  It was close to time for tires so I got them since the price was reasonable BUT what made the tires 'not okay' after the inspection said they were okay and no rotation occurred and then they make this horrific droning noise ALL OF A SUDDEN?

resp.text: Thank you for the review Tommy. It's disappointing to see there was a problem with the oil change, and we apologize for the inconvenience. If there is anything we can do to assist, please go to https://goo.gl/Htn9PP and provide your contact information.

name: Asher
text: They cut the mufflers off the car before realizing they did not have a replacement so they kept the vehicle for two days longer than promised. Then told us the wrong closing time. At pickup, they rude and combative. Poor experience. To be fair, I feel like they did do a good job.

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear about this disappointing experience! Please let us know what we can do to help resolve this by visiting https://goo.gl/Htn9PP. Thank you.

name: Shay Babe
text: I came out of pocket from so much money buying rental cars and etc just for them not to fix my truck right. I don’t recommend anyone taking their foreign cars there. They are very nice and friendly though. But the service needs some work. My motor almost caught on fire because of bad wiring. I did get my money back though for the service and parts but I still came out of almost 400$ in rental cars.

resp.text: Hi Clyya, it’s disappointing to hear there was a problem with the wiring and we appreciate you letting us know about it! If there is anything we can do to assist, please visit https://goo.gl/Htn9PP to provide your contact information. Thank you.

name: Ronald Mcknight
text: Great customer service and quality work.

resp.text: Hi Ronald, thank you for sharing your experience!

name: Timothy Sutton
text:
Very trustworthy place!I was told I needed new brakes at a different shop, so I sought a second opinion here.  These guys said I was good for another 20K miles at least!  And caught a small problem that would have become much more expensive if they had not seen it.  Will be going here while living in Hoover.

Visited these guys again and had another fantastic experience: efficient and always honest!

name: Lyndsey Harrison
text: These guys are awesome! They went above and beyond what was required! Talked me through every detail and gave me back my peace of mind. Ask for BeBe! I highly recommend.

name: Gary Hazelton
text:
I have used Midas for years in another location and I always respected their quality of work and prices. Unfortunately, the Hoover team made an epic fail.

I made an appointment one week prior for brakes, exhaust, struts, oil change and tire rotation. Cost was discussed and I wrote it down. The keys and vehicle were delivered one night early. They decided to hold off until 1:30 pm to start anything and then provided extreme estimates 3x what we talked about before I dropped it off. I only allowed them to change the oil and rotate the tires after the cheat attempt. Beware, brake estimate = $30!

The tires were not rotated because they forgot. The front desk guy simply told me they don’t need rotated as they put tires in a position to maximize rear traction on a 60:40 split front:rear AWD vehicle. He offered to show me a video. That ideology is technically wrong and now my tires will wear in this position for 20,000 + 3,000 more miles.

NEVER again. Go elsewhere to avoid a poorly organized and managed facility,

resp.text: Hello, thank you for taking the time to leave us this feedback. We strive to provide excellent experiences, and we are saddened to learn that you did not. We'd like to see what we can do to turn this experience around, but we need some more information from you first. Please click https://goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

name: Steve Hoyt
text: Needed a brake job - repairs were completed in a very thorough manner for a fair price

name: S Ireland
text: We take all of our vehicles here. Everyone is very knowledgeable.

name: Brett Dicus
text: The service was great! Chris was a great help at the desk and made sure I got everything I needed and went the extra mile.

name: Susan Kiker
text: They were really nice and fixed my car quickly, so I didn’t have to stay  there all day. Also, they were reasonably priced for the work that was done.

name: John Ireland Jr.
text: These guys are my heroes; Professional, friendly, and timely too!

name: Joseph Ware
text: I had a really good experience here . They are very knowledgeable and they have great customer service. They have great pricing and do great work . Never not once felt like I was being taken advantage of . Will definitely be going back there and will definitely recommend to my friends and family .

name: Marsy
text: Misleading prices over the phone to try and get you to come in! Be careful and ask for specific pricing for your car. 45 min wait for Simple oil change. Rather go to oil express for friendlier, upfront, faster service.

resp.text: Hi Marsy, thanks for sharing. We do our best to manage work during peak times, and we're genuinely sorry to hear that you left unhappy with your experience. We'd like to see what we can do to turn this experience around, but we need some more information from you first. Please click https://goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

name: Kevin Keck
text: 2nd visit to this location. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. Very pleasant experience. Will definitely return.

name: Amber Davis
text: Had a great experience here getting a new set of tires for my car. They were kind and knowledgeable, and I never felt pushed to purchase other products or services. Definitely recommend them!

name: Griffin ONeal
text: I am 16 and went to get an exhaust put on my truck. They were super kind and friendly and even stayed after they closed to finish it. They also offered water and candy while I wanted. Very well run business.

name: James Huff
text:
Great Mechanic and friendly staff. They diagnosed my break issues and repaired them at a fair price.  they were more than willing to provide details regarding the needed repairs.

This was my second trip back to this repair shop.  I came in last year with a different vehicle.
(Same great experience!).

They are now my brake shop.

name: Jamie Talbott
text: Friendly atmosphere and great service!  Definitely recommend this particular business!!!

resp.text: We are glad you had a great experience and appreciate your patronage.

name: Bridger Post
text: Had a simple brake bolt malfunction went to my local AutoZone thinking they could help me with the installation and they just simply said they can't change my bulb I don't know if it was fear of breaking something in my car but they were no help whatsoever this Midas granted was only going to charge me $71 but when they saw how simple of a procedure it actually was they cut my bill in half talk about excellent service I will be taking my car and my wife's car here from now on 👍

name: Nikolai Krestinksky
text: Very fast and quality service.

name: Ann Rayburn
text: Great service and friendly staff! During my last oil change they even cleaned the bugs off my windshield accumulated from an out-of-town trip. The waiting room is very nice and I like that they have complimentary coffee.

name: Hazel Anderson
text: I must say they went beyond providing me with quality service. I am very pleased with the services rendered. I will definitely be back.

name: Debra Spivey
text: The owner and manager of this Midas location were the most courteous, helpful, and honest I have ever witnessed. Such a breath of fresh air in a world where customer service is scarce. I will be going to them for all my automotive needs!

name: Jeffrey Moody
text: Very friendly staff. Stopped in from out of town due to an emergency and they fixed me up quickly. Even gave me a great discount for being military.

name: Kelley
text: Had new exhaust system installed on truck.  Excellent customer service and workmanship.  Competitive price.  Very pleased.  Highly recommend.

name: Matt Davis
text: I showed up around noon on Friday to have them remove a nail from my tire and patch it. They were Courteous and professional and got me in and out pretty quick.

name: Tim Allen
text: I have been there multiple times for both personal and business use. Staff is knowledgeable and offers fair prices. Does not try to add on if service is not needed.

name: Brian Wykle
text: The customer service is outstanding.  They attended to my needs and were able to service my car right away.

name: Sweet T
text: My family was well taken care of. Jack offered friendly and professional customer service. Our business seemed to be valuable.

name: Lashawn Brown
text: I took my Camaro to get Some work done, I was so pleased from the first visit I took it back to have more work done Mr.Jake is the sweetest person ever, will do everything in his power to help you get the Service your car needs,you can tell helping others comes natural for him.All the Techs are very professional and knowledgeable about what you car needs and If I could give 10 stars I would with no hesitation So if your looking for a professional, knowledgeable staff to take care of your car needs THIS IS THE PLACE!!!

name: AJay Ess
text: This was always my go-to place for auto service when Bebe was front and center. So far, my last two experiences with Jack have been awful. Each time I've gone for an oil change and tire rotation, he's tried to pressure me into agreeing to $1500 worth of "urgent" repairs. He even refused to rotate my tires because he said I needed to purchase some from them asap. I won't be returning there, which sucks because I've been getting my vehicles serviced at this Midas for several years. Please don't reply with that generic response.

resp.text: Hello, thanks for your review. We always aim to provide excellent service on every vehicle that comes through our shop. We're very sorry to hear that you have been less than satisfied with the shop in your recent visits. We'd like to discuss this further with you, but we would require some more information from you first. Please click https://goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more so we can better assist. Again thank you for taking the time to leave this feedback and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: Justin Braud
text: Good guys. Good prices. They’ll be performing all maintenance on my car that they have the capabilities to do.

name: Fredrick Ikpelue
text: Awesome car service in Hoover! Highly recommend!

name: tom burns
text: Courteous friendly service. Took care of my automotive needs. I will get service work done at this location. Thanks Midas Hoover.

name: Casey Darling
text: My boyfriend and my father are both engineers who each know the way around a garage, and I, admittedly, could change my oil and brakes and tires and gaskets (etc) myself if I truly wanted to...still I have no reason not to support local business and visit Midas for routine maintenance. Especially since Bebe is the first mechanic in town who hasn’t lied to me about something being wrong with my Lexus. I feel totally comfortable with him—which is huge. Plus, it’s a pretty big deal that they don’t hide from me while they work on the car. I can see everything from the lobby, which is not something you can say about most places. I never met the previous owner, but as far as I can tell you— I wouldn’t be afraid to send my mother here if need be.

name: Jeremy Bryant
text: Busy place

resp.text: Hi Jeremy. We are sorry that you did not have a satisfying experience. If we can help, please contact us at https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx

name: Debbie Fulton
text: Horrible! They take advantage of you. Run as fast as you can. Go anywhere else besides here!

name: Barnacle Bill
text: I visited last week for an alignment consultation. I received this rather uneasy feeling and declined. Upon walking out the door. I was questioned by this person (who didn’t identify themselves) if I really wanted an alignment. He went on to ask if I could find a place to do the alignment cheaper and hounded next about it. My feelings are, if u have to approach a potential customer unprofessionally and further solicit my business, that’s just sad. Avoid this horror story. Take your vehicle to FIRESTONE in Pelham!!

resp.text: Hey Bill, thanks for bringing this to our attention. We're sorry you left feeling dissatisfied with your experience. We'd love to talk to you more regarding this, but we need some more information from you first. Please click https://goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

name: Luke Germek
text: The mechanics at Midas repaired a crack in my exhaust and replaced an oxygen sensor. Now my vehicle runs like new. Thanks

name: JENNIFER ROSS VICK
text: They helped me alot

name: Robert Hohn
text:
Bebe and Jess have offered by far the best customer service I've ever gotten at an auto shop. Even though Midas is a franchised chain, the employees at this specific location treat every interaction as if their own reputation is on the line. They are kind and honest, and, most importantly, come off as 100% trustworthy.

If you're tired of having somebody just read some data off of a monitor that they obviously don't know anything about, or you're tired of somebody trying to up-sell you on tons of junk that you don't need, or you'd just like to shake hands with the guy who's actually going to work on your car, this is the place to go.

The quality of all the work we've gotten at this location so far has been A+, and we'll be coming back in the future for everything that we need.

name: Frances Loza
text:
I knew I had to have brakes and rotors, but not a lot of money to spare. I told Jack my budget and he   was able to come in under my budget. I'm sitting here with tears of joy in my eyes because my car will be safe to drive and I can still buy groceries.
I highly recommend this location and I will be back to have some other work done on my car in the future.
As a person who has been resigned to just hand over their wallet when it's time for automotive care, it's nice to feel that I'm not being taken advantage of.
Every person I encountered was kind, fair and professional. Plus, I got to meet the owner and shake his hand. Good experience.

name: Lindsay Miciotto
text: No no no just plain NO they tried to say a bunch of stuff was wrong with my car that wasnt.. Then the guy proceeded to tell me my left strut needed to be changed but yet it was just changed and was BRAND NEW. Dont waste your time with these clowns

resp.text: Hi Marie, we're sorry to hear you aren't happy with your Midas experience. We make our service recommendations based on a number of factors, including visible condition and manufacturer's recommended services for the vehicle make/model and mileage. Ultimately, we want to keep our customers safe. We'd like to talk to you more regarding this matter, but we’ll need some more information from you first. Please click https://goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

name: Yiming Ma
text: Great service at fair price. Will definitely go back.

name: Chris Warr
text: I drove my car here 6/21/2017 to have my rotors turned.  I was getting a shimmy/shaking while applying the brakes to my 2008 Honda Civic.  Google maps indicated that the place was closed so I called and the guy at the desk informed me they were closed for a time but now open.  When I pulled up there was only one other car there and no one was in the waiting room.  Something like this should have probably clued me in but I thought it was a weekday before 4pm so didn't think much about it.  It took them two hours to turn my front rotors and my car still shakes when I apply the brakes.  My car also makes a ticking noise when I'm going less than ten MPH while turning the wheel slightly left.  There was no noise before these people worked on it.  I then took the car back to see what could be done about it.  They said when they drove it around and stopped at slow speeds and highway speeds they didn't hear or feel anything.  These people don't know what they're doing.  It would be a complete waste of time and money to take your vehicle here.  I'll not be taking my vehicle here ever again.

name: Bradina Braxton
text: Absolutely perfect service.  Will return and recommend others to service their cars with Midas.

name: Sistrunktv
text: I took my Ford F150 truck to Midas for a dual exhaust job. I ended up having to bring it back to this store in Hoover because they did a bad welding job on my dual exhaust  when the work was performed . I took it back to them and the computer clearly says I had my dual exhaust performed at this location and the mechanic acted like he didn't have a clue what I was talking about. They tried to charge me 80.00 to weld my dual exhaust back on. If you want something done right don't take your car here. It is a waste of time.

resp.text: Hey, thanks for bringing this to our attention. We're sorry you left feeling dissatisfied with your experience. We'd love to talk to you more regarding this, but we need some more information from you first. Please click https://goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

name: Scott Liu
text: One axle brake service with appointment took 3 and half hours. They blame the part provider for brought them the wrong parts. Not to say the bait and switch trick they did. Kids were running around in the workshop!

resp.text: Hi Scott, thanks for sharing. We do our best to manage work during peak times, and we're genuinely sorry to hear that you left unhappy with your experience. We'd like to see what we can do to turn this experience around, but we need some more information from you first. Please click https://goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

text: Dirty and unkempt. Wouldn't know it was a national chain if not for the sign. Arrived for appointment to get oil change and tires rotated and was told it would STILL take 3 hours before it was even looked at. This seems unacceptable for someone that took the time to make an appointment. Was also told HAD to put higher priced oil in and couldn't do anything else. Have never been told that before. Walked out and had all done elsewere including lunch in less time than I would have waited. Won't be going back.

name: Phillip Lozito
text: Great service and great follow up, had brakes replaced in both my car and my wife's. The staff was friendly and helpful. Wouldn't hesitate to go again! Thanks Midas!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing, Phillip! We look forward to seeing you back at Midas in the future!

name: Darryl Moore
text:
I took my car there for an oil change and later after I got home the vehicle was leaking badly an I had to return it the next day.  I returned it and when I returned home, the under cover where they changed the oil was hanging down. I returned the vehicle and they tied it up with straps.

The same day my wife took her vehicle there and they forgot to put the air filter back into the vehicle. I just purchased one and I put it in. We decided we will not return to Midas.

name: Nathan Azbik
text: Amazing work! Love going! Knowledgeable and friendly customer service!

name: Shawn Barrett
text: This was the first time to visit Midas. Although I had an appointment, they were unable to get to my car until at least an hour later. The staff were friendly and apologetic and I did have a good experience otherwise. I will return.

name: black. Artis
text: The worst experience i every had at a auto shop. Took my car there and it seemed to be worst after i got it back. All they did was take advantage of a woman and over charge me everytime i brought the car in . They charge me over 500.00 and the car still may break down. I was stranded 3 times and they didnt even care. They lost a valuable customer!!  Dont take your car there unless you want a messed up car and a high bill.

name: Ryan Thomas II
text: Got me a better deal on fixing my brakes

name: Leslie Edmondson
text: Excellent customer service!

name: Lyle Plauche
text: Amazing service, fast and friendly, would definitely be a repeat customer, I recommend them to all my friends, very fair and competitive prices too

name: Christal Harrison
text: Amazing people. Family oranted good prices and fast. Highly recommend

name: scott burmester
text: Took my old work truck in to have the A/C looked at, and to have the rear lights checked because this Midas was convenient. The brake lights had a short and I didn't have time to track down the loose ground wire. I dropped off the truck and they called me the next day with an $1100 quote to fix the A/C and they didn't have the ability to fix the lights. They charged me $90 for the A/C  diagnosis and I went on my way. Took to a local non chain repair shop and had everything fixed for $400. They didn't seem to be interested in fixing the lights due to me not wanting to spend $1100 for the A/C.

name: Hej E.
text:
Took my vehicle for an inspection at my nearest dealership. Learned I needed the outer tie rod ends done, among a couple of other things. So I shopped around for cheaper prices and came across Midas in Hoover, AL. Took my vehicle to have the radiator and outer tie rod ends replaced/repaired and an alignment done on January 29, 2015. A week ago or so I noticed something was off with the ride of my vehicle. It would pull and had a slipping feel when turning and braking and just driving in general. It worsened and I felt I shouldn’t be driving it. I started thinking I needed to take it back to Midas because something wasn’t right with the steering and suspension (which they’d “repaired”). On February 23, 2015, I cranked the car up to leave work and the steering wheel loosened and turned far right on its own. Called AAA to have my baby towed. The AAA guy instantly diagnosed it and said the tie rod wasn’t done right. The pin wasn’t inserted in the tie rod end. We found the bolt that came off in the parking lot.

All three AAA guys diagnosed the problem and confirmed about Midas improperly installing the outer tie rod ends. One even said that could be a lawsuit and Midas would eat the cost. Had I drove home, that could have been my life on the road. My baby was towed home on a flatbed and then towed straight to Midas the next morning on February 24, 2015. I was not confident in Midas working on my CRV again. Especially since they didn’t do the job right the first time and it had to be done again. And on top of that, the same technician from the first time ended up working on my car this time around. They apologized and claimed the part was defective. I seriously doubt that. This was completely their fault. Point blank.

And to top it all off, that same technician (initials TT, according to my invoice, I believe) that worked on my car both times and drove it out afterwards, stole $20 from my ashtray compartment. He reached down and picked something up off the floor and got out of my car while putting something in his pocket. We caught it before leaving and went back to confront the guy, a short white male that looked to be in his 30s maybe; thick southern drawl. They compensated my stolen possession…with the exact money he stole from my vehicle -- minutes before. We made a little scene about it. It’s the principle of the matter. I usually take my stuff out of my car when having it worked on or having it in the care of someone else. But I failed to completely take all my significant possessions out…like my frikin’ gas money left in the ashtray. Another technician informed us that that wasn’t the first time something like that happened around there and that ‘we didn’t hear that from him’.

So not only does Midas not properly repair parts on a car, they also search it and steal possessions. I’m not confident in the repairing of their wrongdoing. I’m wondering if something else might go wrong. Their credibility is shot with me. I actually feel I should be refunded the cost for labor, if not the whole amount. And since it was a "defective part," they should refund me the cost for parts since the problem had to be fixed (and hopefully it actually is, this time and nothing else goes wrong from them working on it). I will be going to the home office about this. I will reach out to corporate about this. I will review the hell out of this Midas location. A situation like mine was potentially life-threatening and a definite lawsuit waiting to happen. They will not be getting my business.

resp.text: Hey there, thanks so much for sharing this with us. Very sorry to hear about your experience. We'd love to have someone get in touch with you about this. Do you mind sharing your name and phone number with us via email? Please feel free to contact us at social@midas.com. Hope we can be of some assistance. Thanks again.

text:
JacMac Tire and service was not busy today, which was good for me and for them. I usually get depressed when my car gets sick because RARELY do I walk away without spending a grand. But this visit was very pleasant. The customer service man asked me what was wrong with my vehicle, then asked me for the key. He went out and took my car for a test drive, then onto the rack. I waited in the lobby waiting area for a very brief time and then he came back. He told me I had a couple of options. Option one included replacing brake rotors and option two, pads only. I took the less expensive option two because money was tight. My total bill was HALF of what I assumed it would be. At JacMac, the difference is simple. They don't seem to want to drain your checking account like other places around Tuscaloosa who want to bill you no less than 1000 dollars every time you walk in the door. And I really like that he OFFERED me the different options. Most places dont do that. They make you ASK for less expensive options then say, welllllll, but, if you do that then this will happen, etc.
I think I just found "my mechanic."

resp.text: We're glad we were able to offer you the service you needed, Brooks! Let us know if there is anything else we can do for you, and we look forward to working with you again!

text:
Quick service and reasonable prices for tire work.

However, this is what won my respect:
I came in to get my tire patched after running over a screw.  The mechanic patched my tire but accidentally stripped a lug nut when putting it back on. I noticed it once I got home and called the service desk.  They assured me I could come anytime over the next few days to fix the problem.  I showed up the next morning with a $5.18 lug nut from Nissan to replace the stripped one.  Not only did the mechanic fix it right away, the manager voluntarily reimbursed me without me bringing it up.

Mistakes happen...  It makes me happy to see a business doing the right thing. Especially without being prodded.

5 stars for this business!

name: LJ Pack
text: These people have communication issues. We went to make a deal on a used vehicle. We almost made the deal twice. After making our down payment and payment requirements very clear, the sales persons involved went to get approval. When they returned, the vehicle had been discounted, but they added a "fee." That's the only thing he would say, "a fee." They were trying to deliberately be vauge and, in our opinion, dishonest. After discussing their "fee," we never actually achieved full disclosure. We were told the vehicle was at a different dealership within our city and we could go there to finalize the deal. They said that they would call ahead and we should just go over there. Our credit had already been run multiple times, and we had received approval from the credit company. With this in mind, we went to the other dealership location. As we arrived at the other location, they hadn't been given all the details as we had been led to believe. So the process began again, running in circles of double talk and running our credit again... We left at closing time and expected a phone call the next day to complete the deal... That has yet to happen days later. I used to have great respect for Greenway Automotive. It appears that Greenway has only taken over these dealerships at face value, and the same crooks that were already in place are still running things just like they always have. Avoid Greenway Honda in Florence, AL, and Greenway Chevy in Muscle Shoals, AL, if you are planning to make a deal on a used car. They are not to be trusted unless you have the cash to pay up front or your own financing.

resp.text: LJ, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience. This is not the level of customer service that we strive to provide at Greenway. We take customer satisfaction very seriously and we hope to have another opportunity to show you that. Should you wish to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to our General Manager, Jesse Gouvin, at jessegouvin@greenway.com. Thank you for your patience.

name: Phillip Willcox
text: Scott McClellan only reason your giving a bad review is you bought your own parts to save a dollar, that mechanic or any other mechanic is not responsible to warranty YOUR PART that's the chance you take that is why we mark parts up to cover things like this. The thing your not saying is you drove your truck for a month before the slave cylinder went out and like I said that's your part that went out not his so you a responsible for that repair also the labor cost will have to be took up with the store that sold the part. I've known David and his wife for 20 plus years they are honest and good people I've sent him plenty of customers and they have ALL thanked me and said how good of a job he'd done them. But the funny thing is that in my line of work I visit and talk to just about all the shops in the south Hoover to Montevallo area and you and your wife's name came up a couple of times funny how those guys I spoke with all seemed to remember you having some kinda problem and screaming money back, fix it for free, your just trying to screw me and then the I'll get a lawyer card lol we all love those, cant afford to get your car fixed but can afford a lawyer fee yeah right. Folks these are great people at David's Auto don't believe what one trouble maker puts on here because of their on ignorance.
