name: Roy Hunt
text:
Everyone very hush hush, talking  why looking somewhere else, very pessimistic, Doomsday attitude. I know it's all to protect them from liability suits. What ever happened to trust, recommendations, honest opinions? Every answer to every question seemed will rehearsed. Two days later my alternator goes out! Maybe a coincidence, but it seems like everyone I put my trust in the professionals, things start going wrong with my car. Don't trust mechanics, lawyers, maintenance individuals, had one of them tell me, "if we fix it too well, we'll be out of a job, always have to leave something for another day." There's no real honest people in this area, not anymore. Bureaucrats have got their fingers into everything. Law suits are the "American Way!" So you can't really blame them to avoid taking responsibility for their actions. I know what my part costs, they were going to charge me nearly $500 in labor to loosen and tighten bout 6 bolts? A little extreme, they did an estimate but I never got to see it, I asked to see the defective part, but was given the excuse we would have to put it back on the lift. Since it wasn't on the lift, they had no plans to fix it!

Allen from Phenix Firestone called, his only concern was why I was so critical of him. I thought that was clear, but this was the second time I took this vehicle there for the same issue, the first time I was told nothing was wrong with it. In any case in order to resolve the problem Allen stated, "we're not working in your cars anymore!" I guess I hurt his feelings?

I used to love taking a vehicle to Phenix Firestone, always felt like they were looking out for me, always trusted them! Now I get the feeling I'm unimportant, it's really changed over the years!

Enough said hope you all have a great holiday I'll be home fixing my cars! LoL!

resp.text: Roy, thank you for taking the time to leave a thorough review! We welcome all feedback as hearing from our customers is the best way we can improve our business. We apologize for any inconvenience. Take care.

name: Julie Hughes
text:
I had an appointment for an oil change at 10:00 am. I was told that it would be ready in a couple of hours.  I left my car for 4 hours. When I arrived at 2 pm, Kyle didn’t know about my car. When he finally found the paperwork, he said,”they can put it on the rack now.”  I informed him that I had to be home by 3 pm and I live an hour away and to please just bring me my keys. He brought my keys, rudely handed them to me and said,”Bye.”
I was not rude to him. I did tell him that this happened before and that I just needed my keys.
I am more disappointed in the way he handled this. He never once apologized and seemed annoyed that I couldn’t wait.  I think 4 hours is plenty of time for a 15 min. oil change.
Customer service goes a long way!

He did enforce. me my car was ready. Maybe he was upset because  I told him I didn't  need a tire rotation  because I DID one the last visit .I just purchase  this car in August  last year. Next time I will get someone else in the service  department  not him. I Jim Burke  Nissan Sales and Service But Adam Montgomery  is not a good  associate .

name: Beth Jeszka
text:
If I could give negative stars I would. I dropped my 2005 Nissan Titian off to have some recall work completed, diagnostics ran, O2 sensors replaced and an oil change. I used one of their rental cars, as the truck would not be finished for several days. I left my truck, after giving them a budget of $1500.00, got on to the interstate and went about my day. I woke up in the morning and the car was not there. I talked it over with my roommate and we agreed i should call the police. Long story short, I tried calling Nissan to let them know the situation. I left several messages, tried calling my appointed service tech, sent an email and even had a conversation with the online chat. This happened Wednesday night- Thursday. I finally received a response, via email, stating my truck was finished. Total cost was just over $300.00. The recall work was covered, the cost was for the rental. All of the work I requested to have completed was not finished. The invoice didn't even reflect my request, the issues my truck is having or why I brought to them. In true honesty, they did complete the recall issues.
I will be staying with Benton Nissan or my personal mechanic, lesson learned.

Customer Service sucks, finishing in a timely manner is definitely some bull$***

name: Jacqoura Towns
text: Very horrible service after my radiator was replaced. I was told to continue to put water in my car which I shouldn't  have had to do that if it was replaced with a brand new radiator. For the price I spent it better have been brand new. Smh waste of money and drive and my car is still messed up. Never again will I ever visit this location or any of them because of this bad experience.

resp.text:
Hello Jacqoura, we're disappointed to see your review, but we wanted to take the time to clarify the situation. When you brought your vehicle in to have the CV axle and P/S pump replaced, you noted that your engine overheated on the way to the location. Our service technician discovered a large leak in your radiator, which you agreed to have replaced. When you let us know that your vehicle had overheated again, we discussed with you the possibility of a damaged head gasket that was causing the overheating. We believe that this is the cause of the problem and suggested adding water to prevent it from overheating while you are needing to move the vehicle. We would be happy to take a look for you, as we believe this is the cause of the overheating issue. Please let us know if we can help you with this repair. Thank you, Jacqoura.
Chris, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Julius Matthews
text:
I'm not a very car saavy guy, but do know customer service. I signed up for an appointment through USAA RepairPal and thought that this place would have integrity. I was wrong.

I took it in one week. That Friday I had to call THEM to get an update on a Lexus IS350. They told me they did a few test and had more to run. The following Tuesday they informed me that the control head need to be replaced. I told them I didn't want the work done. At that moment, not the Friday I called them, not the day I brought it to them, but that Tuesday I was informed that I would be charged $45 everyday the car remained there. Why wouldn't you inform someone of this at the initial dropoff?

So I get there and fortunately I was not charged the $45. I try to leave and the vehicle, which only the AC wasn't working and the TPS light was on. When I get the vehicle back my parking brake light, check engine light, power steering light, and my ABS light was all of a sudden on.

I used them through USAA and this is how they are with customers. Poor.

resp.text:
Hello Julius, we were disappointed to see your review. When you came in late to your appointment, we were happy to still accommodate you and take your vehicle in, and we tried to communicate that we weren't sure how long the services would take due to the schedules of our expert technicians. You seemed to understand this at the time, and you signed the storage fee disclaimer. When you called on Thursday, you said that you would pick the car up on Friday and return for the repairs on Monday. You didn't come in on Friday or Monday, so Tuesday, we called to remind you of the storage fee. We're sorry if any of the paperwork wasn't clear, and we were happy to waive the fee for you when you came to pick up your car on Thursday. We explained the repairs your car needs (which is why your warning lights are on), but we would be happy to go over this information with you again if you have any questions. We wish you the best.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Corinne Boston
text: Paid for a diagnosis on my brakes which was $40. Wanted to charge me 482+ tax for 2 rotors and brakes and said they wanted to take my old brake fluid out and put some new in,check my emergency brake and charged labor for each thing he was going to install. So after i talked it over with my granddad he told me to leave. i told them i couldn’t afford the price and then he tried to take the price down and take the brake flush and checking my back brakes off it came down to 373+tax  i thought about but i still declined. After that they did not say thank you for coming or anything. just gave me my keys. this is the second time this has happened trying to over charge don’t go here! go to tire engineers. i ended up having a friend doing my brakes paid for parts which was wayyy cheaper thank god ! Also my brake fluid was clean and did not need changing so they lied about that as well, and checking for my emergency brake ? nobody rides on there emergency brake. since i’m a young woman they will try and rip you off be careful ladies .!

resp.text:
Dear Corinne,
We are sorry that we were not able to perform the work that was needed on your brakes. We brought the price down as we wanted to keep you as a client and to make sure you were taken care of. We are happy to hear that your friend was able to help. If you need anything, please let us know.

Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Alesha Hicks
text: Sure, they were nice and did the work, but when I got my itemized receipt checked by an independent mechanic from a different garage, their prices were way more than what should have been charged. The biggest one being that they charged for taking broken parts off, which is part of the work that goes into fixing it and would not be charged elsewhere (which was confirmed by another trusted mechanic my family has gone to for years). Get a quote and get it checked by someone else before you agree to the work.

resp.text:
Dear Alesha,
We sincerely appreciated the opportunity to work with you recently to perform brake maintenance on your vehicle. The brake pads that had been previously installed by another mechanic had several broken parts that needed to be addressed. We spent over an hour trying to salvage existing parts in order to save you the expense of new calipers. Our invoice showed we only charged a portion of the hourly labor rate to keep your costs down. I would be happy to discuss all of this further with you and address your concerns in a positive manner. Please give Jamie, the owner, a call at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience.

name: Beverly Ashley
text: They recommended I get rear wheel bearings on my vehicle. My car made awful noises after the work was done, I took the car to them twice after and they still did not fix it. I had another mechanic fix the car which was the same thing the left wheel bearings. Don't take your vehicle here, they aren't trustworthy at all and cannot even fix what they mess up.

resp.text:
Dear Beverly,
Thanks for coming into our auto shop recently. We were surprised by your review since we provided you with effective communication and excellent customer service. We replaced your wheel bearing and discovered a small evac leak. You also had us replace a headlight bulb and rotate your tires.

When you came back the next day and stated you were hearing a noise, our technician, Chris, took the car for a test drive and diagnosed you needed a new tire. You left our shop and purchased a used tire and then had us install it. The next day you came back and stated you were still hearing the same noise. Chris drove the car again and indicated that the used tire was no good. We even moved the used tire to the back to make sure the noise followed the tire, which it did.

Our team did exactly what was asked of us and provided you with an honest assessment of what your vehicle needed. We wish you all the best.
Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Darlene Strong
text: Micheal and his supervisor was so ugly to me. I will never go back to them. Not once did they call me about my car to let me know what was going on and when I called them they just said you can come and it. All it need is a sensor.

resp.text:
Darlene, we're sorry to see that you had a bad experience at our store. We aren't always able to let our customers know how long work on their vehicle will last, as we aren't always sure what repairs will be needed. We apologize that there was a delay in figuring out what was wrong with the vehicle, but we unfortunately had vehicles ahead of you that needed to be taken care of first. Our goal is always to meet our customers' expectations, and we regret that we weren't able to help more. We wish you the best and hope you were able to find the service you needed.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Rocky and Beverly McCurdy
text: Wanted to do a new review since they replied and lied on my other one. This shop lied and said I bought a used tire and brought it to them to put on after they told me that’s what I needed to stop a noise that they caused. Good used tires down the street replaced my tire not you all. I really need you all to stick with one lie. They also doctored paperwork saying I came up there earlier this year then sent out another letter saying I didn’t.  These people are CROOKS I promise you that. I’ve been told if they find out someone else fixes your car, they pay other mechanics that people take their cars to to fix the damage they did to avoid going to court. Good things don’t come to those who lie and don’t do right by people.

name: Laura Vines
text: I took my Subaru in for an oil change.  I asked them to look at the brakes to make sure they were good since it had been awhile.  The guy told me I needed rear brakes, and offered me a good price.  I could not afford it at the time, so I waited.  In the meantime, I spoke to a co-worker, who said, "OMG, don't go there!  I was there really recently and overheard the employees talking about one of the guys there who was so bad and told people they needed work they didn't need done, and were joking about it.!"  So I took it to another place for a second opinion, and they said I did not need brakes!  So buyer, beware.  I put one star because I had to put a star to post this, but I would not put any stars if that was an option!

resp.text:
Dear Laura,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. We appreciate your review and have looked into the issue you raised. We are a family owned automotive center and we strongly enforce providing our customers with an honest assessment of their vehicle needs. We treat all vehicles like our own and value each customer’s time and money. We are sorry if you were not satisfied with your last visit to our center and welcome the opportunity to discuss all of this with you. Thank you very much!

name: travia thomas
text: We just left the shop 30mins ago & when we made it home my belt started making a strange noise. We open the hood to find the oil stick wasn't closed all the way and a drill was stuck in between my belt and melt under my hood.... Wow I hope my belt isn't ruined and I have no future problems!

resp.text:
Hello Travia,
We appreciated the opportunity to service your vehicle for you. Shortly after you left our auto center, our technician noticed one of this tools was missing and we called you immediately to confirm the tool was still under your hood. You indicated you had the missing tool and our manager sincerely apologized for any inconvenience this may have caused you. We really appreciated you bringing the tool back to our shop the next day. Once you arrived, we were happy to inspect the belt and pulleys and found no damage. This was good news.

It was our pleasure to adjust your tire pressure and also install your fog lamp bulb at no charge, to compensate for our mishap. Everything seemed fine when you left our shop and you thanked us for our assistance, so we are a bit confused by this negative review. We are happy to discuss this with you anytime, and encourage you to contact one of the owners, Rick or Jamie Martin, at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

name: Eli Ashley
text: Easily the worst car shop I've ever been to. I would suggest going here if you want to see 5 mechanics chilling in the back room while 1 guy does most of the work. I've been here three times and they've all been awful. The most recent time I went I got an oil change. Not even a week later my car started acting funny and my change engine oil light came on. I looked at the preferred date to return and it said 2/30/2016. If they don't even know how many days are in February I don't see how anyone would expect them to properly fix cars.

resp.text:
Dear Eli,
We are very sorry to read that you are not happy with our automotive services and that you are experiencing auto issues. Our oil change sticker is generated by a computer and it sounds like it was a simple error that created the incorrect February date. We welcome the opportunity to discuss what happened and try to reach a positive outcome. Please contact the owners, Jamie and Rick Martin at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience. We look forward to speaking with you. Thank you!

text: I dont know much about cars but I came to this shop for a problem that was temporarily fixed turned out they missed what was really going on i always keep my receipt so i showed my new shop the work i had done and the new shop Im at told me what they missed im done... wasted 400 to not get my problem fixed I heard bad things about this shop its all true dont waste your time or money

We were sorry to read your review. Please know that we warranty all of our work and would welcome you back. Please feel free to reach out to us to schedule an appointment. We look forward to working with you and making this right. Thanks, Denise.

Jamie and Rick, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care
(205) 945-8863

name: Jaime Fields
text: Awesome great fast service!

name: Charitee Truss
text: I let them put my heater core in 3 days ago my car was running good just didn't have heat now I have no car to drive cause it barely cranks and cuts off every 5 mins but the workers can't tell me what's wrong this ain't right somebody please help me I had my own brand new heater core and antifreeze they charge 180 for labor extra 80 for hoses now I'm out a car

resp.text:
I am very sorry to read that your vehicle is not performing adequately, Mrs. Truss. I checked our records and we were happy to replace the heater core you provided on your 1992 Chevy Caprice. After assessing the car, we recommended replacing the other heater core and hoses, which you agreed. The car was still not performing well after the second assessment, so we then recommended replacing the throttle body. You asked to take the car for a second opinion, and let us know they provided you with the same assessment; the throttle body needed replacing. We stand behind all work where the parts are provided by Precision Tune Auto Care, with a 12 month guarantee. I am happy to work with you to find an affordable and honest resolution to get your car running in a reliable manner. You can reach me at (205) 945-8863. I look forward to talking with you soon. Thank you.
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Mel M
text: On Jan 19, 2019 at about 1pm I took my car to this Precision.  If I could give zero stars I would.  They were to fix a Cv boot leak and replace pads on my front breaks.  The employee got into a car accident and damaged my car.  In addition, the break work was incomplete.  I had to after waiting over 5 hours immediately return to them for noises in the breaks.  But back to the accident, the police took statements from the witnesses.  The report states it was Precision Tune and Auto care at fault.  The employee even stated he was sorry and didnt see the other driver.  They were intially so appologetic. When I tried to contact Precision about repairs the manager Chris said he was waiting on the police report.  I kindly had my insurance make a copy for him and delivered it to him.  I call week later again asking what will happen or if someone will contact me.  He gives a different story getting short with me and saying they arent responsible for anything.  I asked if his company's insurance co will call me he got short with me.  I have complained to corporate but since this is an independent franchise their hands are tied so they say.  They charged me 584 for work performed and my car still has issues and damage to the body because of the employee's negligence and nobody is willing to fix the issue.  Who wrecks your car and then tells you their not responsible.  Well the manager Chris did.

name: Justin Hamilton
text:
I WILL NOT DO THIS AGAIN.

SOOOOOO...where to begin. So this is my third visit to this campus, and needless to say, I'M PISSED. In a twenty-four hour period, I've seen this place three time, with minimum 1.5 hour wait, except for today. I come in the third time for the oil change with tire rotation, and I am denied service same day for the rotation. Ask for the same discount on tire rotations with oil changes since I have to come..even back again, and I am denied that. I understand business is jumping, but I would've been fine with a 50% off (normally $60), but can't even do that. Being a customer here the last minimum 5 years, this has to be the worst service and answer I've received, definitely when I'm spending my time to come and patronize, and giving chance after chance.

text: Very thorough and helpful.

resp.text: Mr. Morgan - We are glad to hear we provided you with thorough and helpful auto care. Thank you for visiting us! ~Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: P Teague
text:
This place just tried to charge me 546.00 for a tune up!!!!! 36.00 per spark plug, &226.00 for labor!!!! I went and bought my spark plugs for 46.00(all six) and  the mechanic isn't charging a third of the price they are asking! This is highway robbery!!!!

Then I called another Precision Auto Tune and was quoted almost $200 less for the same service on the same car what in the heck is going on at that Homewood location that is really sad $200 more that is so ridiculous!!!!!

name: Jamil Miles
text: Fast, reliable, and great customer service

name: Katie Odom
text: I was freaked out by the negative reviews for this place, but the price was good so I figured I could give it a try. My experience was no fuss and fast, and I'm glad I gave it a try after all.

resp.text:
Dear Katie,
We are so happy to you gave us a try as well. It was our pleasure to provide you with an excellent experience at our auto shop. Our team looks forward to being your #1 choice going forward, for all of your vehicle's maintenance. We are family owned, we work hard, and always strive to deliver a fair price. Thanks so much for your business.
Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Katherine Miller
text: I wish I did not even have to give one star as this place is so awful. I have paid close to $1,500 in repairs here just for my axle to break because it was not properly repaired. Now that another mechanic has my vehicle he told me the control arms were put on incorrectly causing further damage to the car, the sway bar linkage was held by electrical tape, and I'm lucky I didn't lose control of my car and kill myself driving it in the condition WHICH I PAID WELL TO HAVE FIXED! It is not only completely shady and unethical but dangerous. I hope someone sues this place and gets them shut down before they kill somebody! Seriously, don't take your car here unless you want a near death experience.

resp.text:
Dear Katherine,
We are very sorry to read that your recent visit to our Precision Tune Auto Care center did not meet your expectations. It is our sincere intention to provide every customer with exceptional service. We are very proud to offer a 12 month, 12,000 mile warranty on all services, when the parts are provided by our center. We were happy to allow you to provide your own parts for us to install and our team recommended other services, noted on your inspection sheet. The axle is under warranty and we look forward to working with you in order to find a positive resolution. Please contact Rick at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

name: Tashona Reese
text: Seems I'm not the only person who's gotten ripped off at this location. I was charged $800.00 for a Brake job. I paid because I was told my brakes were at 10% and having started a new job across town, I didn't want to take a chance to continue driving on them. The staff was super friendly as long as they got their money but, when I called the next day to inquire about how they price their parts, of course nobody knew anything. I left my number for the manager to call me back, this was in September, 2015 and I still have not received a call. I also reached out to corporate and they informed me that it's out of their hands because each location is independently owned, but they would however forward my complaint/ info on to the regional maanger, who I have yet to hear from. I have no problem paying for services rendered, but I do have a problem when businesses are shady.Do not go to this location.

resp.text:
Dear Tashona,
My name is Rick Martin and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. I read your recent review and am sorry that you feel we overcharged you. We went over all of the costs with you before beginning the service on your vehicle and you approved everything. We do not wish to lose your business, so please contact me to discuss this further and hopefully we can find a positive resolution. I tried to contact you and got only as far as voicemail. I look forward to hearing from you. Thank you, Rick (205) 760-9904!

name: Valerie Garner
text: Last oil change I had was done they were in a rush. When they were done. They handed me  unfilled diagonsed I guess test of what was wrong with my car. I would of liked to know what problems my car needs repairs to. It's an older aution car. So I was looking forward to fix the major problems. But instead I didn't receive a through reading

name: v bee
text: After reading all the negative reviews. I decided to post my honest non bias factual review .First and foremost I'm a Christian and I'm not by any means being paid to give a postive review .I have been to this location numerous times ,and each time I've had nothing but postive results .Yes most companies rather car related or not have bad apples .But once those bad apples are eradicated then the true  nature of the company will grow .Rick the owner is one of the caring person I've ever had the chance of coming in contact with .I'm a small business owner myself and know the impact of hiring the wrong people .I would recommend this shop to the pope ..Be blessed

resp.text:
Dear v bee,
Thank you for your kind review. We really appreciate our customers and especially appreciate you taking the time to post a 5-star review for us. We wanted to make sure your vehicle was safe for you to drive and were happy to repair your brakes and A/C. Please let us know if you need anything and thanks again for your business!  ~ Rick, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Nicola Mallory
text: The worst place to take your car for an oil change....you go in for a oil change but you leaving out with more problems then you came with. I took my car for an oil change an when I left an made it to my destination the coolent pipe bust an it ran hot for the first time ever. When i took it back he told me they cant see why its on H. Let's not mention the people that said duhhhh when I told them about my experience there. I can't wait until they close the place down & replace it with something more beneficial to the people.

resp.text:
Hello Nicola,
Thank you for visiting our auto shop recently for an oil change. I spoke with our shop manager and they indicated that during the oil change they saw your Valve Cover Gasket was leaking. We were happy to replace this for you and also suggested replacing the coolant hose. You declined replacing the coolant hose and signed the paperwork stating you were aware of the worn condition of the hose.

I am sorry that you experienced issues shorty after leaving our shop. We would be happy to help resolve them, if you would like to give me a call to make an appointment. I can be reached at (205) 945-8863 and hope to hear from you. Thank you!
Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

text: The owner of this store, Rick, is a good man and an honest man.  If you are unhappy with work that has been done by his staff, contact him.  He will return your telephone call and work with you to resolve the issue.

resp.text:
Hello Concerned Parent, I wanted to let you know that we are very sorry that you felt like your daughter was not taken care of to your satisfaction. I am a parent too, and I truly understand the value of a trustworthy vehicle for our children to drive, especially when they go away to college.

I spoke with our manager and he tested the battery when your daughters vehicle was towed to our shop. Our testing indicated the battery was defective and also showed swelling on the side. When a new battery was installed, the car started and your daughter was able to drive it once again.

We are a family owned auto shop that takes great pride in providing each customer with honest, affordable, and friendly car maintenance. I would be more than happy to discuss all of this with you, in hopes of reaching an amicable solution. Please contact me at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience, or provide me with the best way to reach you and the best time to call at the following email address: jmartin@ptacit.com. I look forward to talking with you. Thank you.
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Danny Vines
text: These people will rip you off. Charge you for parts and service that you don't need and take advantage of people in desperate situations. Stay away from this place at all costs.

resp.text:
I am saddened that your recent experience at our auto center did not exceed your expectations, Danny. We work very hard to provide each customer with honest, affordable and professional auto maintenance solutions. We towed your 2000 Jeep Cherokee to our shop after you could not get it started at a local gas station. After running a few diagnostic tests we concluded the starter was bad and you agreed to have it replaced. Once that was done we continued with our testing and also recommended replacing the ignition switch, which you also agreed to have replaced. When asked if we could put the old starter back into the vehicle, we recommended not doing this, since our comprehensive testing showed the old starter was bad. Autozone ran a test on the old starter as well and came to the same conclusion; the old starter was bad and should not be reinstalled.  I am happy to work with you to get your vehicle back on the road and can be reached at the number shown below. Thank you!
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham
(205) 945-8863

name: Frank Buchanan Jr. (VooDoo)
text:
The employees of this location is not well versed in customer satisfaction and have a tendacy to have a sharp mouth. One of the store managers has manhood issues and thinks that all should bow down into him when he's nothing but pie. His name is Chris and have been employed by Precision multiple times...he has been known to steal cash from the register and also, had a bad drug habit as well. I'd strongly advise that you take your vehicle elsewhere. The owner of this Precision also has other locations around town and he doe not care about truth concerning how his business is ran but rather gotten money hungry at the expense of his employees and the customers.  Nor is their word any good for they tell you what you wanna hear but not man enough to deliver. All Precision Tune locations need to be under new management or close their doors for good.
I speak this in truth for I was once employed with this establishment. I'm an ASE Master Certified Diesel & Gas Technician...yet was treated with disrespect and was lied to about the pay scale. I've seen firsthand the deceit & trickery of staff. Nor do they abide by standards placed before them in order to maintain a respectable business. Of course there's more to the story but enough has been said to bring the customers awareness up..for it is my duty & obligation to expose such when at the customers expenses.
It speaks volumes when you bring things to their attention yet they fail to acknowledge you or allow an explanation....so I chose to terminate my employment and since then...I've been trying to contact those in charge so that I may retrieve my other toolbox at the Pelham location but have yet been able to. Goes to show the level of care when they lose a highly trained technician because the so called service manager has no real knowledge of automobiles but is allowed to make decisions above his experience...but I'm being hindered in accessing all my tools since i can't the owners to meet me there to get my belongings. The Pelham store momentarily closed due to lack of business but yet they don't see as to why when it's self evident.
Please take your business elsewhere...even if it's to one like Hellen Keller...you'd have a better chance of getting professional lasting repairs.

Attention to management: I need my tools from the Pelham location and have notified Chris and txt Rick only to receive absolutely no reply. If interested in the truth....please contact me....

resp.text:
Hello Frank,
We always appreciate receiving reviews from our valued customers based on services received. Since you have not been a customer at our auto shop, I believe this review in in direct violation of the Google Review Guidelines which state: "Off-topic reviews: Don’t post reviews based on someone else’s experience, or that are not about the specific place you’re reviewing. Reviews aren’t meant to be a forum for general political or social commentary or personal rants.” We kindly ask that you remove this review from our Google page. I am happy to make sure you have all of your tools mentioned, and encourage you to please contact Jamie at (205) 945-8863 to make arrangements. Thank you!
Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

resp.text:
Dear ra duhon,
I am sorry to read our services did not meet your expectations and wanted to respond to your review. When you first came to us we were happy to repair the issue with the main seal with parts you provided. When we install parts from the customer, they are not covered by any warranty. We reviewed all of our security tapes and found no foul play regarding items removed from your vehicle while on our premises. Since we could not seem to find a positive resolution, a release was signed by you stating a full refund was provided, and all maintenance was performed to your satisfaction. Throughout this entire process we have shown extreme patience and honesty and have kept in continuous communication with you to try and resolve this to your satisfaction. We wish you all the best!

Our initial inspection of your vehicle indicated you needed the following maintenance; brake inspection, CV Axle replaced, cracks found in a belt, and multiple oil leaks. name: Devin Farrell
text: There a awsemome mechanic there

name: grace skidmore
text:
Their motto is to treat you like family and they do! professional, friendly caring and kind this team exhibits performance excellence. They are expeditious and knowledgeable plus willing to go the extra mile to get the job done. When they have to deliver less than desired news they are forthright and honest. The integrity of this outfit is refreshing to find and is a credit to the long history and tradition of being customer-centric.

John and his crew will take care of you and your auto repairs. No need to go anywhere else.

name: Ashraf Hijaz
text: Best customer service in town, no Ethanol in their fuel.

name: Jose Vazquez
text: Personable and kind staff. My car battery died and they had someone come tow my car right away. The mechanic got to it really quick and my vehicle was ready for pick up the same day. The mechanic took his time to explain other issues he saw and was able to address — he even called ahead and asked if I wanted my oil changed. Highly recommend bringing your car here. Just call ahead and ask if it’s busy since the shop is pretty small compared to others.

name: Charlie Pennell
text: Cloverdale Service Center is my go to place for all work needed on my car. Great service and always professional. Anyone needing any work done on their vehicles check out Cloverdale Service Center.  John and his team always treat me like family.

name: Penny Weaver
text: There's lots to like about Montgomery's Cloverdale neighborhood, and at the top of that list is Cloverdale Service Center. Not only is it a convenient stop for high-quality gas, John and his skilled staff provide prompt, dependable service on most anything your car may need. Need a set of tires? John can suggest the best choice for your vehicle, order and install them with no hassle for you. We dropped our car off at closing time on Monday, and it was ready to go, new tires in place and aligned, before 11 the next morning. It is a comfort to have a reliable resource like Cloverdale Service Center nearby.

name: Amanda Giddings
text: I got stuck in Montgomery on my way home from Pensacola and was fortunate enough to find this amazing auto shop. They managed to fix my car despite it being hard to find parts near them and got me back on the road within a day. With me being a college student traveling alone and getting stuck somewhere I’ve never been, I was beyond grateful to have found this place. They showed me the problems with my car that led to it breaking down and told me exactly how they intended to fix it as well as how much it would cost. The people there were also very kind and accommodating. If I lived in the area, this would be my go to auto shop and I certainly intend to go there again if I ever find myself in the area. I recommend this without question for anyone seeking auto services in this area.

name: Two Brothers Pressure Washing
text: The Best Auto shop in montgomery! All the staff are super knowledgeable, friendly, and treat you like family. Plus they will check your car while they pump your gas!

name: John Martello
text: Excellent work done quickly and successfully at a very fair price.  I can't recommend Cloverdale Service Center enough.  Also, they're a bunch of good guys!

name: Jorge Serafin
text: Friendly, professional, and reasonable prices.

name: Art Sullivan
text: Great place to take your car or truck.Friendly service. Knowledgeable mechanics.

name: Kat Serafin
text: Honest work and fair prices.  I paid $100 to the Toyota dealership mechanics to plug in the computer and tell me nothing was wrong with my car - I doubt they even lifted the hood, let alone test drove it!  John at Cloverdale Service inspected and replaced burned out spark plugs and corroded battery wire - something the previous mechanics should have easily diagnosed if they'd bothered to look past the computer screen!  Got everything fixed up, plus oil change, for an extremely reasonable price, and now my 13 year old car runs like new!  This is my go-to mechanic from now on!

text:
Cloverdale Service Center's great.

text: Omg... i think this place might be my new car shop. Friendly and good service

name: Andrea Wheeler
text:
New to the area and didn't know anyone who could suggest somewhere to get my car worked on who I could trust. Looked online and saw "family environment", "great people", "great service" frequently associated with Cloverdale. Those reviews were nothing short of the truth. All of the staff was extremely friendly, helpful and genuinely cared not only about getting me in and out, but made a lasting impression on me personally.

I only had minor service done, but my time was not wasted ...like you normally feel when you sit at a car shop for hours just to get an oil change. I was in and out in less than 30 minutes!

I would suggest Cloverdale to any and everyone I know.

text: I purchased almost 2 thousand dollars worth of tires from this location for a 2008 dodge dually in September 2020. On February 15th 2021 I took truck in for a rotation and brake inspection. They did the rotation wrong and put two tires that were worn way down and put on outer tears which started skinning them fast. Less than 200 miles down the road and the rear brake pads were metal on metal yet they supposedly just did a brake inspection. Today I took truck back so they could address the issues they cause and they wanted me to pay for their errors. I was fine with covering costs of brakes but the tires was their error. They did want to take care of me the customer. I picked my truck up and will leave this same review on every site I can find and contact an attorney Monday morning to address this matter.

text: I brought a tire in to have a leaky bead fixed, and was told they couldn't touch it because it was older than 2007, and it was against the law.  Well, I looked it up, there is no such law, state or federal regarding tire repairs regardless of age.  They flat out lied....obviously in an attempt to sell me new tires.  Pretty sad.  Also, their oil changes are wayyyy to expensive.  You can go pretty much anywhere else and save some cash.

resp.text: We take the care of our customer's vehicles very seriously. Thank you for informing us, Stan. We want to dig in to learn more about your experience and work to improve going forward. If you could, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon!

name: Swainer (swainer)
text: These guys are incredible. ALL OF THEM! I have always gone to Discount Tires ...up until now.  I have never met a bunch of guys with better customer service than these guys. We had a situation where we were traveling in our BMW i3 and had a blow-out and nobody- not even the BMW dealership in Huntsville had the tire in stock that our car required. Each and every one of them genuinely cared about our situation and never stopped trying to help us figure it out and get us back on the road. These guys went out of there way and took care of us and got what we needed done.  If I even lived in a 50 mile radius of this store and these guys they would have my business all day long. I cant say enough about these guys... it makes me feel really good that there are still people like this on this planet.  Don't go anywhere else, I can promise you that theres nobody else going to take care of you better than they can.

resp.text: Yeahhhhhh buddy! Glad we were able to take care of ya, Mark. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us. We love having you in the TD family.

name: Steve Zanussi
text:
After noticing at a road stop that there was a bubble on the sidewall of my tire while on a long trip, I went to the closest Tire Discounters I could find.  There I was told that it would be at least three hours to change my tire.  They referred me to this location--8873 Highway 72, Huntsville--several miles away.

Upon entering I was greeted by the General Manager, Tyler Thurmond, who assessed the tire, and notified me that they did not have my tire in stock.  (They did have it in stock at the first place, but they had never checked.)  Tyler told me that it would take an hour and a half to get the tire there, but that once they had it, it could be put on very quickly.

Tyler had the delivery of the tire expedited for us, because we mentioned that we had to get up north by a set time.  The entire visit took about 45 minutes, including the delivery of the tire.

Thank you so much, Tyler Thurmond, for your exceptional customer service.  If I find myself needing a tire in Huntsville again, I know where I will go.

resp.text: Wowzeritos! Thanks for the review, Steve. We really appreciate the 5 stars and hope to see ya again for any of your tire or auto care needs! Take a look at our full services at https://tirediscounters.com/services

name: Andrew Smith
text: BUYER BEWARE!  I would recommend to do research on any pricing they give you.  Here is what happened.  Called got a verbal quote of $139-189 per axle for a brake job with rotor's turned which is fair they are just below the dealer which was $200 per axle.  Went the next day to have services done to my car.  Before they began work they inspected it and determine I needed pads all the way and rotor's on the rear and a brake fluid exchange.  Estimate price was over $700.  I declined the brake fluid exchange and they offered some "competitive" discounts brought my total down to about $580.  Still more than it should be.  Asked for a printed estimate when I saw the estimate I knew something was up.  They had part numbers and prices on the estimate.  Quick Google search confirmed the part numbers and prices from a local part supply store that they would be getting the parts from.  They are marking up parts pricing 100+%.  Industry standard is between 10-25%.  Then they told me that the estimate was nearly at cost and if he went any lower he would lose his job.  Nothing but scam and scare tactics were used with me and I didn't take the bait.  Tried to email the address on the general managers card it wouldn't ever go through.  Called the corporate office gave them the info and the pictures I have attached here and they said a regional manager would get back with me still have not heard from that person either.  BEWARE OF THIS PLACE AND THE CHECK ANY PRICES THEY GIVE YOU!

resp.text: We take pride in our craft and place a great amount of emphasis on pricing ourselves competitively. We are continuously evaluating. We want to dig in to learn more. If you are willing, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon.

Jody and Sarah got my car  straight in to the garage and my tire being fixed.  The customer service that the two of them and there staff showed today helped turn a bad day into a BLESSED DAY. My daughter and I sat for a little bit and before I knew it the tire was repaired. Thanks  guys for helping us out ! We will definitely come back to see you in the future !

name: Ashley Patterson
text: I have never had a bad experience with Powell Automotive until Wednesday. My car had been at the shop for almost a month and the only information given to me the first week was that it could be my motor. Each week I called to get an update and I was given a day that he would look at it. Well of course that never happened.  On Wednesday I went by the shop since I was in the area to get an update. David's wife went and spoke with David only to tell me it could be my motor and he has not had a chance to look back at it. My next question to her was when will he get a chance to look at it. And with an attitude she told me she didn't know and for me to speak with David.  I went over to David and introduced myself and he explained the same thing that he told me over three weeks ago. I explained to him that I'm in someone else's car and I need an update. He then begins to explain that other cars were ahead of me. And like I told David my car has been at this shop for almost a month and I've called weekly for updates and that is something you could have explained to me while we were on the phone. He also told me he would look into the recalls for my car and that never happened. I researched that information and presented to him on Wednesday. Then he says I'll look at it by the end of the week. I had just called him Friday morning and he told me that he would look at it that afternoon and give me a call but here we are in another week and I'm supposed to believe that he was going to look at it by the end of week. This was the worse experience ever dealing with David. His mother rest her soul ran an awesome business!! Her presence is definitely missed. I will not conduct any business with them ever again.

name: John Zehnder
text: David and team did a great job with my Ford F-350. It had some a/c issues and I heard he was the best to deal with those. They fixed it quickly and even knocked a couple bucks off of the quote as it didn’t take the estimated amount of time to complete.

name: Michael Rabig
text: Outstanding service, good prices. Fixed the AC on my F150

name: Josh Waldeck
text:
Bottom line: David Powell absolutely saved us from a tight spot. He's extremely knowledgable and kind, and will repair your vehicle effectively while charging a fair price. This shop may not look fancy, nor does it even have a website, but this is a quality mechanic who you can trust.

(Not so) quick story:

We have a 2013 VW Tiguan, which had a series of oil leaks over the past year. Each time the car began to malfunction, we took the car to the jack ingram dealership, where we would be given some roundabout oil leak explanation and reluctantly let them do the $300+ repair. The car has ~90,000 miles and is up to date on scheduled maintenance.

In May 2020, the car indicated low oil and started to shudder on the interstate with a low oil issue again, so we took it to a local firestone and capped off the oil then drove to jack ingram. While the service representative (Megan) was extremely pleasant and professional, her explanation of the mechanics' diagnostics was absurd. She said that the timing chain needed to be replaced (at 90k miles, a part which should last at least 120,000 miles) along with the chain tensioner and a series of other gaskets, totaling ~$3,400. As some sort of bizarre sales oriented pressure tactic, they offered an alternative - replacing the engine - as they printed a quote that was approximately $12,000. The car is maybe worth $6,500.

I asked for a parts list to understand the extent of the bill and noticed that these people want to replace every durable bolt, washer, screw, etc. possible in order to drive the price up as much as possible (image attached). Obviously, we took the $140 hit on the diagnostic fee and went elsewhere.

Thankfully, after calling local shops, we found Powell's Automotive in downtown Montgomery, where David Powell's team actually conducted a diagnosis with UV dyed oil to find the source of the leak (high pressure oil pump), which had nothing to do with the timing chain (tensioner returned to the correct position once the oil was returned to normal pressure). The timing chain was absolutely fine. We ended up paying a fraction of the cost for the correct repair on the vehicle to a company that actually wants to do the job right.

We would have spent $3,400+ for an unnecessary new timing chain and STILL would have had the same issue, had it not been for Mr. Powell. He was extremely professional and diligent with the issue, even driving the car 40+ miles to confirm the issue was resolved after repair.

If you want the job done right, and for it to be priced fairly, go to Powell's Automotive.

name: Melvonnia Knight
text: The staff did a. A great job to my vehicle , I would recommend every body that I know to go to Mr. Powell, the staff is very professional and great customer service , I will be letting Mr.powell taking care or my vehicle in the future .

They did a wrong diagnostics on my VW and replaced the part that was already replaced brand new. I drove from Troy in the morning and was at the place at 7:30, from then till 5PM they wasted all my time. At the end of the day I left the place with a $250 bill for their fault. name: T. Ferguson DiazBrothersFan
text: I gave one star because the girl at front is very sweet and there was a helpful guy, but we left car on a Wednesday at 10am. I explained we really needed the car asap because I have cancer and lupus etc and will be hard for me to give people rides to work etc at 5am! They explain there was cars in front of mine (6) Thursday it was to be done...nope! Friday the were sure by then...NO, the mechanic that looked at it had left for the day and weekend. The other mechanics had jobs and they couldn't get to mine...nothing! They need a mechanic for minor jobs like mine (bearings to be replaced) and other mechanics for the bigger jobs...if you got one car and need it done same or next day or actually in three ...don't go here! I feel the mechanic that looked at the car should have just fixed it. Oh they were supposed to have called as well..no such thing happened, the mechanic just didn't want to do the job! I have never taken a car somewhere where they did not have their stuff together like this place! Never even called for a status update or to tell us anything about the car! Taking car to another place who can have work done in one hour!!! The car set there for 3 days!!!!!

text: Amazing company!!!  We were referred by discount tire. Polite hard-working people. Thank you for putting us back on the road so quickly. Feeling safe Carole

name: Joe Shultz
text:
I went there for a new water pump for a Chevy SUV. A new water pump was installed, but didn't last 100 miles. I returned the vehicle only to have the auto shop refuse to replace the water pump free of charge. I removed the water pump that weekend to find they cross threaded the new water pump and warped the unit. No wonder it did not function properly. After re-tapping a couple of screws and several hours out of my Saturday I replaced the new pump myself. Now I am out the price of another water pump, thanks a lot.

Many people do not know this, but each repair job has an attached amount of time associated with it. So, if an auto center changes your brakes in 30 min but the book says it takes 1.5 hours, then the shop charges you for the extra hour as an extra rake. Now, I do not mind paying the extra as long as the quality matches. This shop may do quick work, but it is not at the quality I am paying for. Poor value given, and they would not make it right either. Basically the repair guy did not remove all the necessary components (like a radiator) to save some time and shoved the water pump in at an angle.

I will never use them again.

name: Heather M
text: Griffin is a lifesaver! My truck blew a spark plug and I had two kids with me along with my husband. We were about 300 miles from home! I thought we were stranded and repair was going to cost a fortune. Griffin used his OWN vehicle to drive 3 exits up to assist us. He was able to get the undamaged spark plug back in and also brought us a brand new coil pack and put it in. He did this repair out of the kindness of his heart and we cannot thank him enough! He was honest from the get go. He could have told us the truck needed a new head or worse and made a ton of money, but he fixed the problem quickly and didn't charge us a fractuon of what he could have! Thank you Griffin, you were our Angel! His shop may be behind sometimes, but he is worth the wait if you want an honest mechanic!

name: Sheree Lewis
text: New owner, great guy great work! I recommend this place for all your auto work .

name: Travis Gibbs
text:
I brought my car and truck to them when they first opened. They fixed both and stuck to fair estimate.

I wouldn't do business with them now after my last experience.

Month 1 & 2
Our car needed a new engine. The shop owner wanted to get an engine from his supplying junkyard. He missed one that became available. This process took about 2 weeks before we decided to find an engine ourselves which he was not happy with but agreed to. He said they could have it put in within a 3 day period. The engine company we bought from needed it done in 10 days for warranty purposes. Griffith used all of the 10 days to because other cars came in front of me while we had to wait on engine. They finally got it in and started but had to send to dealership because the car went into anti-theft mode and wouldn't start. We had to actually arrange the drop off to the dealership ourselves. I feel like we were running his business for him because he was almost never there. The employees even mentioned that problem in passing.

Month 3
We become worried after not hearing anything from dealership or Griffin for about 2.5ish weeks. I had to contact dealership for them to tell me that they told Griffin that the car needed a major fuse panel that could be $1200+. I called Griffin to tell him I approved the install because we really needed the car. It's month 3 folks!

Is it Month 4? Getting close anyway.
We had to go ourselves to the dealership to confront them about not getting to our car. This should be Griffin's job. The dealership says that the part didn't fix the problem. Car still doesn't work. We decide to give up because the car needed another part for $2400 to "maybe" fix. We decide to just give up. Dealership is trying to get more money from us even though they didn't fix the problem. Griffin is trying to put that on us. We said we would pay for his time, but does this seem fair? Griffin himself might be a knowledgable mechanic, but he is a rookie business owner with no organization or management skills of his people.  He wasted a huge amount of our time (3+months), money ($6000+) and stressed my wife and I to no end. We are going to have to scrap our car with a new engine that doesn't run.

They do good oil changes and put a muffler on another car we brought, but he also made me pay for the part up front which shows bad business to me as well.

* FINAL RESULT
paid griffin $1400 because the car ended up not working out. He said he made no money and it would have been $2000 if it had worked + whatever it would be to charge AC. When we walked in to pay he didn't even recognize us. My wife and I talked to this guy several times in person and on phone. The waiting area had mice running around too FYI if you are scared of them. After that we went to the dealer shop that had our car and basically gave it to the tech working on it. he paid for the dealer work and gave us a little cash. When we went to clean the car out I noticed that the driver seat leather looked very dirty and worn. Griffin said he was sorry.

name: Kristina Garrison
text: I am honestly disappointed, this shop has Amazing POTENTIAL. However, I don't feel it is being ran efficiently. I have called with no answer, mupltiple occasions. I also have the concern of the child/childern that are running through shop all day, most days. I have also had to keep from hitting many toys, many times. I believe the shop is in an amazing location, and again has all potential in the wprld. Unfourtnally, right now, I wouldn't recommend it.

name: Chris Ruffin
text:
I moved to McCalla in March of 2015. I was looking for a dependable repair shop that did quality work and that I could become a repeat customer with. I chose Griffin Automotive because they are ASE certified and after using them with 3 vehicles (06 Nissan Altima, 05 Chevy Silverado, & 2015 Nissan Altima) I have had no complaints with them.

They do great work, and are realistic with their estimates. If you are looking for a repair shop with a quick turnaround (meaning hours instead of days) then this may not be the shop for you, but I have a spare vehicle and can leave the vehicle for repairs.  They typically tell me that they have other vehicles in front of mine, but will look at it as soon as they get a free moment. I have sent my cars or truck to them at least 9 times (using both the overnight drop box and just bringing it in) and have only waited longer than a day once (and that was because the part got their late in the evening and I picked it up after work the next day)

I have had multiple types of jobs: brakes pads for Altima and Silverado, rotors for Altima and Silverado,, brake drums for Silverado, oil change for Altima and Silverado, window regulator replacement on Silverado, oil leak repair on Altima, engine mounts on Altima, transfer case replacement Silverado 4x4, along with other normal maintenance type items

I tried calling them and got hung up on so when I drove up there they were all laying around on couches doing nothing. The guy was rude and the mechanic didn't even know where he had put the keys at. Finally got my keys and just took my car home because they were very unprofessional. Now we will have to go to another mechanic to fix what they messed up. The managers, Tim specifically, are also patient, and helpful both on the phone and in store and truly take time out of their day to talk to you about servicing, previous records, dates of service, and HONEST recommendations. You will NOT wait in line here like you will at the dealership, the longest time I've waited for the entire oil change to be done is 15 minutes here, and that included the "wait" to begin. Everyone here has a great attitude and a willingness to help! I cannot say enough positive things about this Express location, you will always be treated like a human and not just the next car in line.

name: Holly Carr
text: Went to this location for an oil change, but my tire pressure light was on so I got them to check on this too.  One of my tires was entirely too low (pressure at 15 when should be at 35, all other tires were only at 30).  Any knowledgeable technician would have removed my tire to check for a leak, but he insisted the tire was fine.  After filling the tires & resetting, the tire pressure light was still on.  He told me not to worry and to "be careful" with that tire--incredibly vague.  Turns out there was a leak, which left me with a flat tire & stranded in Atlanta the next day.  It's clear that the technicians I dealt with had a blatant disregard for my safety and the safety of my vehicle.  I will never return to another Express Oil Change, nor recommend this location to anyone I know.

text: Quick service, friendly technicians, easy to understand options! Adam was very helpful with understanding what we needed and how long it would take/how much it would cost! I will be returning!

name: Matthew Tucker
text:
I noticed gas dripping near my fuel filter.  I didn't know for sure exactly where or what was causing it, didn't want to spend my only free evening of the week with my wife and kid trying to figure it out, but also didn't want to leave a leak overnight so I took off work early to go get it fixed.  My vehicle needed an oil change as well anyway so I took it in and explained it was likely the filter or one of the lines that needed replaced.

Sure they changed my oil no problem, but the guy came around and said he wouldn't fix the leak, that it was a "missing o-ring that they didn't carry in stock" and I'd need to take it back to whoever put the existing filter on and have them do the repair.  Now, I replace my filters every 40,000 miles or so and I've moved a couple of times since then.  I have no idea where I was exactly when I replaced my filter last, because it's a small fix.  I got there at 4:30 pm, close of business at 6, so it wasn't like I pulled up at quitting time.  I had to take more time off work the next morning to disconnect everything myself and find it was simply a hairline crack in the filter.  The mechanic that I talked to didn't even verify anything, except what I already knew that yep there's a fuel leak there.  He just spewed some bs that he thought sounded good because he didn't feel like doing his job... REPLACING A DAMAGED FUEL FILTER SO I'M NOT DRIPPING GASOLINE EVERYWHERE I GO.

I'll find somewhere else for auto service, and I'd recommend you do the same if it's anything other than an oil change.

resp.text: Hi Matthew. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

text: Its amazing how God leads you in the right direction! My wife and I were 450 miles away from home and was having tire problems. text: Had oil changed by Express and afterafter I noticed my car leaking oil. I took it back to Express and the guy said it was leaking from the drain plug and for me to go purchase one and bring it back and he would replace it. I take it back the next day and still leaking after replacing it and so the guy proceeds to say I need a new oil pan and they would email me the price for oil pan and installation. A week went by and I never received the email nor a phone call. I took my car to the dealer and and they replaced my oil pan. They said it was stripped and they (Express) had try to repair it with a repair kit but obviously didn't work. My car was not leaking oil before I took it to Express but was after they changed my oil and so they costed me $560+. I will not be going back to Express for anything.

text: The service was delivered with a smile. I had an oil change and power steering flush both of which were done all in an hour which was fantastic. They notice several things that I had forgotten about for normal servicing and reminded me of them/ offered to do them as well. Would go back again if needed.

text: My car has been the most faithful vehicle until I brought it to this location. I allowed them to replace brakes and rotors (which I later find out that only one set of brakes were replaced which is a not appropriate) only to be left with awful noises coming from my car. I have returned my car to this location several times only to be told nothing is wrong. Stick to the oil changes!!

text: If I could give this shop no stars I would!  I have been using this facility for years and I'm not sure if it is under new management or if they have a new crew but the last several visits have been poor but today takes the cake. I was heading out of town and wanted to swing by for a 10 minute oil change. All the bays were full and the two on the far right had cars that had been there for a while when I pulled up, I was instructed to stay in the second bay. After 30 minutes of sitting without moving-yes I said 30 minutes of a 10 minute service! After no one even explained why there was a delay I backed up and left! Now I'm running late and still haven't gotten my oil changed! Guess I will try the new Quick Lanes across the street!!

The fuel injection service suggested by the technician was $69.95, however  I agreed to have completed per their recommendation but my receipt noted this service is only required every 15K miles...since purchasing this vehicle, i have driven 7,260K total  miles - - only HALF the amount of miles met to reach milage anywhere close to making this expensive "upsell service add-on" considerable. I don't appreciate insincere & dishonest "advice" to line the pockets of greedy service providers...or are my expectations too high or unrealistic - absolutely not. Karma's coming....

name: Samantha Roy
text: I highly recommend this place! My Mom and I were on our way to Charlotte, NC and were planning a night stay in Montgomery. Our battery light on the dashboard came on about 50 miles out. We made it to the hotel that night as the car dies out! We figured it was the alternator. The next morning (btw, this is Christmas Eve), we look on Google for places to service the car and two others whose sites showed opened at 7am didn’t answer the phone. So we called Performance Auto Repair at 7am thinking to leave a message because they open at 7:30am. Well the phone rang once and they answered 30 minutes earlier than their opening time! They worked hard for us, got us a towing service right away and fixed the problem by 10:30 that morning! They were a God send!! Definitely go to them when you need! Thanks guys!!

text: Great customer service on the phone. Had to wait a little bit to get correct person to call me back. But other than that...no complaints

text: I had a great experience with this business. I have had problems with my air conditioning for months. I took my car to the dealership and it was there for a week and my air conditioning still did not work. I took my car here a few weeks ago, and they had it fixed in less than 48 hours. They were very professional and the price was reasonable, much less than others have charged me for not even fixing the problem. I would recommend this business. They take pride in what they do.

resp.text: Thank you! Glad we could get your A/C repaired.

name: Kevin Krouse
text:
Disclaimer: This is not intended as bad mouthing. It is purely a report of the facts.*** Okay, I literally walked into the shop. The employees were not rude, so a plus for that. I asked for a quote for Rancho shocks (all four) for my 2001 Dodge Ram 1500. They wanted to sell me each shock for $175/piece. Yes, $175 for one shock X4. Additionally they wanted to charge $14.96 for shop supplies. $715 for parts (including shop supplies...) On top, they wanted $296.97 for labor to install the shocks.

Bottom line: Those shocks are going for $75/shock on Amazon. I understand and support a small mark up. Everybody must make money. However, charging $100 for mark up?? I recommend military personnel boycott this place. I have no bias against this place. I'm not from here, and have no past dealings with them. That is all.

I've attached the estimate for your viewing pleasure.

resp.text: Mr. Krouch, we apologize for your experience. That is not how we do business. We support our military 100%. We would like to have the opportunity to make it right. Please, give us a call or come by during business hours today and we will do our best to make it right.

name: Alice Yelder
text: Had a f250 lifted on fri may 31, I was very disappointed I wanted truck lifted because it was scrubbing, the people there lifted truck like I asked but truck tires were still scrubbing so we asked why someone didn't call since that was the reason we took it there, they weren't concerned about the quality of the work or did it solve the problem they just took the money. This was the first and last time we will ever use them. There expertise should've been used and should've reached out to us and have customer service and just plain sense but all they could see was money. What about fixing the problem and all they could tell us was "we did what you asked", what great regard for customers

resp.text: We’re very sorry that you feel like you had a bad experience. We strive to have good customer service. Give us a call Monday morning or if you’d like, we can call you and we will do what we can to change your experience.

name: Majyst Thalsbane
text: The service was great. I replaced all tje suspension components on my car o er the weekend. I came in and wanted a performance alignment specific to my car and suspension setup. They were able to get extremely close to the measurements, which is normal as all cars are not capable of achieving the perfect requirements. The technician that worked on my car "fixed" a few issues from the work and informed me of the issues. This was a free set of extra eyes. The price was reasonable for the work performed, they basically had to 4 wheel align twice because of the extensive work done to the suspension.  I definately recommend Performance Auto Repair. I will be bringing my other project cars here for similar service.

name: Brian Barth
text: Aaron and staff are great to deal with. Always take our company trucks there and are very pleased with their service. Anything we ask for they always are there for us. Thank you guys!

resp.text: Mr. Barth, Thank you for the review. It is our pleasure taking care of ALL of your fleet maintenance needs.

name: Troy Brown
text: Cant fix foriegn cars

resp.text: Mr. Brown, we are sorry that you did not have a 5 Star experience with Performance Auto Repair. You can give us a call at 334-260-3582 and we will try to help in any way we can.

name: Thomas Davis
text: Had a bad experience was going to work when my box truck lost electrical power and went dead Lawrence Robinson service advisor said it will be $640.00 to fix it was a month for them to call and say it was the alternator and called back saying that thay was trying to crank it and even trying starting fluids which is not good for diesels now truck needs a starter and flywheel that it will $2,500.00 it cost me $640.00 to get my truck back not fixed now i have more problems than i started with

name: Jack Harrington
text: At times my pickup would misfire and lose power. After reading my Nissan check engine light code, Performance Auto Repair replaced the catalytic converter. The check engine light was not on and the truck had a lot more power. However, the truck continued to occasionally misfire and start loosing power. This would last from 1 minute to several minutes before resuming with good power. Without any engine codes indicating the issue, they continued to search for the problem.  The pickup is now repaired and I can't remember when it has run so well. The total cost of repair was most reasonable for what they did.  Thank you Performance and especially Lawrence!  I will be using them for future repairs/service. I will recommend to friends.

name: atcarter75
text: Greated at the door immediately, and the staff had expert advice.

resp.text: Thank you, we're here to help if we can.

name: Bob Atchison
text:
Prior to my recent visits I’d never used this business.  When I walked in I was greeted by no less than two people.

Zack greeted me and asked how he could help.  From that point forward he was very accommodating and helpful.  He would pull the products up on the computer that I was interested in and show me what they looked like on the vehile.  He made excellent suggestions and made it easy to get just what I needed.

The prices were good and the service excellent.  I would highly reccomend Proformance Auto Repair.  Ask for Zack and you’ll be sure to receive excellent service.

Bob

name: Jamie Jamison
text: I have dealt with mostly Lawrence. He is one of the most concerned, considerate and professional sales and service providers at performance.  I would highly recommended this company to anyone. Especially military.  I am retired military to include law enforcement. This is a great company.  Keep up the grand work.

name: Michael Britton
text: These guys take care of my work beast. No matter the repair or maintenance issue. I’m in and out with little to no interruption of my work day. This place rocks. I was allowing Gipson’s to do my service work. I will never allow that to happen as long as Performance is open for business.

resp.text: Mr. Britton, thank you for the review and for your business. It is an honor to take care of your vehicle and at Performance Auto Repair we take pride in doing so in a timely manner and for a fair price.

name: Terrence Coleman (tcoleman701)
text: Was having problems getting my Putco Switchblade Tailgate Bar installed at other places (the dreaded "we only service or install what we sell" spill). However, the guys at Performance Auto were more than willing to install it and my Tailgate Assist on my 2016 Ram 1500 without hesitation and they performed an excellent job! I made sure to get a business card because I most definitely will be a regular customer! Awesome group of guys! Highly recommend for all of your auto needs!

name: Whitney Banks
text: Remember the $400 your company took from me by the second visit for one wheel bearing? Well, I’m being told that the bearing is still bad.

resp.text: Ms. Banks, we strive to perform quality work and make sure that our customers are happy. If one of the wheel bearings that we replaced back in 2017 is bad, it could possibly still be under warranty. Give us a call at (334) 245-6600 and we will gladly set up an appointment for you to come in and we will check it out for you.

name: Rob Rance
text: I strongly recommend this place.  You can find what you want for your truck at reasonable prices with great service.  Their auto technicians are qualified and skilled.  They do both car repair and truck repair which I didn't know till I visited.

name: Tina Stanley
text: My family takes all of our automobiles to Performance Truck & Automotive.  The staff there is very professional, courteous and friendly.  They  always provide quick and great service.  They go out of their way to provide excellent customer service.

name: Audrae Mayo
text:
My boyfriend and I traveled from Kansas City to Montgomery, AL for a business trip last Friday and Saturday.  Unexpectedly, our front brakes went bad, really fast.  I found them by Google, took it in without an appointment on Saturday morning and was done and out within 1.5 hours.  Very friendly and professional.  I did not feel like they were taking advantage of "out-of-town, desperate" travelers.
Lawrence was very helpful, courteous and genuine!!!!  I even received a follow-up call to make sure everything was good and that we made it home safely.  THANK YOU!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

name: S D Butcher (AdventureFamilyInMotion)
text: AWESOME work! Wonderful staff! We looked at the local reviews online before choosing Performance Truck and Automotive Repair and their reputation is legit! Fast, precise, and friendly! There is even a toy chest with toys for kids to play with! I will be back!!! Thank you for your work!

text: Just got brand new tires on my 13 Jeep JKU. The guys here did an amazing job, correctly on the first time. Ill definitely be coming back for any more work done to my vehicles.

They communicate clearly my vehicle repair needs, offer fair pricing and the best part is they pick up my vehicle and bring it back when they are done.

Thanks for the help.
J. Chapman
