text: I have been very impressed with Performance Truck.  They know a lot about fixing cars and work on them till the job is finished.  Their customer service is excellent and everyone that I have met there is friendly and nice.  Great folks!

name: Joshua Fields
text: Go to vendor for just about everything including light body work. Can't speak highly enough of the service. Would recommend to anyone. I take my personal vehicles and all of my fleet vehicles over.

name: Mike Dean
text: I sat in the lobby for an hour and a half before they told me that they didn't have my size tire and that they should be here any moment. Could have told me a lot sooner. Poor customer service. Will not go back. UPDATED!! I received a call from Lawrence shortly after posting my review. He apologized and was very swift in taking care of me for my inconvenience. That is how you manage your business. They will continue to get my business. Highly recommended! Thanks Lawrence.

name: Venessa Menefee
text: My experience at Performance was superb! The people were very professional, knowlegable and courteous. I trust their work and opinion when it comes to my vehicle. I will come back when I am in need of any type of service on my vehicle.

name: Bonnie L Temple
text: Large regular maintenance time in Santa Fe.  Kept me informed and gave me estimate.  Enjoyable conversation with young man waiting.  Overall pleasant.

name: Dave Ely
text: My Subaru broke down on interstate 65 and AAA had my car towed to this shop.  After a 3 hrs wait for the AAA truck Lawrence saved the remainder of the day.  We had discussed by phone that my fan belt had broken; he took my vehicle information, ordered the part and had it delivered as we waited to arrive.  When we finally got to the shop they recommended a couple of near by restaurants and offered us a ride.  While eating they called to tell me the idler pulley seized and needed replacement.  We returned from lunch and with about 20 more minutes the car was ready to go.  I'd certainly return to this shop for repair work.

name: Lamon Logue
text: Outstanding service !! I was traveling through Montgomery Alabama and my fuel line busted. I almost made it to their shop breaking down just a block away. The service men where very courteous and made arrangements to get my truckto the shop. The rrepair was a difficult one due to the location of the line.They were extremely nice offering me and my girlfriend cold water on this hot summer day even arranged for us to get lunch. For me this is business done right. I wish they were local to me.

name: amanda smith
text: Lawrence, Aaron, and their team at Performance Auto Repair took an unfortunate situation and provided excellent service.

resp.text: Ms. Smith, I’m sorry for any inconvenience. Please email me at aaron11sprayberry@gmail.com and I will send you my phone number or you can email me your phone number so we can try to get this situation fixed ASAP.

name: Bob Wingenfield
text: I have used PTAR for more than 10 years for  my company and private vehicles for tires, periodic maintenance, as well as auto repair.  The staff is courteous and the mechanics treat your vehicle as if it was their own.  When service is required, a simple phone call will get your vehicle picked up, serviced and returned.   Service like that is hard to find these days.  Absolutely five stars for PTAR.

name: seyth smith
text:
Great service
Straight forward and was very pleased with the outcome of the work preformed

name: Rhonda Miller
text: I have a 2010 Silverado. Zach and the guys did an outstanding job on my truck. This is the second truck that I've had a lift installed by PTC. I didn't have the opportunity to meet the technician that installed the lift but none the less his work was flawless. I'm extremely happy with the looks and function of my truck. Thanks Zach.....

name: Raymond Head
text: The service and repair to my truck was done very proficiently. There was a problem after I got my tuck returned to me. When I took the truck back the problem was very quickly repaired and the staff was completely apologetic and helpful in supporting my schedule.

text: Not friendly, everything I've tried to get there they have to order, expensive

name: Joe Pettis
text: I started going to them when I had a tow hitch put on my Saturn Vue, many years ago.  When the warranty ran out on my newer vehicle I noticed they had moved and started using them for a hitch on my current vehicle, oil changes and tire changes or any of my other automotive needs.  I am moving to NC and one thing I will regret is having to go through the hassle of finding another honest mechanic shop to service my automotive maintenance needs.  Great people, honest service.  Need I say more !!!!!!!  hey, they had breakfast the Tuesday I got my oil change and yesterday the coffee was good while they fixed a leaking tire.  Just a small screw in it.   But hey, it's fixed now.

name: colvin conway
text: I work for csx and they do a great job on our hi-rail vehicles, and all other maintenance.

name: Robert Jenkins
text: Front desk people are helpful and happy. Didn't want to pay for new rotors but they assured me it was time. I trust them so I went with it.

name: Joshua Carmichael
text: Performance Truck has always taking good care of our work truck and has made sure they do it right and fast so that they don't take up to much of our work day, so we can keep moving forward..Thanks, from the Ewing Team out of Montgomery

name: Camacho Family
text: These people really know what their doing and they are fair.  They told me up front what it would cost to get the job done.   Instead of cashing in, they explained that my truck was worth a whole lot less than the cost of the repairs.  Of course I did the google thing and started to research all they had told me was wrong with it.  Comparing Ebay prices and the average cost of labor in my area, and the book value of my car.  They were right.  The repairs would have cost more than the truck was worth. They saved me from the money pit that was my car.  I will be returning with all of my car maintenence and will highly recommend their team to anyone needing a honest mechanic.

name: Blackqueen70
text: My name is Tammera. PTC has performed nothing but exceptional service on my suv. I highly recommend them to everybody!

text: They got my jeep up and running in no time, excellent service. I will definately be back. I had someone else look at it and they referred me to them.

Second service trip to PTC for repairs to my 3500 Dually; brakes this time.  Lawrence and I worked out what I needed to upgrade the performance for the heavy trailer I tow and came up with a perfect system.  Yes it was much more than most brake jobs but I wanted something that would last as well perform under towing conditions.

I was referred to PTC from fellow RVer and have been very happy with the quality of service and professionalism I receive from all the staff.  They are pros compared to the Chevy/GMC dealers I have dealt with over the years.

Because of their great service and quality I trust no others with the maintenance of my home hauler.

name: phil lindley
text: I used to only drive big name brand tires$$$, which were usually put on at Sam's or Costo. After an issue with one of the $$$ tires purchased, I found out they are not a typical stock item and I'd have to wait for several days. Since I needed it repaired immediately, I drove directly to Pete Shirley and told them to get close on the orginal tires ratings (speed/trac/hardness) with something they normally stock and replace all 4. Not only did they drive the same,  they were significantly cheaper than the big name brands. The biggest plus, I was back on the road in about an hour. I've waited over 4hours at some places in the past. Since, I've replaced tires on my other 4 vehicles using Pete Shirley. Asked them to put on something they normally stocked on these 4 vehicles, and all road out great, and in and out of the store in a timely manner. They also don't sell the gimmicky road side warranty. But I'd bet they'd do all they could to help you out if something happens outside of the tires warranty.

name: e douglas pratt
text:
Friday January 17 and Saturday the 18th, 2020, Michael and Jonathan at the Oxford, Alabama Firestone store exceeded my expectations . I was traveling from Atlanta to Birmingham when my tire light went on. I made it on my run-flat to their store. They showed me the irreparable damage and found a tire in Birmingham. It would be delivered Saturday; but the Saturday delivery failed to bring that tire. Instead of waiting til Monday, Michael and Jon immediately offered to get the tire from Birmingham themselves. Jonathan made the trip and I was driving safely away later Saturday afternoon. Michael, Jonathan, and their Oxford, Alabama team make Firestone look very good. Please give them a substantial raise. If that's not immediately forthcoming, please embarrass them with lavish praise at your next regional meeting.

Dr. E. Douglas Pratt
Atlanta, Georgia

resp.text: Hi, E Douglas. Wow! We are so thrilled to hear that your recent visit was superior to satisfactory. Vehicles are our passion, but you really are our priority. We appreciate you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We look forward to working with you again, and thank you for choosing Firestone! ^Mariah

name: Deborah Waddell
text:
While the price for my tires and oil change were less than quoted, I do have some complaints: the employee did NOT do requested alignment
he tried talking me into "Fuel System Cleaning" & Renu Fuel System
Cleaner" ($89.99 & $9.99) which I just had done 2 wks prior at my
dealer)
DID NOT cold pressure balance my tires (from the photo of my dash PSI
info: LF 39 RF 39; LR 38 RR 43--what the heck??); on 2009 Chev HHR LS recommended PSI is 30-32 for 15s, 16s respectively. While it won't necessarily affect mileage that much for minor variations, it will affect the wear and tear.
It makes me mad when MEN in the automotive industry think they can pull things over on women. LADIES BE AWARE.
It pays to be an informed consumer and to listen, and if they are slick salesmen like the one serving me, listen twice as hard because he made me think that the alignment check was the alignment being done. Shame shame shame.

** This happened at the Oxford Quintard Mall location but it won't let me put my review on their page.

name: Heath King
text: The guys over at Express Oil in Muscle Shoals are unbelievable.  Lots of drive up oil change places have a faded old sign hanging up that lists their free 200 point inspection, but you end up leaving with no low fluid levels, a stripped oil plug, and nothing more said about the condition of your vehicle than "it's full of oil." Not these guys, they are in a league by themselves. They do great work, they are knowledgeable,  friendly, reliable and most important, Honest! Best of all they have another shop on site with techs that can do a wide range of repairs and diagnostics. Plainly put, you can rest assured that you, your wife, your teenager, etc will drive off with a well-serviced vehicle, Every Time!!

name: Mary Hall
text: I usually use a different service, but they were very backed up so I drove down the road just to have my tires checked because my TP light came on. The gentleman looked at my low tire for about 30 seconds and told me there was a nail and because of where it was on the tire they wouldn’t be able to patch it and I needed a whole new tire. Also that the tread on all my tires was getting low so I needed a whole new set. The set he tried to sell me was almost $1,000. Luckily I had my dog in the back seat, so I had a good excuse to get out of there and tell them I’d come back later. I don’t know a whole lot about cars, but I know when my tire tread looks low and I’ve got at least until the end of this year or the beginning of next before I’ll need new tires. And as for the one with the nail, my cousin patched it and I’ve driven to Birmingham and back on it with no problem at all. Seems like to me they saw a single woman and assumed I wouldn’t have any sort of knowledge and tried to take advantage.

resp.text: Hi Mary. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

text: I've been going to Express Oil Change for about 2 years to get my oil changed. Recently, my car decided to break down pretty close to these guys. Coffee, a notebook and some small car part (not even sure what it was) were left in my car, none of which were mine, all of which I threw away. I'm glad I had nothing valuable in my car if their workers are this unprofessional. I WILL NOT be going back. Go somewhere else. This place is not worth your time or anyone else's.

name: Tom King
text: I gave my service experience a one star because there was no way to make it a zero star. I went in to get oil change and a get a quote on new master cylinder for my son's car. My son had a free oil change card that his mother gave him.  This his first oil change of his first car I bought him last year. He's had the card for over a year and it has no expiration date on it. The service tech "manager" said he didn't think the card was still good. Again, it had no expiration date on it. He said well it should've been signed by manager, though there's no place for it to be signed by a manager. The "manage" said well anyone could've just picked it up and put the date on it and brought it back.  I said I didn't do that nor did my son or his mother. I told him I didn't appreciate being accused of stealing a free oil change card. He said two other people did that yesterday. I said that is not my fault nor an excuse to accuse me of doing the same thing. He could not understand what he had done over a $34.95 oil change. He called the owner and the owner said the card fine, of course. He did not apologize for accusing me of stealing the free oil change card. He said he had to make sure it was ok or it would come out of his paycheck. Again, no reason to ever utter someone could have just picked one up and brought it in unsigned. All he had to say is he had to call his owner to see how to process the card not accuse me of possibly stealing it. With that lack of ability to understand the damage to the customer for your handling of this made me question giving someone like that the responsibility to work on the brakes on my son's car. So, I took my free oil change card from his fingertips and told the inexperienced "manager" that I'd take my business elsewhere. As I left he said the free oil change card was "null and void". He just had to be right. He would not listen to the customer who was getting ready to pay $559 for work plus and extra $36 for the full synthetic oil change. Hint empathy people. I only do business with people I like period and though I just met this guy he gave me reason not to like him in under 10 minutes. I had never been in a Meineke in my life until today and will never do so again. Thanks to this manager at the South Huntsville shop. I wonder if this is the intent of the Meineke representative who gave this card to my son's mother?

resp.text: Hi Tom, this should never be the impression we leave. Far from it; you should always expect the best from Meineke. We are sharing your feedback and we are continuing to focus on customer service. If you have any other questions or concerns, you can contact us by visiting www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/

name: Jason Hughes
text:
Jaye at the front desk was very professional and courteous and the service was awsome so far, however I was charged 4 hours labor and it only took 2.. At over 100$ an hour labor, I had over 200 dollars stolen from me where service's were not performed... I have dealt with the public for a lot of years and in no way would my conscience allow me to do this to  my customers and then
try to  justify it by saying my computer says I have to.... This was my first and last time visiting Meineke...

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Jason. Our car care professionals are all about building trust and confidence. text: The service and this branch location was impeccable. Hunter the manager & my tech specialist Isaac were professional courteous and really went the extra mile to ensure that I was satisfied. They have definitely gained my business and I would personally recommend this location!

name: Ryan Davenport
text: I brought my car in for a radiator replacement due to a leaking radiator, what I got was a new radiator and a slew of problems. First issue was my skid plate was not reinstalled under the engine. The store manager told me that it probably fell off when I was driving and I didn't notice. They were able to replace that at no cost to me. Secondly, screws were missing and clips weren't reinstalled. The manager assured me they would be replaced, and they were. Lastly the radiator was mounted improperly (very wobbly, almost hitting the engine). This was initially resolved with plastic zip ties and told by the manager that it was repaired and I was good to go. Obviously this was unacceptable at an initial service fee of $105/hr. They did end up properly mounting the radiator but only after I noticed the "shade tree mechanic" level of work.

resp.text: This is definitely not the experience you should expect from Meineke, Ryan. We pride ourselves on expert craftsmanship and professionalism. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Tia! The safety of our customers and team members is always our first priority, and we are taking steps to protect the health and well-being of our team and customers. We have implemented a number of precautions based on the advice of the Centers for Disease Control, The World Health Organization and other health authorities to minimize the risk of transmission of COVID-19 for both team members and customers alike. You can continue to expect the same great level of service from us!

name: Alex Sims
text: Brought my car that was occasionally stalling out to get diagnosed and fixed up. They found the issue and fixed it. After a few hours, the work was done and they said they test drove my car to make sure it was working properly. I picked my car up right before they closed tonight and went on my way. Within 2 minutes, my car died in the middle of the street. The bumping and RPM fluctuations progressively got worse, and by the time i was able to get off the road, the car would only coast in drive. If i put any gas to the pedal, it dies. If they test drove my car, they would have known they made the problem WORSE. I am absolutely infuriated and I will be there first thing in the morning to settle this issue.

resp.text: We understand your concerns, Alex. We want to make sure we are doing car care right. We are escalating your concerns internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to regain your trust and confidence.

name: Kathleen Mason
text: My radiator was leaking and I was having a hard time finding a place to fix it. They diagnosed it quickly and got a new radiator in the next morning (I first arrived 2 hours before close) and my car was fixed up before lunch the next day. They also did an oil change, replaced a filter, and looked at my tires. They had a shuttle also. Overall I was impressed.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Kathleen! We're glad to hear you had an easy and seamless experience. We're here to take all the stress out of auto services.

name: Robert Terry
text:
Absolutely stay away from this location. Do not trust them to perform a simple oil change. When you are charged for an oil filter that is not installed, it is called fraud. When you refuse to stand behind your work, You are not reputable. If you expect them to return your calls, you will be waiting till the cows come home.

Update-  Local store representative indicated "Corporate" would reimburse me for damage to oil cap housing.  "Corporate" called indicating any damages are the responsibility of the "Franchisee".  Once again, each is passing the buck but the customer gets hosed.  If the Franchisee is using the name "Meineke",  Corporate should be taking  more responsive action.  If you proclaim that you are customer oriented and responsive, just do the right thing and pay for the parts charged but not installed and the damage you caused.

resp.text: Meineke is all about trust, professionalism, and expertise. We're disappointed to hear you did not feel we lived up to this standard, Robert. We are escalating your feedback internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

name: Bob Hatech
text: Andy and the team were efficient and friendly. My tires are rotated and oil changed correctly and at a good value to boot.

resp.text: We love to hear about experiences like yours, Bob. Thanks for shouting out Andy and his team. We're all about being the best in customer service and doing car care right. We're glad to hear you and your vehicle were taken care of!

name: Jd Carroll
text: The professionals at Meineke are wonderful technicians. Every time I have a problem with my vehicle they are always there to help. Management is super nice and inviting and they always do a full inspection and let me know if there are other small issues and lay out good solutions while also giving me the option and not forcing a sale like other companies. I would highly recommend them for all your auto care needs.

resp.text: We pride ourselves on not just having the best car care professionals, but the best people. Thank you for recognizing our excellent team, Jd. We really appreciate the feedback and the review!

name: Sonny Norville
text: Had an exhaust leak and they replaced pipes and repaired as necessary. Excellent service and prices. Really like the guys!

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Sonny! We're glad you had a good experience and came away happy with your car.

name: Steve Kirkpatrick
text: Took my truck in for air conditioning service recharge,  I had replaced the heater core, radiator, and all the assorted hoses, but the A/C needed complete  Servicing is it had been emptied. Store manager had quit recently and the district manager, Joe, was on site and had my trunk checked out only to find a faulty AC line that needed replacing before they could service my air conditioning system. They did all this at no charge. They could've just took my money and not fixed it, but I found the professionalism quite refreshing.

resp.text: We love to hear about experiences like yours, Steve. We're all about being the best in customer service and doing car care right. We're glad to hear you and your vehicle were taken care of!

name: Incog Nito
text: The people from the front desk to the mechanics were extremely knowledgeable and very polite and respectful. They were very fair in their pricing and took care of my problems very quickly. I'm very happy and recommend this to anyone.

resp.text: Hi there, thanks for the review. We pride ourselves on not just having the best car care professionals, but the best people. Thank you for recognizing our excellent team. We really appreciate the feedback and the review!

name: Michael Bass
text: It was a great experience the techs and the Manager there were very informative, knowledgeable and professional. The pricing was a bit of a tuff pill to swallow but they did a fantastic job and gave me a detailed inspection Of what else needs attention further down the road. Thanks guys for the outstanding work.

resp.text: We pride ourselves on not just having the best car care professionals, but the best people. Thank you for recognizing our excellent team, Michael. We really appreciate the feedback and the review!

name: Anthony
text: Staff took the time to explain everything in detail in a manner that anyone could understand. I appreciated being show what was wrong with my vehicle rather than just being told. It did take about 1.5 hours for an oil change, which I feel is quite longer than I expected or desired, but I am satisfied with the results

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Anthony! We're glad to hear you had a good experience with us. If you ever need auto services in the future, we hope you return so we can provide a 5-star experience.

text: Great experience in all aspects! Well keep going back and recommend!!

text: Great hospitality and service. As a college student, car maintenance can be a struggle, but I needed a lot of work done to my car. Specifically, I believe it was John and Justin who worked with me and my Dad. They threw in a few free services for us. Thank you!

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback! Thanks for shouting out John and Justin. We're all about getting car care right the first time and are proud to be locally owned and operated. You can depend on us!

Wonderful customer service for an extended repair process. Just had to get some seals in the transmission of my car replaced for a pretty penny, but the customer service and the transparency of Meineke made the process much more bearable.
They contacted me on a regular basis to tell me how the repairs were going and made sure to obtain my permission and input for additional repairs that cropped up during the repair process. Definitely will be using Meineke again for vehicle maintenance and repair.

resp.text: Keeping our customers fully informed throughout their visit is of the utmost importance to our team, Alexander, so we're glad you appreciated all of our updates. We appreciate your support on Google, and it's great to hear that this has earned your trust and future business!

resp.text: From start to finish, our goal is to provide our customers with a positive experience, so we're overjoyed to receive this feedback, Edwin! Thank you for sharing your recommendation, and please feel free to reach out any time we can be of assistance.

text: Thad was very nice and professional. Him and his staff did a great job. The facility was super clean and organized. Overall I had a great experience.

name: Christine Black
text: Out of state resident. Had an exhaust problem, thought could have cost me a fortune. I'm a girl with a Michigan plate. And they didn't take advantage of me. Huge props! Thad was the best! Oil change a little high, but that's what I get for running with synthetic oil. If ever a problem again, I'll be Back! Thanks Meineke. You Rock.

text: Usually do all my own maintenance, but due to time and weather chose to give these guys a try based on good recommendations. Those good recommendations were well deserved in my opinion. These guys were competent, professional, and the service was a good value IMO. I will go there again.

resp.text: We greatly appreciate you sharing your positive experience! Our team works diligently to provide five-star service, and we hope you'll keep us in mind for anything your vehicle may need in the future.

text: They fixed my front brakes quickly and at a great price.  This was my first time using Meineke and I was very impressed from start to finish. Curt was very courteous. I will definitely be back here in the future! Thank you

text:
Came in about 5 in the afternoon for brakes issues. They checked the brakes for free gave me a killer estimate and got the job done in about 2 hours. They stayed past closing just for my car. The front desk person Alec was helpfully and very nice. The mechanic Andrew worked really hard and even kept me updated. Will come back because of those two.
Update. Went in for a simple oil change. Alec told me of the 20 dollar of deal and josh did the oil change. Good service again.

STAY AWAY

text: I have never had such a great mechanic help me out. I had a very busy schedule with kids and work and they worked around me with no issues no attitude. Had my car fixed in 30 min and let me and the kids hang out in the lobby and were so sweet to them too. Thank you Craig your the bomb!

text: I was pleasantly surprised that tire rotation is included with the cost of an oil change. The manager was very helpful and knowledgable and even fixed my tire for free when they found a nail in it. He also took a picture of the nail in my tire to prove it.

text: Service was awesome and staff super friendly.

text: I took my car in to the service department for a low tire. They told me I needed to have brakes put on the front and back. I trusted what they told me and decided to have them service my car. After paying them $800 for the new brakes 2 months ago! Do not trust them!!!

text: Highly recommend! They were extremely informative and helpful during my transmission and clutch replacement.

text: This location is very close to us and the service rep took care of our needs quickly and the service was done in a prompt manner.

text: They work with you and that is what separates them from the rest.

We really appreciate your kind words and will be sure to share it with our team. Whenever you need us, we're here to support!

name: Melissa Thompson
text: I was service with promptness & a smile got down to the problem with my vehicle!

name: Richard Bruce
text: I have used this Meineke many times in the past 9 months.  I travel with my job and always would stop at this location when I needed an oil change, battery, wiper blades and much much more.  The last time I was there the technician scared me in to spending over $800 in repairs that have never  been an issue before on a car that I bought new couple years ago.  I thought I would try them again, I just called for a quote on breaks, I explained all I needed was break shoes, and would like a  quote.  The man I was talking to told me to bring it in.  Again I said I just need a quote, he told me he could not give me a quote with out bringing it in for inspection.  I will never use Meineke again, that is how they lure you in, you take your car/truck there for something and before you leave they scare you to death saying something else is life or death.  I just wanted a quote on brakes..... Needless to say Budget Brakes (2 doors down from Meineke) was glad to give me a quote and has now put the breaks on my Nissan Altima.  BEWARE IF YOU GO TO MEINEKE, THEY WILL TRY TO SCARE YOU INTO SPENDING WAY MORE THAN YOU NEED TO SPEND.

resp.text: Earning the trust of our customers is paramount to our team, Richard, which is why it's so disappointing to learn you feel this way. Your concerns are very important to us, and we're saddened to know this experience has jeopardized your future loyalty. Please allow us to allay your concerns by contacting our Customer Service team at 800-447-3070. Thank you.

name: Monicka Lemon
text: This is the first time that I came to this particular location. Over the phone we talked about a full synthetic oil change but when I went to pay, they just did a basic oil change and didn't put the next service sticker on the windshield. I probably won't go back to this location.

name: Ken Stone
text: Great customer service good quality work.

name: Cara Besch

Never again.

Almost 2 hours for an oil change when you are the only the only customer there.

I’ll give them credit for comping the service for me, but didn’t appreciate them saying it was because the wrong part was delivered, when I heard them order the filter for the wrong model vehicle and also never communicating that there would be a delay because they didn’t have the correct filter in stock.

Also, so much drama.

text: These mechanics are very poor. Probably decent people, but I had numerous problems after getting some work done. Wasted a lot of time taking my car back to them, and never got the issues completely resolved. I'd call corporate, but I honestly just dont want to spend more time on this nonsense. My vehicle is getting worked on elsewhere.

name: Judy Waldrep
text: thanks Steve. great job. thanks for helping keep our granddaughter safe in her 2011 Toyota Corolla.

name: Angela Patterson
text: I arrived promptly at my appointment time of 8:30am. I didn't leave until 11:44am. Over 3 hours for an oil change and rear brakes. Absolutely unacceptable.

name: Louise Pajak
text: Everyone was very nice and said hello. Also explained where the refreshments were. Recommend. If you need/used car speech to George Jones, he's very nice.

name: Michelle Chestnut
text: I was there for an interview. Some people were a little " dry " and seemed too busy to bother with me. I felt out of place so I didn't even do the interview. Maybe if I was a customer I'd have been less of a problem for the desk guy  walking through the door. I saw a lot of people just relaxing on the phone up front so it seemed the ones in the back and outside were actually working. So see for yourself how you like it this is just my 1st and more than likely last experience at this place.

name: David Wydner
text: The guys did a great job getting my Tacoma in and out. Barely had time to get comfortable in the waiting area.

name: Bobby Hankins
text: Real great service department

name: austin grace
text: Just bought a Tacoma With Zak Stidham, it was an awesome experience!

name: Joel Banyai
text: In the past few months I've had work done and sent multiple friends to this shop. They've fixed cars other shops won't touch (or messed up), and saved my friends and I a ton of money. We all know warranty work doesn't pay the bills, but when an alternator they had rebuilt and installed failed, they had a new alternator swapped in the next morning. On another repair they offered a good used part they had on hand for much cheaper instead of charging for a brand new part. Another car had a strange symptom; they correctly diagnosed two cascading failures up the line and fixed everything. If a repair isn't going to be cost effective, they'll tell you that too.  I'm extremely pleased. You won't go wrong going here.

name: Lisa P
text: Quick service. Great price.

name: Jane Knauss
text: Very nice and knowledgeable. Quick turnaround and reasonable prices. Highly recommend!

name: Alexandria Haley
text: This man does an amazing job with rewiring...

name: Ikram Singh
text:
I think they did a pretty decent/good job on my windshield wipers and front window rotor. Had the car ready the very next day. The guy is a PROFESSIONAL but I think I was OVERLY CHARGED !!
If it was not for the HIGH CHARGE I would definitely visit this place again.

resp.text: We appreciate your business and we believe our prices are very competitive.

name: Josh Knowling
text: I recently took my truck to Russell Brothers with a tricky electrical issue that had persisted despite previous mechanic's best efforts.  I was skeptical at first that a solution would be reached.  Initially, Russell Brothers did fail in their first attempt at correcting it, despite having replaced expensive components.  However, after a couple of return trips, their persistence paid off and they expertly diagnosed and ultimately corrected the issue for good.  I would like to thank technician 'Jim' in particular in showing great integrity, reaching out to me when he knew the issue was not correctly repaired.  Will used their service again in the future, as well as recommend it to others. Thanks fellas!

resp.text: Thank you Josh! We truly appreciate you taking the time for the awesome review!

name: jdblackbelt
text: I have been bringing my vehicles here for service and maintenance for 10 years now. They regularly charge me half what the dealership has quoted me for the same job. They're always busy (as people have caught on they do phenomenal work for fair prices), so sometimes you'll have to wait an extra day for your vehicle, but you'll always save money. Jim and Robbie have always taken care of me, know me by name, and only recommend repairs and maintenance on what's necessary. There's a reason they've been in business since the 70's. Can't recommend them highly enough.

resp.text: That is so very special that you that the time to write such a wonderful review. We appreciate you taking your time to give us such a kind and thoughtful review. Sincerely, thanks so very much!

name: Elizabeth Henson
text: Easy to schedule with, did the work for what they said it would be, and what they said it would be was MUCH less than the dealership quoted.  This is the second time we've had work done there and they've got our business if we need something else done.

name: alicia perez
text: Best place to get my truck fixed. I took my truck in at approximately 12:30 and they were done by 3:00. Excellent prices, friendly guys, really smart. They know what they are doing and are honest to their prices. They are awesome all around. We will continue to keep taking our vehicles there.

resp.text: Thanks so much!!!

name: Jake Self
text: Had to return a few times but they was kinda working me in I still recommend them. Let me clarify this statement instead of changing it. When I say return a few times I mean too fix several problems. Only once was something unfinished properly on my alternator/battery, and had to have it towed back. No extra charge but I did feel that they should've covered the TOW TAG.😂😂😭👌🤘👍✌️

name: Robert Robb
text: Charged me $400 to fix a bad wire going to the AC clutch (no parts).  At $85/hour that means it took them almost 5 hrs to fix.  I had looked at the problem before I brought the car in and had narrowed it down to the AC clutch so I asked when i pick it up if it was on the ground or power side.  He wouldn't tell me .  When I looked under the car I could see where they used a wire jumper like whats used for connecting trailer lights to connect to another ground wire that must have been good.  I had expected 2 to 3 hundred but with the mechanic refusing to answer a simple question left me questioning.

name: Jovan Coates
text: Russell Brothers Auto is the best repair shop in this city hands down.  I have been having my vehicles serviced there for over ten years.  They have kept things running that others have said could not be fixed, or a dealership suggests that it's time to purchase another vehicle.   They work on any make and model of vehicle and can perform any type of maintenance from fluid changes, up to engine replacement.  The staff is friendly and the service top notch.  They have always had my vehicles ready the same day I drop them off.  The value cannot be beat.  They do not suggest needless services just to pad an invoice, if your car is not running or something electrical doesn't work, they will immediately get to the heart of the problem and take care of it.  They stand by their work and I will wholeheartedly recommend to anyone if you need your car repaired take it to Russell Brothers, you won't be disappointed.

resp.text: Thanks so kindly!!!

name: LiqwdE Teryx 4LE (LiqwdE)
text: So far so good. Very understanding. They helped budget my repairs into 3 visit depending on severity of problems. As long as people remember most problems can't be solved same day. Good mechanics, not miracle workers!

resp.text: Appreciate you very much. Thank you for being our customer!

name: Briana Wright
text:
If I could rate it at half a star I would. Avoid this place like the Ebola.
Though Ebola Might be easier to deal with than these clowns.
* NO Communication.
* NO Realistic estimate.
* NO Time frame for repairs to be completed.
* NO Call to authorize ordering of expensive parts.
* NO Friendly service, in fact, acted as if simple questions were a bother to answer, and indeed were NOT answered.

In the End I had my Car towed away to take to elsewhere.. where the car was fixed, and on the road the next day, for the same price as I was charged by these yahoos for ripping apart my dashboard.

name: Thomas Taylor
text:
These guys will fix those cars that no one else will even touch. They repair a Porsche Cayenne (a real PIB to fix) to a 20 year old beater that most would charge more than the car is worth.

The guy that was crabbing about his experience...., If you say "Fix it!" they will fix it. If you say tell me what is wrong and how much, then they will do that as well. BTW, it cost $$ to diagnose and this is sometimes the most expensive part of a repair. Communication is key and it goes both ways.

These guys are about the only honest ones left. They are so good that many dealers around town bring their used cars to them because their own mechanics can neither fix nor diagnose what is wrong with them. Or maybe they just don't want to get their hands dirty!
Jim and his guys will get greasy and keep you on the road!

resp.text: Kind words and much appreciated!

name: Russell Patten
text: Great repair facility. Will go back there again in future if needed. Very helpful and knowledgeable

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words and for being our customer!

name: James Bowker
text: Best place to take your car or truck. Real nice people who don't B.S you. 💘

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great review. It is very appreciated!

name: david huey

text: I asked for a quote for two sides. I was given a price. I asked if that was the price for both sides. He said yes. Later, after already doing one side, he tells me that it was the price for one side and questioned if I wanted the other side done. I said I would pay for both sides if they took care of the alignment. He said they would. I got the vehicle, immediately noticed the horrible alignment, had it inspected, and was told that the alignment was, as I suspected, terrible.

text: We've had one good experience with these folks and two bad ones. They have some skilled electrical technicians capable of figuring out difficult electrical issues. Unfortunately, the company WILL take advantage of you financiallly given the opportunity. They failed to honor a warranty on a part they replaced. Another time they overcharged for correcting an easily diagnosable connection problem in the ignition system. No parts were replaced, probably less than an hour of labor was involved, and the bill was a few hundred dollars. When I politely questioned them on the bill, the guy became agitated, tried to change the subject, explained how I was lucky they didn't charge much more to get my car back.

name: corrine Parrack
text: Had a nail in my tire but the tire would have to be replaced. Was on phone, the guy said I may need to get all new tires because of tread difference even though I had just told him my tires were only a year old. Told me tire would be their next morning. I dropped off car around 9am and was told the tire was already there! I almost waited but told them I would be back and left with my ride. Thank God I didn’t let my ride go. I returned about 2 hours later to pick up or wait in case they weren’t finished. Found out the tire was not in! Left again and finally got my tire replacement by end of day. As a business, always make sure you know what you say is true when you are dealing with your customers. Very frustrating. At checkout was not offered insurance on the tire either. Whatever. Just glad to have a new tire. Just question these people to make sure what they tell you is true. You know what they say about people that assume. Don’t assume talk to your customers. We take you at your word. Otherwise, friendly people.

resp.text: Hi corrine. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

name: JerryTeresa Vaughn
text: I'm impressed. Beyond the oil change, I needed a tune-up and a sensor repair (according to my engine light and readout). However, Jason and David suggested other things before changing the sensor - which may not be bad. In the tune up it looked as if an ignition coil was bad, which they changed. It did not solve the problem, so they took everything apart and replaced my coil - saying we will not charge you for what you do not need - nor charge you for the additional labor. They found a cracked sparkplug which caused the problem. My estimated bill of 526 ended up being 326. I expressed to them my gratitude for their integrity, along with their quality work. I'm sold on these guys and am making it my vehicle place. Thanks!

text:

name: Chad Stokes
text:
Talk about “Expect Excellence”, even Nick would be proud of these guys. They are very professional, kind, and pleasant to work with.

I had a blow out, on Friday, September 7th on I-459 while driving South @ 5:45 pm. I hit SIRI on my phone and located the closest tire store to my location and I sure am glad she steered me towards Darrin Gilliam and his team. I slowly limped my way to the store and got out at 5:55pm on Friday afternoon and Mr. Gilliam asked how he could help me. I told him I needed a tire that I just had a blow out and was traveling to Hale County and needed to get home. He checked his inventory, but did not have the tire size I needed, but went well above and beyond to find one for me. He had two other guys and himself on phones calling all around to different stores trying to locate one and I was worried about them closing the doors at 6 pm, but he stated they do not close the doors until all customers are taken care of and would not leave me stranded.

After locating a tire and having it brought there, Darrin Gilliam, Jasson Trammell and Matt Ramirez installed the tire and rim and helped me get back on the road. I have never ever been to ANY BUSINESS 5 minutes before closing time and especially on a Friday afternoon to receive great customer service like this. These gentleman stayed over with smiles on their faces just to make sure I was taken care of, regardless of the time.  While I was waiting, I did notice this location was very well organized and everyone there worked together as a team. This store definitely has their ducks in a row.

The management and workforce in this store is "bar none" the best I have ever seen. Unfortunately, I don’t live close enough to do business with this store, but I will recommend anyone in this area to make this your “go to place” for all of your automotive needs. I will check out the store in Tuscaloosa and see if their standards are as good as this store on 5036 Bond Blvd. Thanks again guys for all your professional and kind help on a short notice at quitting time on a late Friday afternoon. This store should win the store of the year award!

resp.text: Chad, thank you for taking the time to share your positive Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers experience! We appreciate your business and we’re glad we could be there to help get you back on the road safely.

text: I brought my 2010 BMW 530i in to have it serviced; might I add I’ve used them numerous times.  I’ve never had a problem with them before. Mind you the guy that helped me was very rude; I asked him what are my options and he said junk it because that’s what I have.  Fast forward twelve months later I  sold the car to a male friend; he had it towed back to Mike & Mike under his name and they replaced the battery and a few minor things for $700.  Ladies please don’t let this happen to you. This was absolutely unbelievable and I really enjoyed how quickly they use to fix my car and get it back to me.  I was truly taken advantage of and lost a good car.

text: Wow! Really great service and quality. I had a lot of things wrong with my truck including the transmission and they fixed it all in 2 days! name: Kevin Barnett
text: I recently bought a 2013 Accord from a dealership and started having transmission issues after a few weeks of owning the vehicle.  After taking it to two different dealerships with no success, Dane gave me very specific instructions to take it directly to Aamco when the vehicle had a hard shift like I was experiencing sporadically.  He said the key was to leave it running so they could correctly identify the code to fix the problem.  Last week this all took place and within 10 minutes the issue was correctly identified.  Dane is a straight shooter and very customer focused—two things I am looking for and appreciate when dealing with any business.  I highly recommend him and his team.

name: Dell Burton
text:
I own a 2004 Nissan Titan.  I felt the transmission slipping, AAMCO here in Trussville was highly referred.  Dane showed nothing but the highest level of professionalism.  He displayed a high level of expertise on diagnosing my problem.  The turnaround time was phenomenal.  The team he has in place repaired my vehicle and had me back driving within a few days. It’s been pulling strong with no slipping at all.

AAMCO in Trussville, AL out performed my highest expectations.  I highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review! It was a pleasure to take care of your vehicle repairs.. Thank you for giving me and my team the chance!

text: The team is amazing and goes above and beyond to keep you on the road and they know their stuff💪💪💪

name: Jonathan Hervey (DJ FatMack)
text: Had a transmission replaced with a warranty. 3 months later started having issues. Was asked to bring it back by 2 times. Took it with an appointment the first time no help. Took it with an appointment 2nd time it sat there almost 2 weeks nothing was done. They told me they didn't wanna replace the transmission again if there's a possibility that it could not be the problem. I needed to carry it to the dealer to verify its a transmission issue because they don't have the tools they need to verify it. But you had them when you told me you could replace the transmission at a tune of $3600. Now that you have made the money you won't honor your warranty.

resp.text: I apologize for the inconvenience however that is not at all true. When your vehicle originally came to our center it would jerk and not even move, after diagnosing the obvious transmission issue we discussed a low mile used transmission was the best option for your budget and overall goal of repair.. The original repair was done in April and has been fine until now.  You came back to center for an issue that I agreed is there however the codes being set were manufacturer codes that could not be read by our computer. My recommendation was to have a dealer scan to diag said codes to determine if in fact it was in transmission at which point it would be taken care of under your warranty.. I take a lot of pride in what we do here and would never not repair a vehicle under warranty. In fact in your case with it being a used transmission from a supplier I wouldn't be out anything to repair your transmission if that's the issue. The supplier of your transmission under the warranty would have to provide a replacement unit and compensate our shop for the issue because of there transmission falling prematurely . Again I completely understand your frustration but there is a reason for the instructions given and it certainly wasn't to not honor a warranty. It was simply to gain more information to submit a warranty claim to the supplier to replace the transmission if again it was found to be faulty.. I'm here to fix your car if you choose and I hate you see this issue that way especially after our last discussion and you was completely on board with all of this.

My Ace Plumbing Services truck started leaking transmission fluid and shifting crazy. Pulled in this shop and spoke with Dane. He had several options for me and took time explaining them all. He was very knowledgeable, understanding and sympathetic to me needing the truck that i depend on daily for my living. They did everything promised in a timely manor at a reasonable price. 100% satisfaction is hard to find .

Sent you .

name: Corey Medders
text:
Complaint Description:
Transmission did not last 5 months or 12k miles, now warranty is not being honored. In March of 2018 my transmission gave up in my truck. My family had been using Aamco Trussville since the doors opened, so obviously I would trust them with mine. In July my truck started making noise one morning, next thing I know it had locked up tight before I could even react. Could not even turn the crank with a socket and all the spark plugs out. I called Aamco in Trussvile just to make sure it couldn't be the trans they had just "rebuilt" . I was assured that there was no way a transmission failure could cause an engine to seize like that and they would be happy to price me some engine work. Being in the auto industry myself, I decided I woukd price and engine and install it myself eventually since I had another form of transportation to get me by. Well here I am in Jan. of 19, still in warranty. I have pulled my motor and behold, the transmission is locked up tight, WILL NOT TURN. Motor turns fine now that it is disconnected and has great compression on all cylinders. I contacted Aamco Trussville to tell them my situation and was fully expecting them to be gentlemen and fess up to their mistake. As soon as I mentioned it was out of the truck and I could bring it down for them to see, I was told it would not be under warranty because I pulled it. The only reason I pulled it is because we were all under the assumption (including Aamco) my motor was locked up. They are now saying they are under new management with new staff and can't take my word for someone else that was in the previous staff telling me what they did. Well, Aamco of Trussville is Aamco of Trussville.I just want my truck back. My wife is a stay at home mom and Ive been driving her only form of transportation lately. This is a strange position for both of us to be in, I understand that. But whats right is whats right. I work hard and am an honest man. I feel like I am being taken advantage of and thrown away because they have all the customers they need. I know places like this, cant stand by the product, rotate staff. Cycle continues.

name: Ray
text:
I brought my VW Routan to Trussville AAMCO after my transmission had a couple of slips.  It wasn't something that happened often, but this car is known for transmission issues once it gets high in miles; currently I'm at 167k.

Perry, the service manager, was able to take what little information I could give him about the problem, give me a basic diagnosis and ask me to drop it off so they could look at it.

I dropped it off that evening and the VERY NEXT morning he called, said he could reproduce the problem, find the faults and proposed the fix.  No surprise to me, it did require a complete service on the transmission but they were able to resolve the issue within a day and a half.  For additional peace of mind, the repair came with a warranty that's good at any AAMCO.

I can't imagine taking it to any other shop though.  These guys are friendly, fast professionals.

The car is now spinning like a top and I could not be happier with my service.

Thanks guys!
